https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is a Paybill?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Paybill is a cash collection service that allows an organization to collect money on a regular basis from their customers throughM-PESA. It is an M-PESA mode of collecting funds.
Payments are customer-initiated, and the receiving organization may have a unique identifier i.e. account number.
The customer has an official relationship with the organization to whom they are making payment and has an “account number” that helps identify the user. The customer inputs a business number (Paybill number) for the entity they are paying.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the difference between a Paybill and a Short-Term Paybill?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Paybill is a long-term product, and the applicant may use it over several years. It is used by business, institutions, and government entities and therefore a valid registration document/license is required during application.
A Short-Term Paybill is designed to be used for a period of 6 months only, to accomplish a specific project after which it will be closed. The projects may be personal, so no business registration license is required. However, the applicant must supply official documentation to prove the project's authenticity.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How long will it take to get a Paybill number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All application requests will be made through the online portal -https://m-pesaforbusiness.co.ke/applyAfter application and submission of all the required documentation on the portal, processing of the Paybill will be done within 24 hours.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Organization’s Business Number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is the Paybill number used by customers to make payments through Lipa Na M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Only the business owner or merchant, or aggregator can apply for a Paybill number.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When can I be able to extend my data bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Data extension will only occur if a new bundle is purchased before your current data bundle expires and the new bundle has a longer validity than the duration left on the bundle about to expire.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be able to extend my daily bundle with any other data bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will be able to extend their data bundle expiry by purchasing either a daily, 7 day, 30 day or 90 day bundles with the longest validity being assumed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be able to extend a data bundle with 7 day validity with any other bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes you can. 7 day, 30 day and 90 day bundles can be extended, with the longest validity being assumed. (The longest validity is the furthest expiry date).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when my data bundle expires?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Upon expiry, the resources are deleted and cannot be recovered.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What if I do not purchase a data bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The customer will be charged Ksh 4.3 per MB from their airtime if they do not purchase a data bundle or have not activated My Data Manager.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I access the Internet on my phone?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You need to set up the phone with settings and then go to the Web/Internet icon and put the Internet Web address you want to access, e.g., www.safaricom.com and select ok/go.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I know my phone is 3G enabled?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The phone will display 3G. (This is seen on the top left or right on most handsets).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How is data charged by Safaricom?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Data is charged depending on download and upload of information, i.e., it’s not time based.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Retirement of Platinum Service
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: In October 2019, when we renewed our commitment to be Simple, Transparent and Honest with our customers, we also tasked ourselves to review our products and services to harmonize customer experience and ensure that our customers were getting the best value. As part of the review process, our loyal Platinum customers will be upgraded to the All-In-One plan or the new Karibu PostPay plans with non-expiry resources, which offer more voice and data. The notification that was sent to all ourPlatinum customerswas to inform them thatPlatinum Plans will no longer be available effective August 30th 2020

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Why are you expiring Platinum Plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: TIn line with the new brand promise of being Simple, Transparent and Honest with our customers, we tasked ourselves to review our products and services to harmonize customer experience and ensure that our customers were getting the best value.As part of the review process, our loyal Platinum customers will be upgraded to theAll-In-Oneplan or the newKaribuPostPay plan with non-expiry resources, which offer more voice and data..

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What do I need to do to move to the new plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
For customers onPlatinum PostPay, on 1stSeptember 2020, we will migrate you to the No-Expiry PostPay plans. There will be no further action from our customer.
For ourPlatinum PrePay customers on auto-renew, they will also be migrated automatically toAll in One auto-renewplans.  For our customers who purchase thePlatinum product one off, they can select, theAll-In-One plans, onMySafaricom Appor by dialling*544#and selectingoption 3“Normal Data Bundle WITH EXPIRY” thenoption 1“All in One Bundle.”
All customers have the opportunity to select any other Safaricom service according to their needs.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does it mean I have to move back to PrePay if am currently on PostPay?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, you do not have to move to Prepay. You will be migrated to the new No-Expiry PostPay bundles and your account shall be moved to the new bundles effective the next bill cycle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I lose my previous resources?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: TYou shall use your platinum resources until their expiry date. At the end of month the plans will not auto renew. The new No -Expiry PostPay bundles will then take effect.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will new customers be able to join Platinum on the APP before 30th August 2020?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, New customer will not be able to join Platinum as the Plans will no longer be available after August 30th, 2020.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens to me on Karibu 1000 and 2500?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customer on Karibu 1000 and 2500 will continue to enjoy their bundle offer. You will also be able to convert your minutes to data should you require more data bundles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is eligible for the New No Expiry PostPay Plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: PostPay is open to all Safaricom PrePay customers with the exception of corporate accounts.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I sign up for the New No Expiry PostPay Plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
On mySafaricomAPP or theSafaricom website

On USSD *544#?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I purchase a bundle with my credit limit?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you can use your credit limit to buy a plan.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I accumulate Storo bonus upon purchase of PostPay Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Once on PostPay you will not accumulate Storo Bonus.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What can I use this bundle for??
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can use the bundles to make calls from Safaricom to Safaricom and Safaricom to other networks and SMS to Safaricom Subscribers and other networks. You can also surf the internet with data. The minutes can also be used for international calling to India, China, USA and Canada

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I buy the bundle more than once in a month?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. You can only buy once. You cannot have multiple subscriptions.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the bundle auto renew?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the bundle will auto renew every 1st of the month.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use the bundle for international calls?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you can use it for international calling to USA, Canada, China and India.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use my bundle for chargeable messages?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, you will not be able to use the bundled SMS to access chargeable messages

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use my bundle for Skiza or bank USSD?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the bundle cannot be used for Skiza or bank USSD you need to make a prepayment or increase your limit to cover for these charges

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I earn Bonga points if i purchase PostPay Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you will earn Bonga points when you purchase the plans.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I “Sambaza” or transfer resources (bundles and minutes)?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, you cannot transfer/Sambaza your resources.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the priority in usage?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Priority will be for resources (bundles and minutes) that expire.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I have activated Data Manager and I join PostPay?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Data Manager Service will remain active after joining PostPay

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I stop auto-renewal??
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To stop auto renew simply dial *544# and select stop auto renew. You will no longer be able to enjoy the preferential PostPay out of bundle rates. Once the bundle runs out normal data and voice rates will apply.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is M-Ledger?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-Ledger is a mobile app (currently only on android) that runs on your phone and creates powerful information for your M-PESA transactions.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does it work?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-Ledger works by searching through a Database and displaying 6 months of M-PESA history upon download of the application. This data is then compared with your existing M-PESA SMS messages.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I get messages that are already deleted?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. At the moment you can get up to 6 months of your historical data transactions. In future more may be available.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is M-Ledger secure?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. M-Ledger's data on your phone cannot be accessed by any other app. M-Ledger also has an inbuilt PIN protection feature which you can enable. Each time you open the app, you will be prompted to enter a secret PIN (Not your M-PESA PIN) that only YOU know.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is M-Ledger free?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. M-Ledger is a free service. Standard Safaricom data charges for prepay and post pay customers apply for back-up and restore services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I buy another phone?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Once you have installed M-Ledger and allowed it to back-up your data to Safaricom Cloud, your data will be automatically uploaded whenever an internet connection is available on your device. Should you purchase a new phone, you will get all your data for the last 6 month.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I view my transactions on the internet?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. If you provide an email address during M-Ledger installation, your transactions will be accessible as long as you log ontoM-Ledger.safaricom.comusing your email address.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I print my transactions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes you may access your transaction data when you log ontoM-Ledger.safaricom.comusing the email address that you provided during installation. To access this data on the website, you will require a working internet connection.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I view/share the SMS Content in M-Ledger?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, If you keep your finger pressed on a line with a transaction , M-Ledger will pop up a menu where you can , call,SMS , copy the number in the SMS. You can share the SMS either as it is or with current balance hidden.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I see there are Graphs and Charts how do these work?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Graphs are available on M-Ledger allowing you to access and represent your information based on Time, Person, Type and Top-20. Simply click on each menus and tap on the Charts icon to view your data in a graph.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will M-Ledger consume my data bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. The standard Safaricom internet/data charges for pre-pay and post-pay customers will apply when M-Ledger downloads or backs up data.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is M-Ledger a Safaricom product?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. M-Ledger is a Safaricom product

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I opt-out of having my data uploaded to Safaricom Cloud?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, simply un-check the box that requests Backup to Safaricom Cloud during installation. The option is also available within M-Ledger once installed through the settings. Please note that if you opt out of this feature, past transactions older than 6 months will not be captured should you change your phone.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I lock M-Ledger with a PIN and then forget it?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To set a PIN you will be required to provide an email address. Should you forget your PIN, it is RESET and sent to you on the email provided.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I had paid for the previous version of M-Ledger already. Do I get a refund?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Only premium users on the monthly plan, who had already paid ahead, will get a refund for the time they have not consumed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I have the previous version of M-Ledger, if I install the Safaricom version, do I lose my data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No.All that is required is that you open the old version of M-Ledger and subscribe to Premium Service (at no cost to you) and your data will be backed up if there is an internet connection. You can then uninstall the old version and install the Safaricom version and restore your data.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I send feedback about the application in case of an issue?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-Ledger has an inbuilt feedback feature which opens in your regular email account. Use this avenue to give feedback on your experience. You can contact Safaricom customer care on line 100 / 200 or through email onThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.; twitter-@safaricomltd; and on Facebook at www.facebook.com/SafaricomLtd

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I get PayBill, BuyGoods and USSD codes on M-Ledger?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. M-Ledger allows you to search for Lipa na M-PESA, , mobile banking Bank codes and PayBill numbers. Bank codes and PayBill numbers are downloaded to your device upon first initiation of the search functionality while BuyGoods numbers are searched Online

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I access the bank codes or Lipa Na M-PESA numbers on M-Ledger
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Once you download the app, click on the search icon and select the service you need. For buy goods till numbers, type in the service providers name and a list of till numbers will be displayed

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Hourly YouTube Bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a 1-hour validity YouTube bundle that the customer can use solely for purposes of accessing YouTube content on their devices. Customer will receive 1GB for Only ksh 10 valid for 1 hour.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How different is it compared to the existing YouTube packs?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The existing YouTube bundles have a validity of 24hrs, the hourly YouTube bundle will be valid for only 1 hour after purchase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I purchase the bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The bundle will be available on *544# on option 0 (not 1). Customer will select the YouTube bundle option then select the hourly pack.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the priority of the YouTube Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The hourly YouTube bundles will have the highest priority to the 24-hour packs

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What payment options are available for this product?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The customer can pay using airtime or M-PESA

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use the hourly YouTube bundle to browse other content apart from YouTube?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The bundle can only be used to watch vides on YouTube; it will not be consumed if customer accesses other data content

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I transfer / sambaza my YouTube pack?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The YouTube bundle cannot be transferred or sambaza to other MSISDNs.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Daima Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Daima Service aims at giving Safaricom subscribers an opportunityto extend their line’s lifecycle for a duration of timeunder the available options.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is the Service available to all customers?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This Service is only available to Individual Prepay customers (Exempted- M-PESA tills, Corporates and Postpay).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does one activate or deactivate the Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *100*4#OK and follow prompts or via My Safaricom App or Safaricom website or call 100 for assistance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will there be a refund if one deactivates the service before the due date or does a wrong subscription?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Refunds are not allowed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many subscriptions can one have?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A customer can only have one service subscription at a time.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the charges for Daima Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Each of the above options will give the customer 20 Minutes + 20 SMS monthly during the entire subscription period

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the offer’s validity for Daima Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Validity of service will be 6 months ,1 year or 2 years. However, the monthly awarded resources expire after 30 days. The customer is also notified via SMS to renew or purchase a new subscription when the current one lapses.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when my subscription ends?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The line becomes inactive and can be disconnected for failure to top up.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check my balance?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To check balance, customers will send the word BAL to 144.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can the resources be used for off-net Calls and SMS?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. You can use the resources to make local off-net calls and send off-net SMS. The resources cannot be used to make international calls or roaming.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can one purchase Daima Service for another number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. A customer can purchase Daima service for another number via USSD *100*4# >Daima, select Buy for Other option or via My Safaricom App or Safaricom website.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can one purchase Daima Service via Bonga points?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. As long as the Bonga points are enough to complete the purchase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can one purchase Daima Service if there is an outstanding Okoa Jahazi debt?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. You will be prompted to pay the outstanding Okoa Jahazi debt first then proceed with the purchase via M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can one use Fuliza to purchase Daima Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. A customer needs to be registered on M-PESA with an active Safaricom M-PESA line and have a Fuliza limit to enjoy the service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I accumulate any Storo bonus after purchase?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. A customer will accumulate Storo bonus once they purchase Daima Service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can one sambaza the resources?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You cannot sambaza the Minutes and SMS.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I access Customer Care services while roaming?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Simply use Zuri chat on the roaming websitehttps://roaming.safaricom.co.ke/to contact Safaricom customer care or dial the Prepay Customer care number via +254 722 002 100.You will be charged the applicable rate indicated in the tariff schedule i.e. the rate applicable to calls made back home (to Safaricom).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Bulk Data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a solution offered by Safaricom which allows Enterprise Customers to purchase data in bulk and distribute to their customers or employees.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who qualifies for bulk data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Any business that has a contract with Safaricom for the purchase of Bulk Data.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I apply for bulk data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Through sharing your business details athttps://dop.safaricom.co.ke/dopportal/and a member our team will reach out for the onboarding process.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Data Operation Platform?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Data Operation Platform (DOP) is the platform that hosts the Bulk Data Service amongst other services for our Enterprise Customers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where do I Sign Up for Bulk Data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers can get the Bulk Data service through, providing details about their business athttps://dop.safaricom.co.ke/dopportal/and a member of the team will reach out within 24hrs with registration guidance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What documents do I require to get Bulk Data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers are required to provide certified copy of Certificate of Incorporation, Certified copy of KRA PIN and Signed off contract with Safaricom.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I get to know if my application is successful?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Bulk data customers will receive a notification upon successful completion of registration fromThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the payment method for Bulk Data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Bulk data payments are accepted through M-PESA and Bank Payments.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What Payment plans are available for Bulk Data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Bulk data allows two payment plans.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I view my billing and distribution data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers can access billing and distribution report through the Data operations platform.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I update / change payment method?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers can use any method of payment anytime without the need to change it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What do I if I have made payment but not received the Bulk Data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Contact your Account Manager / Sales contact orThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I know that I have received the Bulk Data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will receive a notification on successful disbursement of Bulk Data to their account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What do I do if I cannot re-distribute the Bulk Data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers can Contact their Account Manager/Sales contact or Safaricom Admin throughThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does the Bulk Data expire?
Does the unused Bulk Data Roll Over after the next payment?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, Bulk Data resources do not roll over.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I check my Bulk Data balance?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Balances are available on Data operation platform (DOP) under Reports.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who can I contact if the portal is not working?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Enterprise partner will Contact their Account Manager / Sales contact, Safaricom Admin, ORThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does safaricom have 5G ready Mobile data bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Yes, following succesful commercial launch in Oct-2022, customers will dial *544# and choose Option 4:GO MONTHLY then Option for 5G Plans to view the 5G ready bundles.
Also available on *444# and choose Option 1:Data OFA -> Option 6:TUNUKIWA.
The offers from Sh 3000 are available for all customers . Remember to be in 5G ready site to enjoy maximum speeds.
