https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Nilipe Na M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Nilipe Na M-PESA is a campaign intended to boost the growth and usage of Peer to Peer (P2P) transactions on M-PESA within the Safaricom network. The campaign will reward a select group of M-PESA P2P (Send Money) recipients who exceed a daily transaction target, from values over Ksh 100.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is eligible for the Nilipe Na M-PESA campaign?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: For a start, a select group of M-PESA customers will be opted into the campaign and notified through SMS.Safaricom will advise customers if the campaign will continue after the 3 months of pilot.To know customers selected for the initial pilot on M-PESA interface, CEEs will check the customer profile on M-PESA.i. Under ‘Customer Information’, on the left hand side of customer profile, select ‘Segment’. The campaigns a customer is registered for will be displayed.ii. Select ‘KYC Tab’. If a customer is on the campaign, ‘Nilipe na M-PESA’, will show on the list of promotions, with the target. If a customer is not registered, or has opted out of the campaign, under ‘Nilipe Na M-PESA, the status will read ‘Inactive’.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I deactivate Nilipe Na M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To deactivate Nilipe Na M-PESA:I. Dial *234#.II. Select option 0: “Nilipe Na M-PESA”III. Select option 2 IV.You will receive the message below, confirming that you have successfully opted out of Nilipe Na M-PESA.“You have successfully opted out of the Nilipe Na M-PESA Cash Reward. To reactivate dial *234#.”

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will I get my NILIPE Na M-PESA Cash back reward?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The recipient will be given a daily target of M-PESA send money transactions to receive in order to be rewarded.Once you hit your target, you will be rewarded with cash back to your M-PESA account instantly for every subsequent transaction.The target will reset every day at 0000hrs.For example, where your target is 5 transactions a day, you will start getting your cash back reward on the 5th transaction you receive. To query your target, you will dial *234#I. Select option 0: ‘Nilipe na M-PESA’II. Select option 3: ‘Check my target’You will receive a message informing you of your daily target:“Receive XX transactions on M-PESA today and earn a cash reward for every transaction after that. #Nilipe Na M-PESA”

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What transaction types do I need to do to get the cash back rewards?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Cash back will be based on send money transactions received from M-PESA, from Ksh 101 upwards. Customers will start receiving the cash back immediately they hit their daily target.The following transaction types will NOT earn you cash back rewards:i. Send Money transactions from other Networks.ii. Mobile banking Transactions and Bulk Payment Transactions.iii. IMT (International Money Transfer) iv. Lipa na M-PESA (Merchant Payment) transactionsv. C2B (Paybill) transactions.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will the cash back be calculated?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Cash back will be calculated based on the value of send money transactions you receive above your daily target.The transaction values must be over Ksh 100 – i.e. M-PESA Kadogo transactions (below Ksh 100) do not qualify to add up to the daily target set, for a cash back reward.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the transaction charges be changed for this campaign?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, normal M-PESA transaction charges will remain

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the difference between Nilipe Na M-PESA and LIPA Na M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Nilipe Na M-PESA is a campaign to drive and reward acceptance and usage of Send Money (P2P) transactions among M-PESA customers.Lipa Na M-PESA is the payment of goods and services through a designated M-PESA till number. Money is collected in a Merchant account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I already accept payments through LIPA Na M-PESA on my till; can I also enroll for Nilipe Na M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If your nominated number is among the selected group of pilot customers, you will be informed of your eligibility to take part in the campaign through SMS. Nilipe Na M-PESA targets Peer to Peer (P2P) transactions where money is sent and received on one’s personal M-PESA line.Lipa Na M-PESA tills do not qualify as the campaign targets P2P transactions

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I query my target transactions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To query your target,i. Dial *234#ii. Select option 2: ‘M-PESA Information’iii. Select option 3: ‘Check my target’iv. You will receive a message informing you of your daily target:“Receive XX transactions on M-PESA today and earn a cash reward for every transaction after that. #Nilipe Na M-PESA”

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will I get my cash back reward?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: After you achieve your daily transaction target, your cash back reward will be automatically credited to your M-PESA account.The M-PESA transaction message received will show the amount rewarded, and your current balance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How long will the Nilipe Na M-PESA campaign run?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The campaign will run among the select group of M-PESA customers for 3 months, from the campaign start date.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I do not get my cash back reward?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Check that you have attained your daily target transactions.If you have, but are yet to receive your reward, please call Safaricom on Line 100 (Prepaid), Line 200 (Postpaid) and Line 234 (for M-PESA related queries)

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: In case of any queries, who will I contact?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can contact Safaricom on:I. Line 100 (Prepaid customers)II. Line 200 (Post Paid customers)III. Line 234

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is validity of the airtime awards and what can it be used for?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Chapa Dimba na Safaricom?

The aims of the tournament are to transform the lives of young people by giving them a platform to showcase their talent and an opportunity to earn from their passion.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will I redeem my points using Lipa na Bonga service (Bonga popote) at a Lipa na MPESA Buy Goods Till number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To redeem your Bonga Points, simply dial *126# and select “Lipa Na Bonga “. You will be asked to enter the Till No/Pay bill No the amount you want to pay and your Service PIN. If you have forgotten your Service PIN, simply click forget to reset it.Business Rules;This Service is available to all Safaricom Prepay and Post Pay subscribers who are enrolled to Bonga Points.Prepay subscribers and Individual Post pay subscribers will be able to redeem for goods & services at Select Pay bills & All Buy goods merchantsCorporate Post pay customers will need to work with their Relationship managers from enterprise business to guide on a process to redeem for goods and services for the corporate client

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the conversion rate for Lipa na Bonga Service (Bonga Popote)?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customer will exchange 5 Bonga point to KES 1

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will I confirm if I have paid using my Bonga points?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To confirm a transaction, compare the MPESA transaction ID you have received with the one that the Lipa na MPESA merchant has received. To note, all payments paid using Bonga points will come with the customer name as ‘Safaricom Bonga Everywhere’

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I pay into a till but have insufficient Bonga Points?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The transaction will only be completed successfully if you have insufficient points in your account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I check the number of points I need to pay for my bill?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To check how many points, you need to pay for your bill, dial *126# select ‘Lipa Na Bonga’, then select ‘Bonga Calculator’. You will be requested to put in the amount you want to pay. You will then get a response showing the number of points you will need to pay your bill.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are there any extra charges when I pay using Bonga Points?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, there are no extra charges. Only the Bonga Points value of the bill you are paying will be deducted from your Bonga balance when you redeem

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What can I do If I don’t have enough Bonga Points?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: TYou can calculate how much your Bonga points can cover on *126# when you go to Lipa na Bonga and use the Bonga Calculator. Thereafter let the merchant know that you will be paying partly with Bonga points and the rest of the payment you can make via Lipa na MPESA

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the M-PESA Chama Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a service being offered to groups/chamas to allow them to collect funds conveniently and securely.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I apply to get an M-PESA chama account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Simply walk into any Safaricom shop or Safaricom Care desk countrywide and request for an application form.You can also send an SMS with the word CHAMA to 21366 or email us onThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.and one of us will get back to you.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How long does it take to set up an M-PESA Chama account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: AUpon submission of the application form and signed contract, it will take 48 hours. The customer will then be notified via a telephone call from Safaricom.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the requirements to set up an M-PESA Chama account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The applicant is required to submit the following documents in addition to the application form;

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Once the money has been collected, how does the group access it?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The money collected is transferred by group representative to the bank account provided in the application form. The group or a group representative will initiate the request for the funds to be transferred to the bank account by logging in to a portal access and making the request or sending an email toThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the maximum and minimum amount that can be held by an M-PESA chama account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The M-PESA Chama Account can hold from 0 to Ksh. 100 million.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: As a member how do I get to know whether other members have paid?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The group representative can register the rest of the members and provide access for members to log in to the portal to access the chama statement.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are there charges for depositing money into the M-PESA Chama Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The chama will not be charged. However, members contributing will be charged a small fee based on the amount sent.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are Fixed Wireless Access products?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a fast and affordable internet connection for small to medium sized businesses based on the revised packages and wireless technology.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do new Fixed Wireless Access Products work?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
The functionality of Fixed LTE or 4G For Home products will remain the same. Product lifecycles, - sales, onboarding, order management, activation, billing, usage and termination processes will remain the same. Existing customer will receive higher allocation in the subsequent billing cycle. No customer migrations will be needed.
New customers will be onboarded on the higher volumes only.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the Fixed Wireless Access Products have FUP limits?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. The new packages will not have any access limits for a given time.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will Fixed Wireless Access customers have guaranteed internet speeds?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. The new packages based on best of effort for each customer, in their access area or network cell. The network cell may have peaks and troughs in traffic, customers will experience low and high speeds respectively.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I exhaust my bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You are allowed to purchase same bundle as subscribed via M-Pesa, by dialing USSD *485#. You can purchase as many times within the month as desired. This payment is treated as a bill prepayment, so the monthly bill remains the same.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I move with the Fixed Wireless Access indoor router to another location and use it well?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Fixed Wireless usage conditions are restricted to network cells/locations to push required traffic, 4G or 5G. Chances are a customer may move out of these areas. Effective working of Fixed Wireless Access products is only guaranteed where signal strengths are already confirmed. This is done at sales and onboarding part of the journey, not meant to change.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is an eSIM?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: eSIM is an embedded SIM inside your device. There's no physical SIM card that you need to insert. The eSIM stores data that is needed for your device to connect to and use the Safaricom network.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the benefits of eSIM?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
1. Having more than one phone number tied to a single device without swapping SIMs.
2. Freedom to switch operators without having to change your device if using a single SIM device.
3. Reduced risk of SIM Card damage since the SIM card is embedded in the phone.
4. Frequent travellers can easily switch providers as they travel.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What does it mean when a device has a Dual SIM with an eSIM?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
1. Having more than one phone number tied to a single device without swapping SIMs.
2. Freedom to switch operators without having to change your device if using a single SIM device.
3. Reduced risk of SIM Card damage since the SIM card is embedded in the phone.
4. Frequent travellers can easily switch providers as they travel.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is an eSIM only device?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Devices that are eSIM-only do not have a physical SIM card; instead, all the information is stored on the eSIM inside the device.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are eSIM devices available at Safaricom Shops?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, subject to availability.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I know if my phone supports eSIM?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Please dial *#06#. If the device has an EID number, it means it is eSIM enabled.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I download the QR code to my device without a data connection?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. You must be connected to a WI-FI or cellular network.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can the eSIM connect to 2G, 3G, 4G and 5G?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the experience will be like a physical SIM where you can switch between networks.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use both physical and eSIM on the same handset with different phone numbers?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, if you have both SIMs active it means that you have two different phone numbers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many eSIM profiles can one have on my device?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is dependent on a specific device because of different manufacturer specifications and capabilities.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I have the same eSIM and physical SIM active?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If it’s the same number, no. If it’s a different number, yes. An eSIM is treated by the network like a normal SIM card.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I make and receive calls from both phone numbers I have?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Yes, you can make and receive calls and messages from both numbers if one is an eSIM and the other is a physical SIM.  However, if you're on a call with one of your phone numbers, calls to your other phone number will go to voicemail. You will also receive a notification for the missed call.
Call Waiting will work if you receive a call to the same number that you are currently using.  If both phone numbers are eSIM then one has to be on at one time.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: For SIM card with M-PESA, after SIM swap, does it auto activate or M-PESA activation will be required?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Remains the same. You will be required to go to the STK menu to activate.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is M-PESA PayPal?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a money transfer service for joint PayPal and M-PESA customers that enables customers to move funds between their own M-PESA account and PayPal account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What charges will apply for Withdrawal/Top up Service?
Do I have to create an account to use this service?

Yes. You need to have registered PayPal and M-PESA accounts.
Once you have registered for M-PESA and PayPal account, you will be required to link their PayPal account to the M-PESA account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I link my M-PESA Account to PayPal? (New PayPal Accounts)?

The customer will be using the same link to withdraw funds from a PayPal account to an M-PESA account and deposit to a PayPal account from an M-PESA account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I withdraw to M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Withdraw service from PayPal allows you to transfer funds from your PayPal account to your linked qualifying M-PESA account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I top up the account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The top-up service to PayPal allows you to top up funds from your qualifying M-PESA account to your linked PayPal account to shop online or make payments with PayPal.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How long does it take to receive funds after withdrawal?

The funds will be processed to your M-PESA account in 2 hours to 3 calendar days after transaction confirmation depending on the value of the transaction.
The estimated time will be presented to the customer before confirming the transaction.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will receive a confirmation SMS from M-PESA and an email from PayPal.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Current M-PESA transaction limits apply (Maximum KSh. 150,000 per transaction and KSh. 300,000 per day).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can one perform transactions on the Business Till?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Withdraw Funds: From Agent
You will receive a pop-up on your phone screen that the requested withdrawal has been successfully initiated. You will then receive an SMS from M-PESA confirming the amount withdrawn to your mobile number.
Withdraw Funds to Bank:
There are two options under withdraw to bank i.e.
You will receive a pop-up on your phone screen with a confirmation that your withdrawal request has been successfully initiated. You will then receive an M-PESA notification SMS that the withdrawal request of all funds to your bank account has been successfully initiated and your funds will be credited to your bank account. The M-PESA Business Till balance will also be displayed.
Withdrawing specific amount to the bank
You will receive a pop-up on your phone screen with a confirmation that your withdrawal request has been successfully initiated. You will then receive an M-PESA notification SMS that the withdrawal request of all funds to your bank account has been successfully initiated and your funds will be credited to your bank account. The M-PESA Business Till balance will also be displayed.
Make Payment To Business Till (Buy Goods Till)
You will receive a pop-up on your phone screen with a confirmation that the Paybill payment request has been successfully initiated. You will then receive an M-PESA confirmation that the payment you initiated to another Paybill number has been successfully completed. The M-PESA Business Till balance will also be displayed.
Make Payment To Paybill Number
You will receive a pop-up on your phone screen with a confirmation that the paybill payment request has been successfully initiated. You will then receive an M-PESA confirmation that the payment you initiated to another Paybill number has been successfully completed. The M-PESA Business Till balance will also be displayed.
Pay to Mobile Number
You will then receive an M-PESA confirmation that the payment you initiated has been successfully completed. The amount transferred and the recipient’s name and phone number and your Business Till balance will also be displayed.
Sell Airtime
You will receive a pop up on your phone screen with a confirmation that the airtime purchase has been successfully initiated. You will then receive an M-PESA confirmation that the airtime sale was successfully completed. The amount transferred and the recipient’s name and phone number and your Business Till balance will also be displayed.
Check Balance
You will receive an SMS with your Business Till balance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: M-PESA business till account management
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Create Assistant
The Primary Operator will create the other users i.e., Merchant assistants. Assistants will only be able to transact on the business till and not their personal numbers.
Upon successful creation the assistant Operator will receive an Operator ID and a one-time start PIN on the mobile number used at creation, the assistant will be required to change the PIN on the business till to be able to transact.
Change your Operator PIN
You will receive a confirmation message that your PIN has successfully been changed and the till successfully activated. You are now ready to start using your M-PESA Business till.
Reset another Assistant Operator’s PIN
Upon successful PIN reset, the assistant will receive an SMS confirmation with a fresh start key, the assistant will follow the process of changing PIN outline under change PIN above.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I access my statement?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
This is a Do-It-Yourself automated process where merchant can access their daily, monthly, and yearly statement on demand. You need to opt into the service to receive your statements.
Note that you can also access your statements on the M-PESA Business App.
M-PESA Merchant Statement opt In.
To ensure the correct email address was used, you will receive a confirmation message that an email has been sent to the email provided for verification. The verification link will remain active for 24hrs. Once the email is successfully verified, the merchant will receive a message confirming that the email statement verification has been initiated. The merchant will need to validate their email registration using a 4-code digit sent by SMS. M-PESA Merchant Statements Opt In Validation
OTP (One Time Password) Validation: USSD Validation
You will receive a confirmation that your request to verify your OTP is being processed. Upon successful validation, you will receive an SMS confirmation that your email has been successfully registered.
OTP (One Time Password) Validation Option 1: USSD Validation
Upon successful validation, you will receive an SMS confirmation that your email has been successfully registered.
Upon successful completion, you will receive an SMS confirmation that your full statement has been sent to your email.
Full statements for a specific period:
You will receive a confirmation SMS that your request for M-PESA statement has been received and is being processed. Upon successful completion, you will receive an SMS confirmation that your full statement for the specified period has been sent to your email.
Change Statement Email:
You will receive a confirmation message that an email has been sent to the email provided for verification. The verification link will remain active for 24hrs. Once the email is successfully verified, the merchant will receive an SMS confirmation that your email statement registration request is being processed. You will need to log into the email provided to access the verification code to complete the change of email. Upon successful email validation, you will receive an SMS confirmation that your email has been successfully registered.
Resend OTP:
You will receive a confirmation SMS that your request to resend the OTP has been sent to your email with instructions on how to access the OTP.
Cancel Statement Registration:
You will receive an SMS confirmation that your request to cancel your registration for M-PESA statements has been canceled successfully.
Opt out of Statements:
You will receive a confirmation SMS that you have successfully been opted out of M-PESA statements email service. To opt in dial*234#.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is TerraPay?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It is an international money transfer provider that has partnered with Safaricom to enable M-PESA registered customers to send money to individuals in Bangladesh and Pakistan either to their mobile numbers or to their bank.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the benefits of the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The service will offer the following benefits to our customers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who can use the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This service is open to all M-PESA registered customers who have opted-in to the M-PESA Global Services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the access channels for TerraPay service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The M-PESA customers will access the TerraPay service on the following channels.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which countries does the TerraPay service support?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The TerraPay service supports customers in the following countries.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I join M-PESA Global to use the TerraPay service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
To enjoy the TerraPay service, you must opt-in to M-PESA Global either on M-PESA App or on the USSD code *334#.
To Join using M-PESA App
To join using USSD *334#:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the transaction limits?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The normal daily M-PESA transaction limits apply.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I make payments to Pakistan and Bangladesh recipients?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
You can make payments via TerraPay via USSD *334#, MySafaricom App, or M-PESA App
On M-PESA App
On USSD *344#.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I know the recipient’s phone number/bank account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The recipient will send you their phone number or bank account number to you which will be validated by Terrapay during the transfer of funds to avoid sending money to the wrong recipient.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the charges for using the Terrapay service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: In what currency will the recipient receive the funds?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The recipient will receive the funds in their country’s currency i.e., Bangladesh Taka (BDT) and Pakistan Rupee (PRT).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I want to request a reversal of a transfer?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Call the Safaricom contact center on 100 or 200 with the transaction details and time stamp.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I request a partial reversal in case I send the wrong amount?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. This service supports only full reversals, hence does not support partial reversals. For example, if you send Ksh 1,000 to a TerraPay customer, you can only request a reversal of Ksh 1,000.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I request a reversal for a transaction that was done after 30 days?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Only transactions done within a period of 30 days will be eligible for reversal.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the channels for support?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: In case of any queries or more information:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Bonga Deals?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Bonga Deals are discounts with Safaricom partners that reward customers relevantly based on interests, location, behavior and segment. Customers on the Bonga Loyalty scheme get an added value of Bonga Deals for using their Bonga Points at different Lipa na MPESA merchant outlets.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who qualifies for Bonga Deals?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All 30-day active Prepay, Post pay and Home customers on the Bonga Loyalty scheme qualify for different deals based on their location and segment

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I access Bonga Deals?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers can access Bonga Deals through Safaricom USSD channel *126#, MySafaricom App and Web channel under Bonga Rewards.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the process of redeeming the Bonga Deal?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: NCustomer will go to the channels available *126#, MySafaricom App, Web and go to the Option Bonga Deals. Customer will then choose the deal they would want to redeem and confirm redemption. The customer will then get a voucher code that will be used to redeem the offer.The customer will then give the merchant the voucher code and enjoy the discount as they make their payment using Bonga points or part Bonga

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Validity of the deal?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The validity of the offer will be dependent on the partner and will vary based on the negotiated discount.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I have to use my Bonga Points when redeeming?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you can use full Bonga points or ask the merchant to use Part cash & Part Bonga when doing the redemption.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What if I have enrolled on Bonga but don’t have Bonga points now?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can still enjoy the offer as you continue to accumulate your Bonga points.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times can I subscribe to an offer?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A customer can subscribe as many times as the want to the offer if its valid.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times can I redeem the voucher number received?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can only redeem the voucher received once.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I have to use my Bonga Points when redeeming?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you can use full Bonga points or ask the merchant to use Part cash & Part Bonga when doing the redemption.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What if I have enrolled on Bonga but don’t have Bonga points now?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can still enjoy the offer as you continue to accumulate your Bonga points.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-TIBA is a service on your mobile phone that allows you to put funds aside for healthcare. Funds stored in M-TIBA can only be used to pay for services and medication at specific healthcare facilities which carry the M-TIBA logo. You can transfer funds from your M-PESA to your M-TIBA. Funds stored in M-TIBA are managed by UAP insurance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who qualifies to register for M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Anyone who is a Safaricom customer above the age of 18 years is eligible to register on M-TIBA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What documents do I need to register on M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You must have a duly registered Safaricom SIM card and be a holder of a valid national identity card or passport.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I register more than one M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. You can only register one M-TIBA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How much does it cost to transfer funds to my M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All transactions from your own M-PESA to your M-TIBA are free of charge.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check my M-TIBA balance?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Available products will be displayed along with the available balances

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Am I required to maintain a minimum balance in my M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. there is no set minimum balance for M-TIBA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the minimum amount of funds I can transfer to my M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The minimum amount you can transfer from M-PESA to M-TIBA is 10 Ksh.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the maximum amount of funds I can store in M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: There is no maximum limit of funds you can store on M-TIBA

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are my funds safe in M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Funds stored in your M-TIBA will stay safe. Your M-TIBA is secured with a PIN which should be known only to you. Do not share your PIN with anyone. The funds stored in M-TIBA are managed by UAP. UAP is a licensed Insurance company and a medical scheme fund manager regulated by the Insurance Regulatory Authority of Kenya.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where can I use M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-TIBA works with a large network of healthcare providers. Please ask an M-TIBA agent for a list of healthcare facilities participating in M-TIBA in your area or call our Toll Free line on 0800 721253 or visitwww.safaricom.co.ke/about/community-impact/social-innovation/m-tiba

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I recognize an M-TIBA facility?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Participating healthcare facilities will carry the M-TIBA logo.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I know when my M-TIBA has been charged?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will receive an SMS notification when you have opened your M-TIBA before getting treated, and another SMS when the healthcare facility has billed your M-TIBA. The SMS sent after your M-TIBA has been billed will indicate the cost of the services and medication and your new M-TIBA balance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I know I’m not overbilled?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The healthcare facility uses a pre-agreed price list to bill you. You are advised to confirm the cost of a service with the healthcare provider before opening your M-TIBA. However, for any questions, please call our Toll Free line on 0800 721253.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I transfer funds to a facility that is not participating in M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will get an error message and you will not be able to make a payment.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I pay for others using my M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. You can pay for anyone using your M-TIBA if you add them as a dependant. Dial *253#, Login, select Settings then “Add Dependant”; follow instructions to add dependant. Once the dependant is added you can pay for his/ her treatment and medication.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I don’t have sufficient funds in my M-TIBA to pay for healthcare services?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can only use M-TIBA to pay bills up to the value of funds you have stored. You can transfer additional funds to your M-TIBA directly from your M-PESA following instructions provided under item 9 above “How do I transfer funds to my M-TIBA?”

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I change my M-TIBA PIN?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will receive an SMS notification confirming PIN change “Your PIN has been changed”.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I correct personal details in case they are wrong in the system?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Make sure you provide correct details during registration. If you notice certain details are wrong, please call the M-TIBA Toll Free line on 0800 721253 or emailThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I confirm if I or my dependants are registered?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To confirm registration status simply dial *253#.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I transfer funds from my M-TIBA to another M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. This option will become available in the near future. We will inform you when this is active.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I lose my phone?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will need to call Safaricom customer care and get your SIM card blocked. Then you need to get a replacement for the SIM card at your nearest Safaricom shop. After getting your new SIM card, you can continue using your M-TIBA by dialing *235#.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I close my M-TIBA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. Please contact the M-TIBA Toll Free line on 0800 721253 for instructions. You will be asked to provide confidential information to verify ownership. However, you are advised to keep your M-TIBA active.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens to my M-TIBA funds in case of death?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Upon notification of death, by a next of kin by availing of a copy of the death certificate, the M-TIBA account will be in-activated and the remaining funds sent to your M-PESA account within 5 working days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How secure is my personal data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All information/data in our system is secure and protected using the highest standards.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where can I get additional information about M-TIBA? (listing)
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can call the M-TIBA Toll Free line on 0800 721253. Alternatively, you can visithttp://m-tiba.co.ke/, or emailThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the new data tariff?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The new data tariff now allows customers to buy data with NO EXPIRY DATE, for any amount they wish.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What does NO EXPIRY DATE mean for the new data plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: TThe data will not expire. The customer gets to use the entire bundle until it depletes.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is eligible for the new data tariff?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The new data tariff is available to all Safaricom customers (prepaid, postpaid and hybrid).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I purchase on the new data tariff?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The new data plans are available on *544#, My Safaricom App, and Web onwww.safaricom.com/bundles

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I purchase the new data plan multiple times?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, customers can purchase the data as many times as they like.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does the new data plan come with free access to WhatsApp?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. The New Data bundles will not have free access to WhatsApp.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which payment modes are available to purchase the new data plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers can buy the new data plan with Airtime and M-PESA. The customer will be prompted to select the payment option before completing the purchase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I purchase the new data plan for another number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you can purchase the new data plan for another number as well.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I earn Bonga points?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, customers will earn Bonga points for each purchase as per the current conversion rate.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be able to buy data bundles with Bonga points?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. The customer can still buy the old Data Bundles with Bonga points. They however will not be able to buy the new data plan with Bonga points.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be able to browse without the data plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, customers will be able to browse without data using their airtime at KSh 4.3 per MB.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I subscribe to My Data Manager?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers can subscribe to My Data Manager by dialing *544# and selecting Normal Bundles with Expiry on option 3.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will a customer still receive balance and depletion notifications for the new data tariff?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the customer will receive balance notifications at 500MB, 75MB and 2MB.The customer will also receive a depletion notification upon the data plan’s depletion.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be able to sambaza data with the new tariff?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you will be able to sambaza data from the new tariff, between 5MB and 10MB per transaction, with a maximum of 20MB per day.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What will happen to my previous bundles when I buy the new data plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The normal bundles with an expiry date will be used up first before the data in the new tariff.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I extend the validity of the old data bundles by buying the new data plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. The validity of the old bundles with expiry cannot be extended with the new data plan.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who can access My Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This service is open to all M-PESA registered customers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I join for My Account service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will automatically join these services once you register and activate your M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I access my M-PESA Account service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To access these services:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the charges for accessing My Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Accessing My Account services is FREE, thus there are zero costs when accessing these services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I forget the security questions’ answers that I had set?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Contact customer care for the questions and answers to be reset to default/ delete.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I do not set the security questions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It is not a mandatory requirement. However, if you want to reset your PIN on demand, you should set the security questions.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I want to reset my PIN and I have not set any answers to the security questions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If you have not set answers to the questions and need to self-reset your PIN, a dynamic vetting process will apply when you contact customer care.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I get a start PIN after registration?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will not need a start PIN. You will activate your M-PESA and follow the prompts.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I reset my PIN immediately after a SIM replacement?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. You can do it yourself, and it is only allowed 7 days after a SIM replacement.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do lock my M-PESA PIN?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You lock your M-PESA PIN by entering the wrong M-PESA PIN five consecutive times.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: In case of any queries, who do I contact?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: In case of any queries or more information:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When I click on a button appears “Coming Soon”. What does it mean?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You are testing a beta version ofM-PESA, features that are labeled as Coming Soon will be available only on future versions. Keep using the Application to discover these new features.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I have seen an error screen while completing a transaction. How can I complete a transaction in this scenario?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Please make sure that you are using the mobile application with a proper internet connection, have enough balance and inserted the correct PIN. If all these criteria is met, please contact support and indicate the error that is present on the screen.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I don’t want to accept the Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy. Can I still use the App?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, accepting Terms & Conditions and Privacy Policy is a mandatory step to use M-PESA

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I didn’t allow the App to access my contacts on the Send Money flow. How can I give permissions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can click on button that directs to phone settings, or go directly to settings on your device. Then on M-PESA App Settings activate the access to your phone book.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the benefit of using a B2B Payment service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The following are the benefits of B2B payment service to our customers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the types of transactions under B2B payment services?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Business Intra account transfer - This allows the transfer of funds within the same organization e.g., Working to utility, working to Float, working to Merchants, and Vice versa.
Business Inter account transfer. This allows the transfer of funds from one shortcode to another shortcode. Business inter-account can either be done as a single or in bulk.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the roles of B2B payment service users?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Roles are a set of permissions on what a user created can and cannot do in the M-PESA system. B2C payment has 4 roles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the transaction limits for B2B payment services?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Before you start transacting, the shortcodes to be used must all be authorized.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who do I contact in case of queries?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: For any customer request or inquiry,

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Lipa Karo?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It is a service that allows payments and collection of school fees through M-PESA. Upon signing up for a Lipa Karo account, a school is issued with a business number to which parents and guardians pay their child’s fees. The service is available to schools which have signed up for an M-PESA Paybill number for Lipa Karo or through paybill accounts operated by our partners e.g. Kenya Commercial Bank, Co-operative Bank and Pesapal.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What steps does one follow while making school fees payments?
What notification will I get as a confirmation that the fees have been remitted?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will get two SMS notifications:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is this service available in all schools?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You may need to contact your school or bursar to confirm whether your respective school has been registered with this M-PESA service and what the business number to pay to is.If your school is not registered, you may request for registration by asking the school to email Safaricom onThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.to request for a paybill number for the school.We will send you the application details and process your application upon receipt of the completed application form.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I get the right business number for my school?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can get in touch with your school bursar to confirm what your school business number is and how the student is identified. Alternatively dial *234# and follow instructions to get your business number. Enter school name as the key word

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who Can I Call for Assistance?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
For assistance on the service you can contact;Safaricom Contact Centre; Dial 100 (from Safaricom mobile phone)E-mail:This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
