https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Out Of Bundle Management?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a service which ensures you aren’t billed from your airtime when browsing. Data charges will only be on your data bundles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I access the Out Of Bundle Management Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The service will be available on *544# under the name Out Of Bundle Management..

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I activate the Out Of Bundle Management Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *544# and select Out Of Bundle then choose “Activate”. You will receive the following SMS confirmation message: You have activated Out of Bundle Management. You will not be able to browse without a data bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I activate the Out Of Bundle Management service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will receive a pop up menu with the following options when you start to browse the internet and you do not have a data bundle or when you are about to finish your data bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I do not select any of the three options mentioned above?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The browsing or internet session will be stopped and you will not be allowed to access the internet until you purchase a bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I was downloading a video or a song and the pop-up appears and I take no action?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The download will be stopped and whatever you have downloaded will be lost. You will have to start from the beginning when you buy a new bundle or accept to continue browsing out of bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I still receive the low bundle when I am about to exhaust my bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you will still receive the low bundle notification when you are 2MB. The SMS message you will receive will appear as below: Dear customer, your data bundle is almost finished. Dial *544# to check your data bundle balance. .

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times a day will I receive these notifications in a day?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Provided you finish your data bundle, the pop up and SMS message will be sent to you to ensure you buy a bundle and don’t browse using your airtime without a data bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I deactivate the Out Of Bundle Management Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *544# and select Out Of Bundle then choose Deactivate You will receive the following SMS confirmation message: You have deactivated Out Of Bundle Management. You will be charged from airtime when you browse without a data bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What will my experience be like when I activate the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will receive flash messages with the choices to buy a bundle, Okoa a bundle or Redeem Bonga points for data bundles and you will not be able to browse when you do not have a data bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What will my experience be like when I opt out of the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will not receive the flash messages with the choices to buy a bundle, Okoa a bundle or Redeem Bonga points for data bundles. However you will be allowed to browse on your airtime when you do not have a data bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Subscription Management?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a functionality which will give customers a way to easily query their auto renewal subscriptions as well as a way to accept weekly notifications for a list of all auto renewal subscriptions. The subscription check is unified on *100# and *200# under “My Subscriptions”.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is an auto renewable subscription?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: An auto renewable subscription is any subscription (data, SMS, Skiza, PRS & Games etc.) that is auto renewed either daily, weekly or monthly.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What options does the customer have on the Subscription Management menu?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The following options are available on the Subscription Management menu:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I select Weekly Notification?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will be given an option to opt in for a weekly SMS notification. The weekly SMS notification will be sent to subscribers who have an active subscription only. The same menu will also give you an option to opt out of the weekly SMS notification.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Spark Accelerator Program?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Spark Accelerator is a collaborative initiative by Safaricom, M-PESA Africa, and Sumitomo Corporation and Implemented By iHub LTD. It is a platform designed to empower bold and visionary founders of early-stage startups to grow and scale their businesses.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is the Spark Accelerator the same initiative as Safaricom Spark Fund?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Whilst the Spark Fund was premised around providing funding to early-stage startups, the Spark Accelerator seeks to broaden the scope of support to early-stage startups, that fit the criteria, to include technology and product development support, access to market and access to capital.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the terms and conditions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center-landing/terms-and-conditions/safaricom-spark-accelerator

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who should apply for the Spark Accelerator?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Startups based in Kenya, particularly those building solutions in highlighted focus areas, are encouraged to apply. The program is open to diverse teams with the requisite expertise, ready to accept equity participation, and with existing products and post-revenue.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the entry requirements?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Startups based in Kenya, particularly those building solutions in highlighted focus areas, are encouraged to apply. The program is open to diverse teams with the requisite expertise, ready to accept equity participation, and with existing products and post-revenue and Pre-Series A. If you’re a female founder we strongly encourage you to apply.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the accelerator’s focus areas?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
The Spark Accelerator focuses on startups in highlighted sectors, including:
a. Embedded Financial Services:
i. Insure Tech
ii. Fintech as a Service –(enabling other businesses to offer financial services)
iii. Agency as a Service - Enabling agents to sell digital products
b. SME Productivity Tools:
i. E-commerce enablement
ii. POS and acceptance solutions
iii. Merchant loyalty and rewards
iv. Inventory and sales efficiency
v. Working capital management
c. Fintech powered by AI:
i. Wealth management
ii. Fraud management
iii. Reg-tech
iv. Scoring
d. Content:
i. Local gaming content
ii. Long and short-form video content
iii. Mobile advertisement Definition
e. Others:
i. Personal financial management
ii. Carbon Finance
While these are highlighted, we encourage startups from aligned industries to apply, valuing diversity and innovation.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I apply?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
The Spark Accelerator focuses on startups in highlighted sectors, including:
a. Embedded Financial Services:
i. Insure Tech
ii. Fintech as a Service –(enabling other businesses to offer financial services)
iii. Agency as a Service - Enabling agents to sell digital products
b. SME Productivity Tools:
i. E-commerce enablement
ii. POS and acceptance solutions
iii. Merchant loyalty and rewards
iv. Inventory and sales efficiency
v. Working capital management
c. Fintech powered by AI:
i. Wealth management
ii. Fraud management
iii. Reg-tech
iv. Scoring
d. Content:
i. Local gaming content
ii. Long and short-form video content
iii. Mobile advertisement Definition
e. Others:
i. Personal financial management
ii. Carbon Finance
While these are highlighted, we encourage startups from aligned industries to apply, valuing diversity and innovation.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When does the program start and how long will it run for?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The program is expected to start in March 2024 and will run for 14 weeks. The program timeline will be communicated to selected startups during the onboarding process. We aim to provide comprehensive support to ensure long-term success.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many startups will be supported?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: We are committed to supporting up to 10 outstanding startups

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the benefits of this program for a Fintech or Content startup?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Participants in the Spark Accelerator Program will gain access to a range of benefits, including Safaricom and M-PESA Africa product and technology support, mentorship, access to capital, and go-to-market support. The program is anchored around Safaricom's goal of transforming lives. Participants can expect to get various benefits including, but not limited to:
i. Expert advisory from experts across Product development, talent management, marketing and sales.
ii. Access to a community to test out your products.
iii. Coaching and mentoring by successful founders and experts.
iv. Networking with other founders to build amazing solutions in Fintech.
v. Exposure to a vibrant network of investors.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What stage of startups are you looking for?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The program is designed for Pre-Series A startups, indicating that applicants should have an existing product, post-revenue, and demonstrate potential for significant growth. You must have a product-fit solution with verifiable users. Applicants should have a balanced team and be passionate about Fintech and the highlighted sectors. Female-founded/led companies are strongly encouraged to apply.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is equity participation a requirement for joining the program?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the Spark Accelerator Program targets startups ready to accept equity participation.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What types of technology support are available to startups in the program?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Startups in the Spark Accelerator Program will have access to some of Safaricom's select technology assets, including Daraja and M-PESA Africa Open APIs, and more. This also includes integration and development support. Additionally, AWS Activate Credits are provided.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens during the program?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The program will focus on deepening the capacity of Fintech and Content startups through carefully curated dedicated business support activities across four key verticals:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the selection process?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Once we receive your application, we will screen your solution for fit and alignment with the program focus areas, before assessing for scalability, potential and other criteria. The final stage is an interview process where our team will engage with you and conduct due diligence before a final selection.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When does the process close?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: February 2024. We are keeping the applications open for one month from 12th January 2024 – 16th February 2024 therefore qualifying teams are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do startups need to provide any other additional documents for their application?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All we require now is a video of you, the founder, speaking about your solution and links to your pitch deck and product demo. Do remember to upload your video so we can access it easily to review.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the recommended team size?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: While there is no strict team size requirement, a diverse team and multiskilled with the requisite expertise in the sector is encouraged.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do we need to know someone or be a member at Safaricom, M-PESA Africa, Sumitomo Corporation, or iHub, to be eligible to apply?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, knowing someone or being a member at Safaricom, M-PESA Africa, Sumitomo Corporation or iHub is not a requirement for eligibility. The Spark Accelerator Program is open to all qualifying startups meeting the specified criteria.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What level of commitment is required to participate in the program?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The participants in the Spark Accelerator Program are required not to take part in other accelerator program for startups at the same time.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I learn more about this if I have any other questions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: For any additional questions or more information about the Spark Accelerator Program, please send an email toThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.We're here to help and provide the information you need.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is eligible to buy FLEX Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: FLEX Units are available to all Safaricom PrePay and individual PostPay customers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I purchase and/or renew FLEX Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To subscribe, dial *444#, *100# or *200# to purchase FLEX bundles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will I know if my purchase if successful?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will receive an SMS notification for a successful purchase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When will auto-renewal for FLEX bundles be done?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Renewal will be done at midnight. If you don’t have sufficient airtime, the renewal will be done when you top-up and have adequate airtime on your line..

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the validity of the FLEX bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Validity of the Flex bundles is dependent on what you have selected,

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use my FLEX Units to call/SMS other Networks?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the FLEX Units can be used for both local on Net and off Net Calls and SMS. International calls and usage when roaming will be billed from your airtime.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check my FLEX balance?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can check your Flex Units balance via USSD by dialing either *144#, *100# or *200#.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If I have a data bundle or SMS bundle and purchase FLEX, what is the priority if usage?
I have an Advantage Plus Bundle/ Karibu PostPay. Can I purchase FLEX?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Currently, you can only purchase FLEX Units after your bundle expires or after you terminate the Advantage Plus/ Karibu contract

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I Sambaza my FLEX Units once purchased?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, FLEX Units are not transferable to another number.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I get Storo bonus when I buy FLEX?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Currently, you can only purchase FLEX Units after your bundle expires or after you terminate the Advantage Plus/ Karibu contract

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I Sambaza my FLEX Units once purchased?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, FLEX Units are not transferable to another number.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I get Storo bonus when I buy FLEX?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, FLEX purchase contributes to your Stori Ibambe target on the day of purchase

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use my FLEX Units for roaming?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the offers can be used for only local on Net and off Net Calls and SMS

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will FLEX Units be rolled over?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All FLEX Units will have rollover with below conditions.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will Skiza and PRS services be billed from FLEX?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Skiza and VAS services will not be billed from FLEX. These will be charged from the airtime in your account. This will also apply for chargeable USSD codes.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I earn Bonga from FLEX?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Usage of the free Flex units does not earn you Bonga Points under the Safaricom Bonga Reward Scheme however you will earn Bonga points once you buy Flex bundles

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use my FLEX units to buy data bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Flex units will not be used to purchase Data Bundles, international calling or SMS.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use my FLEX units while roaming?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Flex Units will not be available to roaming subscribers. Charges applicable for Roaming are available on www.safaricom.co.ke. Roaming means the use of telecommunication services while you are in other countries but using a Safaricom SIM Card.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is ZIIDI MMF for individuals or can chamas and businesses invest?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: As currently approved by the Capital Markets Authority,Ziidi MMFis an individual investment fund, however, we are working to add other options in the near future which may bring in chamas and businesses.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is ZIIDI MMF halal compliant?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: As currently approved,Ziidi MMFis an interest earning money market, however we are working on a Shariah compliant option that will be unveiled soon.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What interest do I earn for investing in ZIIDI MMF?-
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is aMoney Market Fundwhere the funds are invested in government securities such as T-bills as well as interest earning accounts. The rate therefore changes daily. The interest earned on your investments is computed daily and an indicated rate given to you on the M-PESA App and on *334#. Your funds start working for you just 24 hours after depositing. It’s the perfect way to make your money grow effortlessly!

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does the Ziidi MMF Interest attract a fund management charge?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the fund management fee is 2% interest per annum. However, the return indicated is a net return.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is money earned on the Ziidi MMF subject to taxation?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, Like all other interest earning investments, the Ziidi MMF income is subject to 15% withholding tax.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does Safaricom charge M-PESA transaction fees to & from the Ziidi MMF?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
No, All transactions to and from your M-PESA wallet to theZiidi MMFFund are completely free.

Enjoy giving you a worry-free convenience to manage your money.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I deposit or withdraw funds from the ZIIDI MMF directly to an agent or to the bank account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, For now, all deposits and withdrawals are via your M-PESA account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the transaction limit on the ZIIDI MMF?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The minimum amount to invest is KES 100 and the minimum amount you can withdraw is KES 10. There is no maximum investment. However, the daily M-PESA transaction limit of KES.500,000 per day and KES. 250,000 per transaction are applicable.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I track my investment?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can view and track your investment and earnings on the Ziidi mini app homepage under Investment performance or on *334#.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What document should I provide for the next of Kin claims?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Next of Kin is the person whose details you update on the ZIIDI mini app and in the event of incapacities such as sickness, mental instability, or death they can have access to your funds.

In the event of a claim, the Next of Kin will provide the following documents:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which channel should I use to make Next of Kin claims?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: As a Next of Kin, you’ll be required to visit the nearest Safaricom Retail shop or Care Desk for assistance with processing the claim.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I change ownership of my ZIIDI Account to my Next of Kin?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You cannot change ownership of your Ziidi account. If you need to change the ownership of your Ziidi account, you will need to withdraw all your funds and opt out of Ziidi. Then, follow the current process for changing the ownership of your mobile number and account details. We are here to help you through each step!

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What does it mean to lock Funds on the ZIIDI MMF?
How long can I Lock my Funds?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: There is no fixed period for locking your funds on the Ziidi MMF. Lock them for as long as you like using the Ziidi Mini-App on the M-PESA App or USSD 334#. Plus, you can easily top up your locked funds anytime.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When will my funds be available after un-locking?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Your funds will be available 72 hours after unlocking. Kindly note that you can only unlock the entire locked amount, not just a portion of it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is there a transaction limit for locking or unlocking funds?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, there’s no limit to the amount that can be locked or unlocked. However, the amount to be locked should be less than or equal to the amount in the Ziidi MMF wallet. No fees will be charged for locking and unlocking of invested funds.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the locked funds award higher interest than the rest of the funds in the Ziidi MMF?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The interest earned will be the same, however locking your funds helps you overcome impulsive spending building financial discipline.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where do I get support for the Ziidi MMF?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: For support and inquiry, please contact Safaricom Customer Care Center

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is 5G for Business?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Business 5G Wi-Fi is the next evolution for fixed wireless internet services that will offer businesses high-speed and reliable internet connectivity on our fast5G network in Kenya.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where can I get 5G connection?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Business 5G will initially be offered in areas where we have rolled out 5G network. We will gradually expand our covered areas and keep you posted on our rollout when we arrive in your area. This can also be checked throughnetwork cell info lite for 5G - Google Searchusing a 5G enabled handset.

How do I accept a Niokolee request?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
You will receive a notification from 44444 asking you to “Accept” or “Decline” the request.
Once you accept the request, the selected amount equivalent is moved from you to the requestor and notifications sent to both of you.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What messages will I receive?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the validity of the minutes?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: One can request up to Ksh 100. The options will be available on the menu as from 10,20, 30, 50 and 100.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will purchase of another bundle extend Validity?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Any unused Niokolee Kredo will not be carried over after the lapse of the validity period.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times can I request for Niokolee?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
You can only initiate a maximum of 2 Niokolee requests per day and any subsequent request will be automatically declined by the system.
Equally, you can make a maximum of 10 Niokolee requests in a month, any subsequent request will be automatically declined by the system.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I be a requestor and a sponsor to another number?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use the Kredo to call across networks?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the resources can be used for both on-net and off-net for both calls and SMS.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use Niokolee Kredo to make international calls?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the Niokolee airtime cannot be used to make international calls.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use Niokolee Kredo while roaming?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, Niokolee Talktime is usable only while within Kenya.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I share Niokolee Kredo to a number from another network?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the difference between a Paybill and a Short-Term Paybill?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Paybill is a long-term product, and the applicant may use it over several years. It is used by businesses, institutions, and government entities and therefore a valid registration document/license is required during application.
A Short-Term Paybill is designed to be used for a period of 6 months only, to accomplish a specific project after which it will be closed. The projects may be personal, so no business registration license is required. However, the applicant must provide official documentation to prove authenticity of the project.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the required documents?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: When applying for the Short-Term Paybill, each type of Paybill has specific documents required as will be shown on the portal, i.e., a Medical Paybill will require different documents from a Wedding Paybill.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the file format required to attach the documents?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Any format except ZIP file.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What size should the documents be?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can attach up to 10 MB per document required.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the required documents?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: When applying for the Short-Term Paybill, each type of Paybill has specific documents required as will be shown on the portal, i.e., a medical Paybill will require different documents than a wedding Paybill. Follow this link to view the various categories of documents required;https://m-pesaforbusiness.co.ke/apply

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A beneficiary is the recipient or the person in need of the funds collected on the Short-Term Paybill.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I know the progress of my application request?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Log in to the portal –https://m-pesaforbusiness.co.ke/and click on “my applications” tab. Only the applicant can view the status of the application.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does the solution work with both apps and websites?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the solution works for both apps and websites. However, for the solution to work as intended, both apps and websites should not have embedded links.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are embedded links?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: These are links to content that is not hosted on the Businessʼ actual online resource – Website, App or IP address.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if the Business has embedded Links e.g., 3rd party advertisements / banners that redirect traffic to other websites?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The business would have to undertake notification to its end user customers upon clicking on such a link, that they are navigating off the free sponsored online resource.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can the service work with only an URL as opposed to an IP address?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To ensure minimal exposure to risk, we require both the online resource IP address and the URL for the service to be provisioned.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can the service work with an IP address that is not static?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. The business's IP address must be static to ensure that the end user customers are not charged for dynamic content while on the sponsored website /app.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are there set up/ maintenance costs?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. However, a conditional monthly access fee (or minimum spend amount) of KES 50,000 (including VAT and Excise duty) shall be applied for the service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Upon receipt of all relevant documentation, technical configurations take 10 working days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are we able to cap usage/spend?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. This is achievable via a Daily Usage Limit per End User customer in MBs (FUP).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is deposit required for this service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: For new customers, deposit will be required as advised by our Credit Control team on a case-by-case basis. Customers that are currently deposit exempt will not be required to pay deposit.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can the customer terminate the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Service may be discontinued upon a written request from the business. The SLA for this requests is 5 days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can the customer terminate the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Service may be discontinued upon a written request from the customer. The SLA for this is 5 days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can a customer change or add a new IP address to the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. To change or add a new IP address, the business should fill in a new form with details of the new IP addresses they wish included. Change SLA is 4 days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are we able to share mobile numbers of the end user customers who access the business’s online resource with the business owner?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: As guided by CA regulations, we are not able to share customer mobile numbers with the business customer.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What type of reports are available to the business owner?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Reports will include:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who can use the B2C bulk payment service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This service is open to all registered entities including SMEs and Micro SMEs.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is a shortcode?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a Bulk payment number used by organizations to access the M-PESA web system and make payments to consumers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the B2C charges?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Please download the Tariff Form under the download section above.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the file format required to attach the documents?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Any format except ZIP file.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What size should the documents be?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can attach up to 10 MB per document required.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How long will it take to get a bulk payment number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Submitted applications are processed within 24hrs (Working days).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I know the progress of my application request?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Log in to the portal –https://selfservice.m-pesaforbusiness.co.ke/LNM/and click on the “My Applications” tab and enter the mobile number used at registration. Only the applicant can view the status of the application.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What does the various application status mean?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The following are the transaction statuses for your application.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does an organization deposit fund into the shortcode to make payments?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
An organization can make an RTGS transfer to the M-PESA holding account at NCBA, Co-operative Bank, Equity Bank, and KCB banks, quoting their B2C shortcode preceded by 333 as the beneficiary account number. E.g., If the customer’s shortcode is 123456 then the beneficiary account number is 333123456.
EFT and Cheque deposits can be made to the same M-PESA holding account using the A/C number.
Refer to the attached guide under the downloads section for the bank details.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I deposit funds into the wrong account details?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The request will be rejected, and funds will be reversed to your Bank account. Your bank will notify you accordingly.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I enter the outlet shortcode/business number without the prefix 333?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The request will be rejected, and funds reversed back to your Bank account. Your bank will notify you accordingly.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the advantage of this deposit process?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The deposit process offers the organization the following advantage.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How long will it take for the M-PESA float/funds to be available in my outlet/organization shortcode after making a deposit?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The fund will reflect on the Working/MMF Account at contrasting times depending on the channel used to make the deposit.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the types of accounts under B2C payment?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: There are 2 accounts for B2C payment.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the types of B2C payments available on the portal?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: There are two types of B2C payments.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the distinct roles in B2C payment?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Roles are a set of permissions on what a user created can and cannot do in the M-PESA system. B2C payment has 4 roles.
User-created by Safaricom.
The user is limited to creating and managing other users.
They are not able to view, initiate or approve transactions.
The user can view statements.
The user will upload the bulk file/ initiate transactions.
The user cannot approve/reject other transactions.
The user has the role to initiate a reversal.
The user cannot withdraw funds from M-PESA.
The user can view statements.
The user approves the bulk transaction uploaded.
The user can Approve/reject other transactions.
The user can withdraw funds from M-PESA.
The user has the role to initiate a reversal.
The user has view/read-only access.
The user cannot upload/ Initiate any transaction.
The User cannot approve/reject transactions.
The user cannot withdraw funds.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I initiate and approve the B2C payments?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. The B2C payment follows the maker-checker principle; that is one user (business operator) initiates the transaction and the other approves the transaction (business manager) for its successful completion.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I pay for non-Safaricom or non-M-PESA SIM cards?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can disburse funds only to Safaricom, Airtel Kenya or Telkom Kenya subscribers registered on the respective mobile money services such as M-PESA, Airtel Money and T-Kash respectively.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use B2C to make payments from my short code to another shortcode?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. B2C is for payments from Businesses to Customers’ mobile phones. Shortcode to shortcode payments consumesB2B (Business to Business) service..

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the maximum number of individuals can I pay at once when making B2C bulk payments?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The maximum number is 20,000.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the maximum amount you can pay an individual?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: An M-PESA registered can receive up to KSh 150,000 per transaction subject to the maximum customer account balance of KSh 300,000.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I make disbursements from a shortcode that has insufficient funds?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Individuals will receive the funds amounting to the balance of funds and the rest of the individuals will not receive it, and the transaction status reads failed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When making disbursements to an individual, are the withdrawal charges included?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The organization making the payment has a choice to send the exact amount or include the withdrawal charge. Further guidance is in the manual attached.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Should a customer have any queries, whom will they contact?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: For any customers queries

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Tunukiwa Dabo Dabo Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This service aims at giving our Prepay, PostPay & Hybrid Subscribers, the opportunity to access and buy personalised predefined airtime bundles that offer double the value of the purchase price.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I purchase the offer?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To purchase the offers, dial *444# and select option 0 “Kredo Dabo Dabo”. You can purchase the available personalised airtime offers as many times as you wish.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I use the airtime bundle resources?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The bundle resources will be used for on-net and off-net voice calls, SMS and pay-as-you-go data.You will not be able to use the bundle resources to purchase any subscription service such as Skiza or data bundles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I earn Bonga Points when I use Tunukiwa Airtime Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. Purchase of all Tunukiwa Bundles earns you Bonga points whenever you purchase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do Tunukiwa Airtime Bundles contribute to Stori-Ibambe target achievement?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All Tunukiwa offers are discounted and thus will not be considered in achievement of the Stori Ibambe target.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the offer’s validity?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The validity of the offer is specified at the time of purchase. Validities will range from 24 hours, 3 days, 7 days and 30 days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How frequently can I purchase?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can purchase multiple options at any given time throughout the day.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I transfer (Sambaza) my resources?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: CThe bundle resources cannot be transferred. To check your offer balance, dial *444# then select ‘Balance’.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are Jambo Tourist Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Jambo Tourist Bundles are designed to allow travellers connect to Safaricom network in Kenya. Travelers can enjoy better calls, data and SMS plans compared to international roaming rates.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is eligible?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Jambo Tourist Bundles are available to tourists visiting Kenya within their first 90 days on Safaricom network.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens after the first 90 days?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The customer will not be able to purchase the tourist bundles but can access all other bundle offerings on 100, 200, 444 and 544.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which resources are available for Jambo Tourist Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will get100min International Calling (52 countries)+8GB + 400 Min(Local Networks) +1000SMS + WhatsApp@Ksh2000 OR 30GB @Ksh 2000

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I purchase the Jambo Tourist Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will need to dial *444#> Global Connect which will display the available plan

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which purchase methods can I use to purchase the Jambo Tourist Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can purchase the Jambo Tourist Bundles via Airtime and M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check my Jambo resources balances?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can check the resources balances by dialing *444# or send SMS to 144 to display the remaining balances.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use the Jambo resources while roaming?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Jambo resources can only be used while in Kenya i.e., cannot be used while roaming.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I make international calls or send SMS using the Jambo Tourist Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: International Minutes can only be used to call the pre-selected international destinations. Other international destinations will be charged out of bundle rates i.e., Normal PAYG rates. All the other resources can be used to make local calls and SMS.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I Sambaza or transfer the Jambo resources?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Jambo resources cannot be transferred. However, you will be able to Sambaza Airtime from their main account and can also receive Airtime from 3rd parties.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times can I purchase the Jambo Tourist Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can purchase the Jambo Tourist Bundles as many times within the first 90 days on the network.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the purchase of another bundle extend the validity?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, purchase of another bundle will extend the validity of the existing Jambo Tourist Bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the Jambo resources rollover?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, unutilized Jambo resources will roll over if they re-purchase a similar Jambo Bundle before the expiry of 30 days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I deplete my Jambo Tourist Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Once you deplete the bundle, you will have access to unlimited WhatsApp valid until the bundle expiry date. Also, if you make calls, SMS, or browse you will charge out of bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I reverse the resources in case of an erroneous purchase?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, however partially utilized resources shall NOT be reversed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be awarded any Bonga points upon purchase of the Jambo Tourist Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you will earn Bonga points upon purchase of the Jambo Tourist Bundles according to the Bonga terms and conditions.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I get any Storo bonus once I purchase the Jambo Tourist Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you will accumulate Storo bonus points upon purchase of the Jambo Tourist Bundles if you have subscribed to the service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are International Calling Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The International Calling bundles enable customers to purchase a bundle for calls to USA, Canada, China and India

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I purchase a bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will be able to buy the international calling bundles via USSD (100# & *200#)

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check my bundle balance?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To check your bundle balance, dial *100# and *200#, Select Products and Services then select ‘International Calling Bundles’ then select Check Balance

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use my bundle to make calls to these destinations when roaming?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the bundle can only be used when making calls when in Kenya.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I rollover my unused minutes?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can rollover the unused minutes if you purchase another bundle before expiry of your current bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I earn Bonga points when I purchase the bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Bonga points earned will be on the bundle purchased

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I Sambaza my minutes once purchased?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, you cannot transfer the minutes purchased to another number.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the usage priority?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The usage priority is

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the M-PESA GlobalPay service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
This is a VISA virtual card that connects to the customer's M-PESA wallet. The M-PESA GlobalPay virtual card allows customers to pay international online merchants for products and services using their card credentials.
The card includes a 16-digit card number, the card's expiry date (mm/yy), and the security code, also known as CVV.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can one access this service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
M-PESA registered customer can join the GlobalPay service via GlobalPay Mini-App on M-PESA App.

On M-PESA APP:
▪ Log in to your M-PESA APP.
▪ Select the Grow Tab.
▪ Select the GlobalPay tab, to activate your M-PESA GlobalPay.
▪ Select your card color.
▪ Enter PIN.
▪ You will receive an SMS with the card number and expiry.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the customer be issued with a physical card?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. This is a virtual card that will be accessed through the GlobalPay Mini-App on M-PESA App.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the customer need an M-PESA account to get an M-PESA Virtual Card?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To open an M-PESA Virtual Card, one must first register for an M-PESA account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times may a customer apply for an M-PESA Virtual Card?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: After activating the first Card Credentials, you can only apply for up to four (4) new Card Credentials in a single year.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if a card expires?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
When the card expires, the cardholder can renew it using the M-PESA App.
The M-PESA statement on the renewed card account will continue to provide past transaction details.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the cardholder lose their M-PESA account if the Virtual Card is cancelled?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the M-PESA account will continue. However, the user will not be able to use the Virtual Card service until it is activated using the M-PESA App.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can the cancelled M-PESA Virtual Card be reactivated?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Cancelled cards cannot be renewed. However, once the current Virtual Card has been terminated, one can apply for a new one. This is limited to a maximum of four (4) new Card Credentials within one (1) year from activating the first card credentials.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What can be done to prevent a virtual card from being cancelled.
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To avoid Card cancellation due to inactivity, make sure to use it at least once every 3 months to complete any successful transaction.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can the M-PESA GlobalPay Visa virtual card be used to pay for purchases on any online merchant website?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Payment can only be made to international online merchants that accept VISA cards such as Netflix, Amazon, AliExpress, etc. For a transaction initiated to a local online merchant e.g., Jumia, the M-PESA Customer will receive an appropriate message on the checkout option advising them to use the Lipa na M-PESA option.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can the Private Card Details, Expiry Date and CVV be shared with third parties?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. These are confidential numbers that should not be shared with anyone, including Safaricom employees. Card details should not be disclosed to third parties since they could result in unauthorized or fraudulent transactions.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does deactivating repetitive payments cancel subscriptions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Disabling the repeat payments feature does not cancel subscriptions. Customers must visit the merchant site where they have put their card to cancel the services or remove their cards to avoid charging by the website.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if there is a disagreement on a payment made?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This happens when the cardholder is unable to reach an equitable solution with the participating retailer. All disputes must first be addressed with the Merchant in accordance with their respective dispute and refund policies.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many cards is a customer eligible for?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-PESA customers are only eligible for one card per ID. The service will only be available through the user's registered mobile phone. To convert to a new mobile number, the consumer must first deactivate the card and opt out of service before reactivating.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the minimum/maximum that can be paid using M-PESA GlobalPay?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-PESA customer M-PESA limits will apply, ranging from KSh 1 to KSh 250,000 per transaction, with a maximum limit of KSh 500,000. The minimum amount will vary depending on the current USD-KES exchange.(Note: The minimum amount is dynamic and equal to $1 to facilitate settlement procedures.)

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the charges for the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Safaricom will charge a 3.5% markup on the transaction value at the current FX rate for international payments. This will be dependent on the billing currency's (KSh) exchange rate to the currency used at the time of purchase, such as USD, GBP, etc. There will be no additional charges, such as the M-PESA transaction cost.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: In case of reversal, will the customer be refunded the full amount paid?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. In the event of a reversal, the total amount returned to the consumer does not include the 3.5% forex markup fee.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does my GlobalPay Card have an expiration date?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Card expires after three years. One will be alerted at least four times before the card expires, at the following intervals: - One month, seven days, three days, and one day to expiration.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the card become dormant if it is not used?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. A card will become dormant if it is not used for six months. However, one can activate immediately through the M-PESA App.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are there any exceptions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Some merchant categories are restricted on M-PESA GlobalPay Virtual Visa card, including gaming, gambling, money transfer services, and cryptocurrency.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can the M-PESA GlobalPay Visa Virtual Card receive funds?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the card cannot receive funds and is only used to make online payments. It utilizes the funds in the customer’s M-PESA account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can customers use Fuliza on the card?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Fuliza will not be available for M-PESA GlobalPay Payments.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is a CVV (Card Verification Value)?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a three-digit security number that appears on the card and is used for online payments to prevent fraudulent transactions. M-PESA GlobalPay CVV numbers are only valid for 30 minutes. Customers are encouraged to keep ALL of their card information private, including the CVV number.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can one use an expired CVV Number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Every time a payment is to be made, a CVV number will be generated, and it will be valid for only 30 minutes.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is a flash SMS?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a form of SMS that appears on the phone's main screen rather than being automatically put in the message inbox. The M-PESA GlobalPay service uses Flash SMS communications to protect the VISA Credentials..

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Set Budget functionality?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It is a service that allows users to track their expenses based on their selected budget and is strictly for informational purposes. The function does not prevent payments from being processed; instead, it warns the consumer as they approach and surpass their preferred set limit.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What constitutes a repeat payment?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A repeat payment occurs when a client approves or permits a business to automatically debit the cardholder's M-PESA wallet for recurrent purchases, such as NETFLIX subscriptions.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the cardholder be needed to enter an M-PESA PIN for repeat payments to be processed?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Once the card credentials are entered into a merchant website for any subscription services and the repeat payment functionality is enabled, the payments will not require the user to enter their M-PESA PIN in the following billing cycle. The funds will be automatically taken from your M-PESA account. Customers are urged to maintain their card number, validity period, and CVV details secret and private to prevent others from utilizing their card details for subscription services, since they will be deducted without their authorization.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if there is a double deduction from your virtual card?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: When duplicate deductions occur, the merchant normally refunds the amount within 72 HRS. However, if the customer does not receive a refund in M-PESA within 72 hours, they should contact the retailer directly using the link/email address provided on their website. If no support is received after 7 days, one can file a disagreement with Safaricom using the disagreement Form for additional assistance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who should a follow up be done with in case of a pending reversal?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Before filing a dispute, the customer is expected to comply with the merchant's cancellation and refund policy. All pending reversals should be followed up with the Merchant to which the payment was made. Please complete the escalation form that the merchant has supplied on their web platform. Please keep in mind that escalations made through merchants have a shorter SLA (Service Level Agreement) than those made through Safaricom, which can take up to 45 days, according to VISA standards.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the charges for this service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will not be charged to make payments for online purchases from global merchant sites. However, a 3.5% forex markup applies to the billing currency's current forex rate at the time of purchase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the cost estimator feature?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a feature that shows the customer an estimate of the total cost. The actual cost is influenced by the dynamic fluctuations in foreign exchange rates.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I become a Safaricom supplier?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: One can express interest to become a Safaricom supplier by registering with us and passing our prequalification process.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I register/express interest to become a Safaricom supplier?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Registration can be done through our Prospective Supplier Registration Portal available on our website:https://egjd.fa.us6.oraclecloud.com/fscmUI/redwood/supplier-registration/register-supplier/register-supplier-verification?id=Y3QK6WkvK4KjAQt0ynz0qFUqqDI5qOUn9TC%2BdeE%2Foho6erYZdOS5sUX0pA%3D%3D
The registration will be reviewed and your company will be advised on the way forward

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What information is required during registration?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: During registration you will be requested to provide your company’s registration and tax information, contact details, directorship, references, products and services and to attach your company profile and registration certificates, and to express interest in specific category(ies) of supply.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How long will it take for me to get feedback on my registration request?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Feedback on the registration requests will usually be provided within 5 working days upon receipt of the registration request.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the next action after a successful registration?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The submitted documents will be reviewed and the registration will either be approved or rejected.If the Approved RFQ suppliers will receive supplier’s prequalification questionnaire which they will be required to respond to within the stipulated time.Suppliers in below categories: sponsorship, statutory bodies and schools are registered for payment purposes and hence once their registration is approved they are not subject to prequalification.The evaluation once completed, the outcome of either success or failure for prequalification is communicated to supplier, users and the category manager.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What aspects are considered by Safaricom for Prequalification?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The prequalification covers the following areas: Financial Capacity, Health and Safety, Licensing; Partnerships and Accreditations, Insurance,Management Policies, Business experience for the relevant supply category, Probity and Litigations, and any Conflicts of Interest.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How long does the prequalification process take?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The pre-qualification process takes 10 working days. This however varies depending on the quality of submission received from the supplier. Where information is missing or not adequately provided by the supplier, the period of pre-qualification may be extended to allow the supplier to submit or resubmit the relevant information before the pre-qualification is finalized.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I get feedback on my prequalification status?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes.Safaricom will evaluate your response and provide feedback through the contact particulars provided at the time of registration.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are there manuals or guide that can assist on how to go about the registration and prequalification?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes.The manuals and guides are available in our company website:http://www.safaricom.co.ke/about-us/suppliers/supplier-tools-and-support

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will my company get business from Safaricom once it has passed the prequalification process?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The purpose of our supplier registration and prequalification process is to identify and evaluate potential suppliers who may subsequently be invited to tender for specific goods and services should a requirement arise in the specific category. There’s therefore no guarantee that a pre-qualified supplier will be invited for a tender within any specific time frame as a requirement may not necessarily arise in the category of pre-qualification during that time frame.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does a supplier need to know or pay someone to get prequalified with Safaricom?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No.Our prequalification process is free, fair and transparent and a potential supplier does not need to know anyone in Safaricom to be prequalified. Safaricom maintains strict ethics guidelines which are to be adhered to by all partners and staff. The supplier code of conduct can be accessed through the following address:http://www.safaricom.co.ke/about-us/suppliers/safaricom-policies-andprocedures

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where or who do I contact for assistance?How do I become a Safaricom supplier?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can get assistance on any aspect of the supplier registration and prequalification process through the below contacts: E-mail:This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many devices can I use on the Safaricom Wi-Fi network?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is my username and password for the Safaricom Wi-Fi Zone?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I download a PO?
What is the M-PESA Bill Manager?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
The M-PESA Bill Manager is a robust billing platform that gives businesses and their customers a one stop end to end platform for invoicing, receipting and real-time payment reconciliation.
Businesses can issue invoices, send payment reminders, update M-PESA payments in real-time, and reconcile other payments from a simple and secure access portal.
Customers receive their bills through SMS notification on their phones and access their invoices for payment via their phones by simply dialing *334# or via My M-PESA APP

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who qualifies to use the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The service is available to all businesses that register for the M-PESA Bill Manager portal. Customers can access issued bills and make payments by simply dialling *334# from their mobile phones or via My M-PESA APP.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I register for M-PESA Bill Manager
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Businesses with existing Paybill numbers will simply sign up through: https://billmanager.m-pesaforbusiness.co.ke

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the requirements to access M-PESA Bill Manager?
What are the charges for M-PEA Bill Manager?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Registering for the portal is free.
Standards M-PESA Paybill charges apply.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is the portal secure?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. Access to the portal is only to authorized users who are created by an administrator and a one-time password is sent to the user whenever access to the portal is required. All data is managed in accordance with the Kenyan data protection and cyber security laws that Safaricom adheres to.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can information be customized on the portal?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. Certain features can be customized, e.g., the school logo on statements.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are businesses and their customers charged for the notification received?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, SMS notifications are Free.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who creates/adds users?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The administrator creates all the users and assigns them roles. The administrator enters the user’s email address and phone number, assigns them roles, and sends the invite. The administrator can also suspend, delete, and edit the users.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Black Friday with Lipa na M-PESA campaign?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The campaign seeks to reward M-PESA customers with an incentive.Customers will get an automatic cash back for using M-PESA (Buy Goods option) to pay for goods and services at participating malls and outlets.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When will the campaign run?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The campaign will only be valid on 27th November 2020.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will customers be rewarded?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-PESA customers will receive a 5% cash back of their total spend value, which will be credited to their M-PESA accounts.For amounts over Ksh 20,000, customers will receive an automatic Ksh 1,000 cash back.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will customers have to wait for the cash back inventive after paying?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. customers will receive their cash backimmediatelyafter completing their payment using Lipa na M-PESA – Buy Goods option.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will customers receive the cash back?

Customers will receive a cash back from the number543276 – Lipa Na M-PESA Cashback.Sample message below:

Dial the new M-PESA *334# to send money.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: In case of any reversal, will the cash back amount also be reversed?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Should there be a reversal, the cash back amount will also be reversed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who can customers contact in case of any issue with their cash back amount?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: In case of any customer issue about the cash back, customers can call Line 234, Line 100 or Line 200. Customers can also use the Safaricom social media channels for additional assistance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Data FREE 500Mbs Campaign?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a data campaign where customers are assigned a daily data offer or (purchase a data bundle for a value equal or greater than their daily offer) and thereafter awarded FREE 500MBs that expires at midnight.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I get the FREE 500MB when I purchase a bundle of a higher amount than the offer presented?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. The FREE 500MB bundle is awarded upon the purchase of the daily offerorwhen the customer purchases a bundle higher than the offer allocated.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I Sambaza the Free 500MB?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You cannot Sambaza or transfer FREE resources.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the validity period of the free 500MB?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The FREE 500Mb bundle will be valid until midnight.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the bundle rollover?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The FREE 500Mbs bundle will not roll over to the next day, however, the bundle bought with the airtime or M-PESA is non-expiry.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times do I get awarded the 500MBs?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The FREE 500Mb bundle is only awarded once a day.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I view my daily offer?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customer dials *544# and select option zero to view their daily offer.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which bundles qualify for the free 500MB?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Only NON EXPIRY Bundles on USSD *544# and *555# (Blaze Non-Expiry) qualify for the free 500MB.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If I purchase bundles in small amounts, do I get the free 500MB?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. the Free 500 MBs are awarded only when you buy the bundle specified for you or a higher amount of the NON EXPIRY Bundles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the order of priority in terms of usage?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The free 500MB will be utilized first before any other bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Why is this information required and why is Safaricom collecting this information?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: As a regulated and licensed financial institution, we are required to identify and collect beneficial ownership information for all our business customers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Why is this update necessary?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This update is required to ensure compliance with recently enacted regulations and to maintain the accuracy of beneficial ownership information.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is considered a beneficial owner?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Beneficial owners are individuals who ultimately own or control a legal entity. This includes individuals with a certain percentage of ownership or control.
The Proceeds of Crime and Anti-Money Laundering Regulations, 2023(POCAMLA), defines a beneficial owner asa person who ultimately owns or controls a customer or the person on whose behalf a transaction is being conducted, and any person who ultimately exercises effective control over a legal person or arrangement.
A beneficial owner of a company is a natural person who meets any of the following conditions with respect to the company:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Information will be collected by filling out and uploading required information & documentation through this secure portal (My Safaricom Partner Portal) accessible only to authorized individuals registered with our company. User guides on how to navigate the portal have been provided separately .
The information can only be submitted by:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What type of information is required?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Key details include particulars of the beneficial owners, personal identification details, Percentage Ownership, a copy of the BOF1 form among other details. A detailed list of requirements has been shared to your official company email address. Please contact us through any of the channels provided on item No. 13 to request for the list of requirements.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When will the portal be accessible?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The portal can be accessed by clicking on the link here -My Safaricom Partner Portal

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is the provided information secure?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the portal is designed with robust security measures to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the submitted information.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the disclosed beneficial ownership information of a company be accessible to the general public?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: NO.The beneficial ownership information disclosed by companies to the Registrar of Companies or to Safaricom will not be available to the public. A company is only allowed to use or disclose beneficial ownership information if:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What if I do not submit my Beneficial Ownership information?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Failure to comply to the Companies Act shall attract a regulatory fine on the Company and each of its officers and may lead to de-registration of your company from the Registrar of Companies.
Failure to provide beneficial ownership information to Safaricom, may result in disruption in services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the process of declaring my beneficial ownership information with BRS?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I declare beneficiaries if my company is owned by another company?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Companies where the shareholder is a corporate body, beneficial ownership is held indirectly, and the company will be required to provide the beneficial owners’ particulars of that body corporate. Upon uploading the Beneficial ownership Form (BOF1), you will be required to upload the company ownership structure of your company indicating the relationship with the parent corporate body.
