https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Western Union is a company that offers money transfer services to every country that has partnered with Safaricom to allow M-PESA registered customers to send money to recipients in different countries.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is a Country ISO?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a 2 LETTER abbreviation for country names e.g., ZA for South Africa, TD for Chad, KE for Kenya, UG, TZ, etc. ISO may not always be the first two letters of the country name.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is a secret word?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: When sending funds to South Africa the sender is required to input a secret word. The recipient will be required to have the secret word details at the collection point to receive the funds.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I request a reversal?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. The full amount and double payment reversals are allowed, and you can request one by contacting customer care. Partial amount reversals will not be possible.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is CRB?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A Credit Reference Bureau is a firm that collects information from various sources and provides consumer credit information on individual consumers for a variety of uses, for example, it provides information on individuals borrowing and paying habits.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the CRB score or rating?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is an individual's credit score given by a CRB using the individual’s credit history which is how well you have performed on all previous loans and how well you are performing on your current loan (s). For example, are you defaulting on any loan? Do you pay all your loans on time?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I clear my negative listing at CRB?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
You have to fully repay your defaulted loan(s) to the respective financial institution(s) and apply for a clearance certificate from the CRB.
After successfully clearing your negatively listed loans, the record may remain on your account for up to five years.
To improve your score, you must improve your repayment behavior on all your current and future loans, that is paying loan(s) on time.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check my CRB score and listing?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can click on this link on your mobile phone (Google Chrome Browser recommended) to get a comprehensive report from Credit Info, which is one of the Credit Reference Bureaus. They charge Kshs. 50 for a report.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does a negative CRB listing affect my account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A negative listing can limit you from accessing future loans from financial institutions.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: My repayment did not reflect, and I have been charged extra fees, what do I do? ?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If you were charged additional fees because the repayment made did not reflect on time, you are eligible for a waiver. Call Safaricom Customer Care Line 100 to initiate the waiver request. The waiver should reflect in less than 48 hours after it is requested.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who do I contact if I have any questions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: For support and inquiry, customers should contact.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is "Fly with Bonga Points"?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: "Fly with Bonga Points" is a campaign stemming from a partnership between Safaricom and Kenya Airways allowing customers to redeem their Bonga Points for Kenya Airways' tickets. The rewards currently being offered are for domestic destinations

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many Bonga Points do I need to participate?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The number of Bonga Points needed to redeem a Kenya Airways ticket depends on the destination, flight type and ticket class. The complete rate is as below:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check if I have sufficient Bonga Points?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To check your Bonga Points, simply dial *126# selectoption 1: "Enquire your Bonga Points".You will receive an SMS notification with details of your Bonga account balance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I redeem my Bonga Points for a ticket?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To redeem your Bonga Points, simply dial *126# select option 2: "Redeem your Bonga Points" then select the "Free Kenya Airways Tickets" reward. NOTE: You will need to provide a booking reference number issued by Kenya Airways to complete the transaction

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I book my flight?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To book your flight, visit any Kenya Airways Sales Office, call their contact centre on 0711 024 747 or email them onThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.Kenya Airways will issue you with a reference number which you can then use to redeem your Bonga Points.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If I do not have enough Bonga Points, can I add cash or M-PESA to complete the transaction?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. You are required to provide the full amount of Bonga Points. If you do not have the full value, you can use the points transfer service to get points from friends and family.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I cancel my ticket? Do I get my Bonga Points back?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Once you redeem your Bonga Points and been issued with a ticket, you cannot get your Bonga Points back. The Kenya Airways cancellation rules will apply at this point.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who should I contact in case of a cancellation?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Please contact the Kenya Airways Sales Office or contact centre. Please note that the Kenya Airways cancellation rules will apply.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I have applied for a refund. How do I check the status of my refund request?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To check the status of your refund, call Kenya Airways on +254 20 642 2764/5, +254 20 642 2912 or emailThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I make a flight booking via the Kenya Airways call centre?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To make a reservation, please call Landline: +254-(0)20-327 4747 or Mobile: 0711 024 747. Note that these calls are all chargeable

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I enroll for the Bonga Points Loyalty Program?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Simple dial *126#and select option 3: to enrol to Bonga Points. Alternatively send an SMS with the word Bonga to 125

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are there any extra charges when I pay for my Kenya Airways ticket using Bonga Points?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Only the Bonga Points value of the ticket will be deducted from your Bonga balance when you redeem.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Digital TV & Internet is a smart Set-Top Box powered by Android that provides you with the simplest way to stream movies and TV shows to your TV. You can also play games, watch Live TV and much more

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What do I get with the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box will turn your TV into a “Smart” TV. You will be able to:i. Stream movies and TV shows from apps like Showmax.ii. Mirror content from your phone or tablet to your TV screen.iii. Download movies and videos for offline viewing. These will be stored on the 32GB internal storageiv. Create a Wi-Fi hotspot with up to 8 users.v. Stay connected in the event that there is no fibre connectivity using the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box 3G/4G data bundles easily purchased through *400# orwww.safaricom.com/bigboxvi. Access external files like videos and music and watch on your TV using the USB port on the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box.vii. Watch movies, series, news and kids’ shows on apps such as Showmax, YouTube, YouTube Kids, Deutsche Welle which come pre-loaded on the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box. This includes Gameloft for all you gamers.viii. Download your preferred App through the Google Play Store on your Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box.ix. Access more than 50 Free to Air (FTA) Live and / or Local channels such as KTN, Citizen and NTV. To access the live channels, simply connect your Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box to an antenna.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I set it up
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It’s easy! Simply follow the set-up steps as outlined on the installation guide to activate your device. In case of any queries, you can reach our support centre by dialling 400 from the contact mobile number provided during registration of the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where can I buy the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can purchase the box from Safaricom Shops in Nairobi, Mombasa, Nakuru, Eldoret and Kisumu.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the price of the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Safaricom Home Fibre customers with an active connection can purchase the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box at a discounted price of Ksh5,999 and at Ksh9,999 for customers currently not subscribed to Safaricom Home Fibre.You will also get to enjoy 3 months FREE subscription to Showmax.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I purchase the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box monthly internet bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Simply dial *400# on your Safaricom line, select Safaricom TV, select Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box then follow the simple instructions. Alternatively log on towww.safaricom.com/bigboxon the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box, select your preferred bundle and proceed to make payment via airtime.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What mobile number do I use to pay for the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box monthly internet bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Your Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box comes preloaded with a mobile number. The number is printed on a sticker placed at the bottom of the box and on the packaging. This mobile number will act as your account number and will be used to purchase the monthly internet bundles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I exhaust my Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box monthly internet bundles before the 30 day expiry period?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can purchase additional bundles by dialing *400# on your Safaricom line, select Safaricom TV, select Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box then follow the simple instructions. Alternatively log on towww.safaricom.com/bigboxon the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box, select your preferred bundle and proceed to make payment via airtime.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can my Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box monthly internet bundles roll over after the expiry period?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the bundles do not roll over. Additionally, purchasing a new bundle will not extend the validity of your existing bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I sambaza or share the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box internet bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, you cannot sambaza or share the bundles to another mobile number.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I get notifications on payments due or when my bundles are running?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you will receive a notification on your TV screen and via SMS on the mobile number that you used during registration and purchase of the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I remove the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box SIM card from the device?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box SIM card comes pre-installed in the box and hence cannot be removed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How should I get in touch with customer care in case I need assistance with the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can reach customer care by calling 400 using the contact mobile number provided during registration of the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box. If you do not have a Safaricom line, you can call customer care via 0722001100.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Bonga Bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a Service that will give Safaricom subscribers an opportunity to access and buy data bundles using their Bonga points at 1 Bonga point = 1 MB conversion rate.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What will be the conversion rate for buying Bonga Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Conversation rate when buying Bonga 121 Bundles will be at the rate of 1 point = 1 MB

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I access the Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will be able to access the service via short code *444*11# or under Tunukiwa Special, thereafter the offers will be made available via the other Bonga channels e.g. *126#, mySafaricom App and the web.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What will be the validity of the Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The validity of the bundles will be 1 week (7 days) and this will be presented to the customer at the time of purchase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the 1 to 1 conversion rate apply to all the other Tunukiwa data Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the 1 to 1 conversion rate will only apply to the Special Bonga bundles available from the above channels and the conversion rates will be indicated at the time of purchase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is advantage plus?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Advantage Plus is a value proposition from Safaricom that enables consumers on the path to success live an uninterrupted life by offering convenience, exceptional value, prestige and differentiated service benefits. Advantage Plus offers Safaricom PrePay and PostPay customers bundle plans geared to provide them with additional value of up to 85% plus the convenience that comes with having an integrated Voice, SMS and Data bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the advantages of the Advantage Plus plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You don’t have to worry about topping up every now and then as a PrePay customer You have a clear understanding of your charges Customers who subscribe to the Advantage Plus PostPay bundles will have access to line 200 You can control your budgets by having a fixed amount to spend on your mobile phone usage expenses You get an itemized bill at the end of the month when you sign onto Advantage Plus PostPay.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I subscribe to an Advantage Plus plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: a.) To purchase a PrePay plan For existing Safaricom PrePay Customers: Dial *100# and select “Advantage Plus” Select your preferred Advantage Plus Plan Select the PrePay option Select your preferred payment option i.e. Airtime or M-PESA To pay via M-PESA, enter your service PIN and confirm. For airtime options, the airtime will automatically be deducted from your main account You will then receive a notification on successful subscription to your preferred Advantage Plus PrePay Planb.) To purchase a PostPay plan For existing Safaricom PostPay Customers: Dial *200# and select the “Advantage Plus” option Select your plan of choice Accept the Terms and Conditions of service Submit the request You will then receive a notification on successful subscription to your preferred Advantage Plus Plan N:B. Your credit limit needs to be sufficient to cover for the cost of the bundle For Existing Safaricom PrePay Customers joining Advantage Plus PostPay Dial *100# and select your preferred Advantage Plus Plan Enter your National ID / Passport number Enter your email address (where your new PostPay bill will be sent) Confirm subscription and 1 month prepayment Accept the Terms and Conditions Pay the prepayment and 1st month’s usage via M-PESA Submit the request You will then receive a notification on successful subscription to your preferred Advantage Plus Plan and you will be migrated to the PostPay Hybrid tariff. New Customers (joining from other networks). Please visit your nearest Safaricom Shop to sign up. An original identification document such as a National ID or Passport

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the validity period of each Advantage Plus plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Because of the exceptional value being provided by the Advantage Plus value proposition and the fact that consumers have three options to pick a package that suit their needs, this package will be valid for 30 days from the subscription date after which they will be expired. Unutilized resources will NOT be rolled over after the expiry date.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I exhaust my advantage plus resources?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If you were previously on PrePay, you will be able to top up your line with airtime. If you were on an existing PostPay tariff before subscribing to the Advantage Plus Plan, then you can continue to use your credit up to your limit. Normal calling, SMS and Internet rates will apply. This will apply to the awarded resources separately e.g. when voice minutes are depleted but the subscriber still has SMS resources; voice will be charged out-of-bundle and the SMS in-bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I upgrade my bundle to a higher bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: YES. You can upgrade and downgrade your bundles based on what you qualify for. PostPay Hybrid customers (i.e. customers who were previously on PrePay) will need to visit any Safaricom Shop to upgrade their bundle plus top up their deposit to the value of the new bundle. Advantage PostPay customers will be able to upgrade or downgrade via *200#. Their credit limit needs to be sufficient to cover the additional cost

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I subscribe to the Advantage Plus plans if I am on the Karibu Postpay bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: YES. You can subscribe to the Advantage Plus Plan if you are on the existing Karibu PostPay 1050 or Karibu PostPay 2,700 bundles. Your existing resources will be moved to the new Plan and the prevailing expiry dates will apply. However, once you exit the Karibu PostPay Bundles you will not be allowed to move back.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I have multiple bundles running at the same time if i am on advantage plus postpay?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: NO. Multiple bundle subscriptions will not be allowed. You will have to unsubscribe from your existing bundle to subscribe to a new one.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when my bundle resources i.e. minutes, SMS, internet MBs expire?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The bundles will not be available for use once they have expired. They will be deleted from the subscriber’s account upon expiry.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I get a notification before I fully utilise my resources?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: YES. You will get notifications before you exhaust your bundle minutes, SMS and internet resources

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I transfer / sambaza bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: NO. The bundles are not transferable to other subscribers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I accumulate bonga points when i subscribe to the bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: YES. You will get Bonga Points upon subscription and renewal of the bundles as per the current Bonga Points accumulation rules.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I get additional services such as roaming and international calling whilst on the Advantage Plus plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: YES, you can get additional products and services as per existing product rules. However, you will need to top up your PrePay line with airtime or increase the credit limit of your PostPay line to access these services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What Advantage Plus plans are currently available?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Simply dial *100# on your PrePay line or *200# on your PostPay line and select your preferred Advantage Plus Plan under advantage plus option.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Sim Registration update?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This a process where you are required to verify your Sim Registration documents by clicking onhttps://bit.ly/37RIJFGor visiting any Safaricom outlets countrywide. This is in line with Communication Authority guidelines.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I know that I need to update my details?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can dial *106# and select option number one to check your Registration status.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What details are required to update my sim registration?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will be required to submit the following documentation: Identification Document used during Registration (Original) and Customer’s signature

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Should I carry a photocopy of my ID?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. The Safaricom Agent will scan your ID at the shop. Alternatively, you can upload your Original ID photo by clicking onhttps://bit.ly/37RIJFGand follow the simple steps

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I did not register my line using my National ID. I used a different registration document. How do I update my details?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You are required to update your Sim Registration details based on the registration document used for registration of your line. This includes Alien ID, Military ID or Passports.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I did not register my line using my National ID. I used another person’s (spouse/parent) registration details. How do I update my details?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The person that registered the line on your behalf can verify their Original ID details by clicking onhttps://bit.ly/37RIJFGand follow the simple steps. Should you wish to have the Registration details under your ID, you can both visit the nearest shop with your original IDs and request that ownership of the line be transferred to you.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I know the numbers which are registered using my ID?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *106# and access option 1: Check Registration Status to get a view of your status and numbers registered to your ID

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I still need to visit the registration point even when I view my numbers via *106# and confirm that they are ok?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Once you dial *106# and you are compliant, you do not need to visit the shop.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How long does the Sim registration update process take?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The process takes about 3 minutes to complete at the Safaricom Outlet. The agent will scan your original Identification document used during registration. These will be captured in the system together with your signature to complete your SIM registration process. Alternatively, self-update your sim registration and submit your Original ID details click onhttps://bit.ly/37RIJFGand follow the simple steps

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What will happen to mobile numbers that I have not identified during the process of Sim Registration?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: We will retain those numbers and verify their registration. If not claimed within the next 30 days, the lines will be recycled.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times can an agent update customer detail?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: An agent will capture your details once.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when the agent or Self Sim verification link has collected all my details?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The system will forward your details to Safaricom for checks and validations. You can Dial *106# to check the status of your registration at any time.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if 1 capture the wrong details (mobile number and ID) when during the process of self-sim registration update?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The agent will get a prompt from the system requesting them to capture the correct details.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is M-PESA Global?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This a service that will enableM-PESAregistered customers to send money to Mobile numbers, Banks and Western Union locations globally.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can one access this service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Download updated M-PESA app version or update current one to access the service

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the minimum/maximum amount one can send through M-PESA Global?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The minimum amount to send is KSHS 101 and maximum of KSHS 70000

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the charges for the service?
Can one send money to all Western Union agents globally?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This service is available in all countries except sanctioned countries e.g. North Korea and Syria.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can one send money to all Banks globally?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This service is currently available in Germany, China and UAE. Other countries will be included in due course.Send to Bank option is currently available on MySafaricom App only

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is a Country ISO?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a 2 LETTER abbreviation for country names e.g. ZA for South Africa, TD for Chad, KE for Kenya, UG, TZ, etc. ISO may not always be the first two letters of the country name.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is a secret word?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: When sending funds to South Africa the sender is required to input a secret word. The recipient will be required to have the secret word details at the collection point to receive the funds.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I get assistance?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: For all customer care queries, kindly call 100 or 200

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I purchase the new data bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The new data plans are available on *544#, *555#, mySafaricom app, Blaze app and www.safaricom.com/bundles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who can purchase the new data bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The new data bundles are available to all Safaricom customers (Prepay, Postpay and Hybrid)

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What can I use to purchase the new data bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can purchase the new data bundles using Airtime, M-PESA and Bonga points.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I purchase the new bundle for another number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes you can purchase for other number the Weekly, Monthly and All in one bundles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I extend expiry for the new data bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes you can extend expiry by purchasing a similar bundle before expiry of your current plan with the longest validity being assumed. Daily Bundles can roll over if you buy another daily bundle. Weekly /Monthly to roll over if you buy another weekly / monthly bundle

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I have set automatic renewal ?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All customers with automatic renewals will receive the new bundles as from Tuesday 29th March 2022

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can other people confirm my name before sending money?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Please note that other customers will also not be able to confirm your name when you opt out of the service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is BuuPass?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: BuuPass is a market place that provides ticketing solutions in an easy and convenient manner for buses, flights and train at the palm of your hand.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the advantages of booking through BuuPass?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can book your ticket from anywhere anytime using any device.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the advantages of booking through BuuPass?
Does booking online cost more?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, booking online onwww.buupass.comis at no charge, the same as over the counter.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Partners using the platform
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: We have 4 bus companies currently on the platform;

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I book a ticket?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Simply dial *877# using any Safaricom line or visitwww.buupass.comfor bookings.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I cancel or alter ticket details?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This can be done at the respective bus company office.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I get a resend or replace a lost ticket?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: CIn case of loss or no confirmation message received kindly contact our customer care on 0715763362 for assistance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where do I get/print a ticket?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Tickets are printed from the bus station office after presentation of the confirmation SMS.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What if I have booked multiple seats, but only one name appears on the confirmation SMS?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Kindly check if the number of seats captured in the ticket SMS matches the tickets paid for.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many tickets can I book?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Each customer is allowed to book tickets for a maximum of up to 5 seats.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What payment options do I have?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Currently M-PESA is the only available payment option.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I do not receive any M-PESA pop up prompting the payment?
How long does a payment time out take?
How to book for Departure and Destination
How do I select the seat by arrangements?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Seat arrangements depends on the bus company but far left and the far right are window seats.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does a time out occur when booking a ticket?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. This happens when a customer takes more than 3 minutes to key in their details especially using the USSD code *877#. Customers should key in their details in a timely manner.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I be able to book a specific date when I dial *877#?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. It is possible using the date format shown e.g. 31/05/2021.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Steps for booking via USSD
Steps for online/web booking, below are the steps;
Who is eligible?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: a. It’s available to all prepaid customers who meet the eligibility criteria.b. Dial *544# to check your eligibility.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which phones do I qualify for?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *544*5# and select from the available phones.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where can I collect the phone?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Visit any Safaricom shop or Safaricom Authorized dealer near you. You will need your ID card and a deposit of the selected device in your M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I make the repayments?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *544*5# or the Lipa Mdogo Mdogo App and select pay for daily, weekly, monthly or full payment.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I don’t pay?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Safaricom will lock the device and bar you from making calls/Smses.
Should you default for 30 days, you will be blacklisted and disqualified from other loan facilities and your details will be forwarded to the CRB.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can my M-PESA repayments be reversed in case of wrong transaction?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. An M-PESA reversal for an existing Lipa Mdogo Mdogo loan cannot be reversed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I get data bundles or free airtime when I make payments?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
• Yes. You will receive a free 1GB Data Bundle at the point of purchase.
• For each installment payment, you will receive a voice, data and sms bundle based on payment selected i.e; daily, weekly and monthly.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which mode of payment is available to pay for the phone?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will only be able to pay via M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I pay using Fuliza?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. You must deposit money on M-PESA to pay.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I purchase the phone for another person?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. You are at liberty to buy the phone for someone else. Please note that your registered line shall be responsible for repayments.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check my loan balance?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *544*5#, select Lipa Mdogo Mdogo, then check balance. Or check from the Lipa Mdogo App.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does the phone come with warranty?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The phones have a one year manufacturer’s warranty. Terms and conditions apply.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I pay the full amount at once?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. You have the option of paying in full if you have the funds on your M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many phones can I buy at ago?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will only be able to buy one phone at a time.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I return a phone after it has been activated?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, you must clear the loan as per the agreement.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is it possible to pay the loan for another number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. Dial *544*5# and choose pay for another option.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If I lose my phone how will I pay for the loan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *544*5# on and select pay. Customer can also use another Safaricom number to pay for the loan (dial *544*5#, select pay for another, enter number with the loan and pay).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does the Lipa Mdogo Mdogo app require data to unlock?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. You will require data bundles for app to connect and unlock.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I pay when the device is locked?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *544*50# to pay the accrued amount and unlock the simcard and the phone.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the validity of the resources awarded?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The validity of the resources will be dependent on the repayment mode the customer has picked. Daily(24hr) Weekly (7days) Monthly (30days).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I Sambaza or transfer resources?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, resources are not transferrable.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is M-PESA Business One Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a service that enables organizations to use one Lipa na M-PESA short code to collect and disburse funds. It combines the Paybill and B2C products in one short code.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does the M-PESA Business One Account work?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It combines the Paybill and B2C servicesin one short code. Organizations can receive Paybill   payments on their utility account and make B2C payments from the same.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is eligible for the M-PESA Business One Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All organizations and institutions that use or intend to use Paybill and B2C services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will organizations having both Paybill and B2C be required to use Business One Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. This is an optional service for those who want to use it. Organizations can still choose to have separate short codes for Paybill and B2C.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the organizations using Business One Account be assigned new products?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. There is no new product. Instead, they will have two products, Paybill Product and B2C Product in one short code.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I apply for the Business One Account solution?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
You can apply online viahttps://m-pesaforbusiness.co.ke/
You may also fill an application form and send back with the required documentation via email toThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
Kindly contact us through the support line below, or through the organization account manager for further assistance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the charges for this service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
The Paybill Tariffs (Business Bouquet, Customer Bouquet, and Mgao Tariffs) remain the same. Similarly, B2C tariffs remain unchanged. Click on the link below to view the tariffs.
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/personal/m-pesa/lipa-na-m-pesa/m-pesa-paybill

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Previously, the Paybill Business Web Operator role could not disburse funds. Does this change?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. On the Business One Account service, the Business Web Operator who is assigned to the Paybill product will now be able to disburse funds. However, any disbursement initiated must be approved by another operator with a Business Manager role. This change applies only to the organizations that will use this Business One Account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I download statements?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. On the M-PESA portal select Review Transaction>Account Type>Set Desired Start and End Date>Search>Export.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Biashara Smart mobile Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Biashara Smart offer is a prepay solution enabling Micro businesses to grow through bundling value-added services that address the needs of a growing business. The offer is for Micro and SME businesses as well as existing Pochi la Biashara and Lipa Na M-Pesa customers. The basic offer contains voice minutes, data and SMS. The advanced options may include closed user group, internet domain service or discounted smart phones, depending on the option you select.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which Biashara Smart Bundle is suitable for my business?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The bundle that you select depends on your payment preference. If your business runs on a monthly budget and you prefer to be billed monthly, then you should select the monthly version that suits you. Otherwise, you can select the daily option if it is more convenient to purchase as needed. However, it is important to note that selecting the monthly option will be more economical in the long run.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I get Biashara Smart mobile Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can get the Biashare Smart bundle by dialing *485# on your line. You can also get the bundle by dialling the pochi la biashara USSD *334# and selecting option “Pochi la Biashara” then selecting “Biashara Smart”.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I pay for my Biashara smart product?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The product is on a prepaid model hence you pre-purchase before use. The payment is made either via Airtime or M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check my balance for Biashara Smart?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can check your balance by dialing *544# on your line and selecting “balance & Tips”. If you do not see it on the first menu, select “more” which is option “98”.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If my bundle runs out, can I buy a new biashara smart bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can buy another bundle by dialing *485# and selecting the biashara smart option you require.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I renew Biashara Smart mobile product when it expires?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can renew your product by dialing *485# and selecting the biashara smart option you require.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I change my Biashara Smart product if I need a different one?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can change your product by dialing *485#.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will my Biashara Smart Bundle expire?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. The daily bundle expires after 24hrs and the monthly bundle expires after 30 days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens to my existing airtime or bundles when I move to Biashara Smart bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Priority in consumption will be given to the Biashara Smart resources, after which the prevailing prioritization in consumption attributed to your existing Tariff will prevail.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I need to deactivate “Data Manager” to browse the internet using Biashara Smart Data?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. The sponsor line will need to deactivate ʻData Managerʼ on *544# to browse at Biashara Smart preferential rates. However, your beneficiaries can browse with their ʻData Managerʼ on.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be able to browse or call when the Biashara Smart Bundle Expires?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. When your Biashara Smart resource runs out, you can top up your line with airtime and continue to enjoy preferential rates.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I earn Bonga Points while using Biashara Smart bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. You will be awarded Bonga Points equivalent to the value of your Biashara Smart Bundle subscription as per prevailing Bonga conversion rates. However, you need to have joined bonga points by dialing *126#.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is eligible for Biashara Smart Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The offer is open to business owners of small office / home office, micro and small businesses who can provide the below KYC documentation;

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I opt out from my Biashara Smart mobile service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The bundle is set as a one off. Hence you do not need to opt out. The daily bundle expires after 24 hrs and the monthly bundle expires after one month. Moreover, if the resources of the bundle get depleted then you line will continue using your regular tariff.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When do you send Postpay Invoices
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Invoices are normally shared by 3rd of every month.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I change my email address?
How do I get my refund?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Share an registered email with us and indicate the nominated mobile number or bank details i.e., Bank, Bank branch, Bank account and account name.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I make payments for my Postpay bill
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
You can make payment in 3 ways.
Contact line 200 if not successful.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When I am expected to pay my bills
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Payment should be done in full by 16th of every month to avoid disconnections.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Why don’t I receive my invoices.
How do I get back to prepaid or how do I terminate my Postpay account.

To go back to prepaid, kindly dial *200# and select terminate.
You will be required to settle any pending bill.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I terminate my corporate account
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Contact our team Safaricom SME @Safaricom.co.ke or enterprise business partner.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is advantage plus?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Advantage Plus is a value proposition from Safaricom that enables consumers on the path to success live an uninterrupted life by offering convenience, exceptional value, prestige and differentiated service benefits. Advantage Plus offers Safaricom PrePay and PostPay customers bundle plans geared to provide them with additional value of up to 85% plus the convenience that comes with having an integrated Voice, SMS and Data bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Kama Kawaida service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Kama Kawaida service is an established roaming zone by Safaricom in partnership with four of East Africa's leading mobile phone networks in Uganda, Tanzania, Rwanda and South Africa: MTN Uganda Uganda Telecom (UTL) Vodacom Tanzania MTN Rwanda Vodacom South Africa

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does the Kama Kawaida service work?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Kama Kawaida service automatically enables both the Safaricom and partner network subscribers to enjoy extended and seamless connectivity via preferential tariff rates on Voice, SMS and Data as they travel anywhere within the three East African countries.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the features of the Kama Kawaida service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It is available to all Safaricom PostPay subscribers. You do not need to migrate to any special roaming tariffs. You do not require prior roaming access. If on PostPay, you do not require any roaming deposit. If on PrePay you can top up your phone using both Safaricom and partner networks' recharge vouchers (scratch cards) via Safaricom's PrePay Roaming Top-up service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will my phone automatically select one of the Kama Kawaida partner networks when I travel within East Africa?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: When travelling in East Africa, whether for business or pleasure, your phone will automatically select the MTN Uganda, UTL, Vodacom Tanzania or MTN Rwanda network based on the visited country. Should another network be selected, you will need to manually select one of the preferred partner networks above to enjoy the preferential tariff rates under the Kama Kawaida service. To do this, go to the Network Setting option on your phone (handset dependent), set this to Manual and select the preferred/approved roaming network within your roaming destination.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will I be billed for Voice calls, SMS and Data usage while roaming on the Kama Kawaida service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will be charged the applicable rate as indicated in our tariff schedule.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I make calls and SMS back home and internationally while roaming on the Kama Kawaida service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: When calling home or internationally while travelling in East Africa, simply dial the country code, the area code followed the phone number, e.g., +254 722 123 456 for a mobile number, +254 20 123 456 for a landline number in Nairobi or +4477 123456789 for a phone number in the UK. Similarly, when sending an SMS back home or internationally, use the format indicated above, i.e. +254 722 123 456.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I top up my Safaricom PrePay line with Safaricom scratch cards on the Kama Kawaida service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will top up your Safaricom PrePay line with Safaricom scratch cards in the same way as you would when back at home (in Kenya), by simply dialling *141* Voucher PIN # and pressing the OK' or 'Call' button.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I access Customer Care services while roaming on the Kama Kawaida service within East Africa?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will simply dial the PrePay Customer Care number via +254 722 002 100. You will be charged the applicable rate indicated in the tariff schedule, i.e., the rate applicable to calls made back home (to Safaricom).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I sign up?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To subscribe, you will be required to visit a Retail Shop and: Fill out an application form Attach a copy of your ID to the application form Make payment:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I Increase the limit if initial deposit is not enough?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: One can pay deposit equivalent to the limit required above the basic Kes. 2000 activation

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How easy is the application process?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You are only required to go to their nearest Safaricom Shop and fill out a simple application form and attach a copy of your ID.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What will be the limit for the additional line if I qualify?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Will be Kes. 2000, however one can pay deposit equivalent to the limit required above the basic Kes. 2000 activation.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is my Credit Limit?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Credit limit is equivalent to the deposit.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is a cheque accepted for deposits?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. All deposits must be in cash.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where can I roam?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can roam in over 200 networks around the world. The list of available destinations can be found on http://roaming.safaricom.co.ke/

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I make calls and send SMSes while roaming overseas?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Call any destination within the country you are visiting by simply dialling the relevant area code and number. To call home (Kenya) : Dial + 254 followed by the desired number, e.g., Safaricom mobile, dial +254 7xx xxxxxx, or Nairobi landline, dial +254 20 xxxxxx. To call other countries: Dial + country code, area code, number, e.g., UK + 4477 xxxxxxxxx. To send an SMS to Kenya or internationally: Type your message and send to the number as above..

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is DigiFarm, and what does it do?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: DigiFarm is a subsidiary of Safaricom PLC dedicated to transforming the lives of smallholder farmers. We provide digital solutions and services tailored to the needs of farmers, providing access to farming loans and insurance, access information on weather and farming practices, access to markets and other services including soil testing, mechanization and irrigation.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What types of services does DigiFarm provide?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: DigiFarm provides a variety of services, including access to farm input loans, farmer cash advance loans, access to weather information and farming practices and market linkages. Dial *944# to register and check the services available for you.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does DigiFarm leverage technology to benefit farmers?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: DigiFarm harnesses the power of digital technology, including mobile phones, to deliver small holder farmer loan products, farming information and services directly to farmers' fingertips. This enables farmers to access timely farm input loans and relevant information, make informed decisions, and improve their farming practices.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is DigiFarm accessible to all farmers in Kenya?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, DigiFarm is accessible to all farmers across Kenya, regardless of location or farm size. Our digital platform is designed to reach farmers even in rural remote areas, ensuring that all smallholder farmers have access to the support and resources they need to increase their production.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does DigiFarm contribute to the transformation of farmers' lives?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: DigiFarm aims to empower farmers by providing them with the access to finance, tools, knowledge, and resources they need to improve their production, increase their income, and enhance their overall well-being. By using technology and innovation, we strive to make a positive impact on the lives of smallholder farmers and their communities.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is DigiFarm connected with Safaricom?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: DigiFarm is a subsidiary fully owned by Safaricom PLC, Kenya's leading telecommunications company. As part of Safaricom, DigiFarm benefits from its extensive network and resources to better serve farmers across the country.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the DigiFarm USSD Farmer Platform?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The DigiFarm USSD Farmer Platform is a mobile service designed to empower farmers with access to crucial information, services, and support directly through their mobile phones using USSD technology.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I register for the DigiFarm USSD Farmer Platform?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To register, simply dial *944# from your mobile phone and follow the steps.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens after dialling *944#?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: After dialling *944#, you will be guided through the registration process step by step.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the terms and conditions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Upon dialing *944#, you will be asked to review and accept the terms and conditions of using the USSD Farmer Platform. Please read these carefully before proceeding.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What information do I need to provide during registration?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will be asked to enter your national ID number and select your region from a list of options from region level, county, sub-county to ward level.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the purpose of selecting my region?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Selecting your region helps us provide you with location-specific information, services, and support tailored to your farming needs and challenges.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the next step after selecting my region?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: After selecting your region, you will be prompted to indicate your farming activity, under categories such as cash crops, livestock, etc.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are farming activities?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Farming activities represent different sectors of agriculture, such as crops, livestock, fisheries, etc. Selecting your farming activity helps us deliver tailored relevant information and services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I opt into the DigiFarm loan product?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To opt into the DigiFarm loan product, dial *944# from your mobile phone and follow the prompts.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What steps are involved in opting into the loan product?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Upon dialling *944#, select the option for Loans then proceed to “Loan Opt In" and follow the subsequent prompts to complete the opt-in process.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are there eligibility criteria for accessing the DigiFarm loan product?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, After the farmer Opt Into loan product, farmers will be scored, and a loan limit will be communicated to them. Factors such as your farming activities, repayment history, and creditworthiness may be considered.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How soon can I expect to receive the loan after opting in?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Immediately after Opting into loan services the farmer can check their loan limit depending on loan availability for your farming activity and region. To utilize the loan limit the farmer will be directed on where to access the farm inputs and services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What repayment options are available for the DigiFarm loan product?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: There are two loan repayment options available for DigiFarm loans.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is there a limit to the loan amount I can access through DigiFarm?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Loan amounts will be subject to eligibility criteria and assessment of your farming activities and creditworthiness. Please follow the prompts during the opt-in process for more information on available loan amounts.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I opt out of the loan product if I change my mind?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you can opt out of the loan product at any time by following the prompts within the DigiFarm *944# USSD platform ONLY after clearing all existing loans.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is my information secure when applying for the DigiFarm loan product?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, we prioritize the security and privacy of your information. We employ encryption and adhere to strict data protection measures to safeguard your data during the loan application process.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does credit redemption work on the DigiFarm *944# USSD Farmer Platform?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The USSD Farmer Platform offer Loan redemption services based on your farming activities through Digifarm selected agrovets. You can redeem credits for various purposes such as farm inputs, mechanization, equipment, or other agricultural needs.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is there a fee for using the USSD Farmer Platform?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, DigiFarm USSD Platform is a Free dial services provided to our farmers. However, accessing Loans, advisory services provided by the platform has some applicable fees and charges.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I access the USSD Farmer Platform from any mobile phone?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, if your mobile phone supports USSD technology and is connected to Safaricom mobile network, you can access the USSD Farmer Platform.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What languages are supported on the USSD Farmer Platform?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The platform supports English and Kiswahili languages to cater to the diverse farming communities. You will be prompted to select your preferred language during the registration process.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I contact customer support for help?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: For any inquiries or help, you can contact our customer support team through our call center by dialing 100 for FREE for registered farmers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Back to School with Lipa na M-PESA Campaign?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a campaign that will target M-PESA customers (parents) who will use Lipa na M-PESA (Buy goods + Paybill options) to pay for goods and/or services at selected retail outlets.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How long will the campaign run?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The campaign will run from 28th Dec 2020 to 3rd Jan 2021.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will M-PESA customers be rewarded??
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Sample message:
Congratulations! You have received Ksh. 123 from the M-PESA Back to School Campaign on 29/12/20 at 11: 11PM. Dial the new M-PESA *334# to send money.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the cash back be immediate?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the cash back will be credited to the customers M-PESA account immediately a successful payment is made.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which outlets will be participating in the campaign?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The followingselectoutlets countrywide, will be participating:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: In case of a reversal will the cash back amount also be reversed?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, in the event of a reversal, the cash back will also be reversed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who can customers contact in case of any issue with their cash back amount?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: In case of any customer issue about the cash back, customers can call Line 234, Line 100 or Line 200.Customers can also use the Safaricom social media channels for additional assistance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Lipa Na M-PESA Do More promotion?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Lipa Na M-PESA Do More Promotion is an 8-week promotion to reward businesses for collecting payments and using Lipa Na M-PESA. The promotion is entry-based; 1 entry will be awarded for every KShs.100 and above collected or transacted via Lipa Na M-PESA Buy Goods.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When will the promotion start?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The promotion will run from 8th January 2020 to 5th March 2020.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which Lipa Na M-PESA transactions qualify for the promotion?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All transactions done from the till qualify for the promotion

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will a Lipa Na M-PESA merchant till be required to opt in?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Any Lipa Na M-PESA transaction over KShs.100 accepted on your till at the beginning of the promotion will automatically opt in the merchant..

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will Lipa Na M-PESA merchants:
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
1.Check their points?
Dial *234# from the nominated number
2.Check winnings?
Dial *234# from the nominated number

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When and how will the draws be done?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Biweekly merchant draws will be done every Monday. The grand prize draws will be done on 5th March 2020. All weekend draws (Saturday and Sunday) will be done on Monday, together with the Monday draws. Public holiday draws will be done on the next weekday of working day as the case may be.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will merchants be informed of their winnings?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Grand Prize and Biweekly winners will only be contacted through the official Safaricom Number 0722 000000. Daily winners will be contacted via SMS, whose header will be ‘LIPA NA M-PESA’.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If a transaction is reversed, will the entries be reversed as well?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. The entries will be reversed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: In case of any query who can be contacted?
What is Internet For Business?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a fast, affordable and reliable internet connectivity for small to medium sized businesses. Safaricom Business Fibre is a high-speed, cost-effective internet service designed specifically for business customers, offering reliable and fast connectivity.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How is Business Internet billed?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Safaricom Business Internet is billed on a prepay or postpay basis. You will receive an invoice on the 1st of each month, with payment due by the 16th. The first bill will include prorated charges for the onboarding month and the full charge for the following month.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I report issues with my Business Internet service?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How long does it take to install Safaricom Business Internet?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Installation begins after payment is received and is typically completed as quickly as possible. Our installation partners will contact you to schedule the setup once your order is processed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Shiriki Prepay Airtime?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It is a prepay plan that Business Owners and or Customers (referred to as Sponsors) can share communication resources depending on their changing requirements for calling, browsing and SMS.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does the customer buy?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: By Dialing *234*11# and Select the plan as per their needs.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who do we refer to as a Sponsor and Beneficiary?
What is the Validity of the plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The plans are valid for 30days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the Purchase modes?.
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-PESA, Airtime and Fuliza.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the mode of Payments?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Buy Once or Auto-Renew (Applicable only for Airtime)

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which tariffs qualify to buy the Shiriki Prepay Airtime?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All-Apart from PostPay.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I buy Shiriki Prepay Airtime If I have an Okoa Jahazi outstanding Debt?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: As the sponsor buys the plans, they will get a prompt to pay the outstanding Okoa on the same purchase journey.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does a Shiriki Sponsor/Beneficiary get help/Support for any queries or clarifications they may have?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Sponsors can call business support by calling 2222 or 200 or email toThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.and most importantly, their Sales Manager in EBU. Beneficiaries retain their respective support line as 100.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Service Change (termination, upgrade, or downgrade)
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a prepay plan. Should a sponsor require a different plan, all they need to do is purchase it by dialing *234*11#.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will a Sponsor add beneficiaries?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *234#, select ‘’Shiriki Plans for Business’’, then select “Add Beneficiary” option. Follow the prompts.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the notification messages to the Shiriki Sponsor when adding a beneficiary?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
SCENARIO
NOTIFICATION TO SHIRIKI SPONSOR
Beneficiary MSISDN entered isnotofthecorrectlength
Dear Customer, You have entered an Invalid Number. Please ensure that the number starts with a zero(0) and the length of the number is 10. Thank you
Beneficiary MSISDN entereddoes not exist (Example an Competitor MSISDN)
