https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will I allocate beneficiaries a limit?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *234*11#, select ‘Add Beneficiary, Enter the Beneficiary Number, Nick Name and Limit. A beneficiary can only enjoy Shiriki rates up to the allocated amounts. After exhausting the assigned limit they shall need to top up and be charged prevailing rates on Uwezo.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How to remove beneficiaries?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *234*11#, then select “Remove Beneficiary” option. Follow the prompts.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If am on Auto-Renew, Can I purchase a plan before 30days validity are over?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, and the anniversary date will be adjusted to 30days from the date of the new purchase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I Sambaza / share my Shiriki airtime?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. The plan does not allow Sambaza airtime. The plan only allows sharing resources with selected beneficiaries by allocating them a limit.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check my balance as a Shiriki sponsor?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: By dialing USSD code *234# and selecting the “Check Balance” option and select sponsor number.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check the balance as a Shiriki beneficiary?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Beneficiary balance check is not available currently. The Sponsor can however check balance for beneficiaries under their Shiriki Plan.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I earn bonga points once I enroll to the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. The Sponsor will be awarded Bonga Points equivalent to the value of your Shiriki subscription as per prevailing Bonga conversion rates.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be able to browse if I have My Data Manager?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No/Yes?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Usage Prioritization for Shiriki PrePay plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Shorter validity bundles are used first. Example, if a sponsor has a 24hour validity, that will be used before the 30day Shiriki Prepay Airtime.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I roam on Shiriki Plan for Business resources?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. You will need to top up your line with normal airtime to be able to roam. The International Calling is supported for only Zone A (India, China, Canada and USA). Normal international calling rates apply for all other countries. Prevailing roaming charges for calling and browsing will apply and will be deducted from the airtime value.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do Shiriki Prepay Airtime get exhausted?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. This is dependent use patterns of the sponsor, and beneficiaries if any.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I buy data bundles via *544# if I am on the Shiriki Plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. Customers can top-up their line with normal airtime and buy data bundles via *544#.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How long will the SMS Promotion run?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The promotion will run for 90 days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I participate in the Promotion?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A customer must buy any SMS bundle to win. The SMS bundles are accessible via *444*8#

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will the winners be selected?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The winners will be selected randomly.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will the Airtime and SMS prizes be awarded?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Winnings are awarded immediately

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I sambaza the airtime or SMS Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The airtime won is not transferable

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I pay for Okoa jahazi using the airtime prize?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Airtime awarded cannot be used to pay for ETU

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the new tariffs about?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Following the enactment into law of the Finance Act 2023, effective 29th July 2023, we will be reviewing ourM-PESApricing to reflect the increase in Excise Duty rate on fees charged on mobile money transfer services from 12% to 15%.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Why can't I transfer over Ksh35,000 to unregistered subscribers?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Due to Know Your Customer (KYC)/Anti Money Laundering (AML) policy set by the Central Bank of Kenya, we do not have the mandate to allow transfers of amounts over Ksh35,000.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: With the changes in tariffs, have you increased the amounts one can send?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the maximum amount one can send in a day, is now Ksh.500,000. You can send up to Ksh250,000 in one transaction. You can now hold up to Ksh.500,000 in your M-PESA account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the lowest amount of money I can send on M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can now send as little as Ksh.1 to Safaricom customers registered on M-PESA for free. You can also make both payments via buy goods and paybill for up to Kshs.100 for free.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How much will it cost me to send Ksh10?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It is free to send any amount between Ksh.1 to Kshs.100 to a registered customer.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How much will I be charged to send 1000 shillings?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It will now cost Ksh.13 to send between Ksh. 501 and Ksh. 1000 up from Ksh.12.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How much does it cost to withdraw Ksh50?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It will now cost you Ksh.11 to withdraw between Ksh50 and Ksh100.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How much will it cost me to withdraw Ksh100?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The cost of withdrawing is Ksh. 11 for registered M-PESA customers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I still withdraw at an ATM?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes you can. You are allowed to make multiple cash withdrawals from the ATM. However, the maximum withdrawal amount is limited to Ksh35,000 per day. Withdrawals vary from Kes 200-Kes 35,000 depending on the ATM.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I know what else has changed with the tariffs?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Visit your agent outlet for more details on the tariffs. You can also visit our website https://www.safaricom.co.ke/personal/m-pesa/getting-started/m-pesa-rates or call M-PESA customer care on 234.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When will the new tariffs take effect?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The new prices will take effect from 29th July 2023 and the new limits from 21st September 2023.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How is the new commission structure?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: We have rationalized and adjusted withdrawal commissions for agents in line with tariff changes on customer withdrawal charges.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the M-Shwari Service?
What are the requirements to have an M-Shwari Account?
How does a NEW M-PESA Customer opt in/activate their line into the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A message will appear requesting you to read and accepted the Terms & Conditions ( English:Visitwww.cbagroup.com/m-shwariwww.safaricom.co.keand Swahili:Tembeleawww.cbagroup.com/m-shwariwww.safaricom.co.ke)

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I need a different PIN to access my M-Shwari account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Your M-PESA PIN is the same PIN that you will use for your M-Shwari account. Always remember PIN YAKO SIRI YAKO.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Withdraw from M-Shwari Account
What is the minimum amount that you can hold in your M-Shwari account (Minimum account balance)?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The minimum amount that you can keep in your account is Ksh 0 (zero) balance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can you send money to people who have an M-Shwari Account, directly to their M-Shwari account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You cannot move money from your M-Shwari account directly into another person's M-Shwari account. However, you can transfer money from your M-PESA into their M-PESA account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can you access your M-Shwari account through any CBA branch?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Your account is only accessible through your mobile phone via the M-PESA menu on your Safaricom line.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the maximum you can transfer from M-PESA to M-Shwari and vice versa?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The normal M-PESA limits apply.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can you send money to your other accounts within CBA directly from your M-Shwari Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. You can transfer money from your M-Shwari account into M-PESA. Inter account bank transfers is not possible on the M-Shwari service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the M-Shwari statements be available on Web self-care and or Retail Shops?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Currently, you can get 5 recently completed transactions through your mini statement. You can also request printout statements from all Safaricom retail centers. You can also view the M-Shwari transactions from the M-PESA statement available on web self-care.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the M-Shwari service earn Bonga points?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can earn Bonga Points on M-PESA transactions; currently the M-Shwari service will not earn Bonga points, but this is being considered in the near future.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do you save and withdraw money on the M-Shwari account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the minimum amount you can move from your M-Shwari into M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can move a minimum of Ksh.1 from your M-Shwari account into your M-PESA account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times can you send to bank (deposit) money from M-PESA into your M-Shwari account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can send money to bank as savings as many times as possible atNOcharge.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the minimum amount that you can send to bank (deposit) as savings?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The minimum amount you can deposit is ksh.1 (one shilling).

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times can you withdraw money from your M-Shwari account into your M-PESA account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can withdraw as many times as you like at NO charge.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will you be able to access your account outside Kenya?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will be able to transact on your M-PESA and M-Shwari account wherever you canroam and send/receive SMS to M-PESA.However, you will only be able to cash in/cash out your M-PESA balance at M-PESA Agents in Kenya.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if you lose your mobile phone and have an M-Shwari account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Your money is safe because your M-Shwari account is protected by your M-PESA PIN. Replace your SIM card at any of our Safaricom Retail Centres or agent outlets. Once you activate your M-PESA menu, using your current M-PESA PIN you will be able to access your M-Shwari account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: After a SIM swap, will your M-PESA line pick the M-Shwari account you had on a previous line or do you have to opt-in again?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You do not need to opt-in again, the system will automatically update your M-Shwari account and all the money in your account will be reflected as soon as you reactivate your M-PESA account using your current M-PESA PIN.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If you request for a loan of Kshs 1,000 how much will you receive and how much will you pay back?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will receive the full loan amount requested if you qualify. You will however be required to pay back Kshs 1,075 within 30 days because each loan attracts a 7.5% facilitation fee.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If you have multiple M-PESA accounts, can you have multiple M-Shwari accounts?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, it is possible to activate more than one M-Shwari account. Each M-Shwari account is linked to a mobile number. However if you want another M-Shwari loan on another M-PESA line you will be required to first pay the outstanding loan on the M-PESA account from which you borrowed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What benefits do I get when I save my money on the M-Shwari service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do you qualify for a loan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: In order to qualify for a loan you will have to be an active M-PESA user for at least 6 months, save regularly on M-Shwari account and continuously use other Safaricom services such as Voice, DATA and M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does a Customer request for a loan on the service?
How do you check how much you can borrow?
How does an M-PESA Customer pay for a loan on the service?
What is the loan duration?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The loan is payable within 30 days. However, you can repay the loan before the due date and borrow again. If you pay the loan in less than 30 days your loan limit qualification will increase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do you get charged interest on your M-Shwari loan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The M-Shwari loanDOES NOTattract any interest. The 7.5% charged is a loan facilitation fee payable only once for each loan taken.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If you have Kshs 5, 000 in your M-Shwari account, will you get a loan of the equivalent amount?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The loan amount is dependent on your loan amount limit, previous loan repayment behaviour and usage of other Safaricom services such as Voice, DATA and M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If you have saved Kshs 5000 in your M-Shwari and have a loan of Kshs 2000 and do not repay within the loan duration (30 days), what happens to the money in your deposit account?
Can you request for a loan immediately you opt-in?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: For you to qualify for your initial loan you must deposit money in your savings. The amount you can borrow will depend on your usage of Safaricom Voice and DATA as well as your M-PESA usage.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can you have more than one loan at a time?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. You have to repay your outstanding loan first before you can borrow another loan.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can you pay a loan on behalf of another person?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can send money to their M-PESA account and they can pay the loan.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If you have not paid your loan within 30 days, what will happen?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Your loan repayment period will be extended for an additional 30 days and you will be charged an additional 7.5% facilitation fee on your outstanding loan balance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if you pay in excess of the loan amount?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The outstanding loan balance will be paid off and the extra amount will be moved to your M-Shwari savings account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If you pay your loan before the due date, will you still be charged the loan facilitation fee of 7.5% on the loan amount?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the 7.5% is a facilitation fee charged on the cost of processing the loan. Early repayment will increase your future loan limit qualification. Remember your loan limit is dependent on your previous loan repayment behaviour and usage of other Safaricom services such as Voice, DATA and M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the advantages of M-Shwari service?

Recently when I applied for a credit reference report in order to assist in my loan application, I discovered that I had been adversely listed for failure to pay for an M-SHWARI loan which I did not take. What can I do?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You need to write to the credit reference bureau that issued the report and inform them that the information contained in the report is disputed. The credit bureau is required to conduct an investigation within 21 days. During this time, the credit bureau will get in-touch with the institution that provided the information and require them to investigate and resolve the matter. Upon completion of the investigation and it is found that the information is either erroneous or incorrect, the credit reference bureau will rectify the information. If after 21 days the bureau is yet to complete the investigation, then it is required to delete such negative information from its records.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I purchase 2 different All in one monthly bundle for different amounts within the same month?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check my balance?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I make international calls using the bundles?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I stop auto renew?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I purchase a bundle erroneously?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the resources roll over?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Our customer care agent will raise a ticket to our support team for the reversal to be effected.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Baze?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Baze is a Mobile First, video on demand service that offers you a vast selection of local and regional short form videos in Entertainment, Music, News, Sports.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What kind of content is available on Baze?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Baze has a wide selection everyone’s favorite local comedies, drama & lifestyle shows Bollywood, Nollywood and so much more.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I access Baze?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can access Baze on your mobile phone, go to your browser and key www.baze.co.ke Register with your name and Mobile Phone number. You will need a subscription to watch content on Baze.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How much is a Baze Subscription?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: There are two Subscriptions. A Daily content only subscription at Ksh 10 and a Daily Combo (Content + Data) subscription at Ksh 20 with 200MB.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I opt out of automatic renewal on the Baze Subscription?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: By dialing *544*35#

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How much data do I get with the Baze Pass?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will get a daily Pass of 200MB.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use my Baze Pass to browse on other sites?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, Baze pass bundles will be restricted to Partner App URLs and any browsing outside Baze will be charged from the customer’s bundle or their airtime.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I purchase more than one Baze pass per day?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you can, and you will have both the bundle and subscription extended by the most recent purchase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I sambaza my Baze Pass?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the bundle resources are not transferable

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does the Baze Pass roll-over?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the content subscription will expire after the validity period

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is eligible for this product?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The bundles will be availed to both Prepay, Post-pay and Hybrid customers via *544*55# , Safaricom App & Web.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use my normal bundles to access Baze?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you can access Baze with a normal bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are all browsers supported?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Am I able to access Baze over WI-FI?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, You can access Baze over WIFI.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do you have an option for multiple users sharing one account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, a User will be able to share the same account if they get access to the OTP..

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Reverse Call?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Reverse Call is a service that allows a customer to make a call with or without airtime and the receiver of the call pays on the caller’s behalf.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is eligible to make a Reverse Call?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All Safaricom subscribers are eligible.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can you make a Reverse Call?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Simply put a # followed by the number you wish to call e.g #07XX XXX XXX.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will the person receiving the call know it’s a Reverse Call?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: When the person receiving answers the call, they will get an announcement requesting them to either accept or decline by pressing 1 to accept or 2 to decline . Once they accept, the call will be charged at normal rates.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the person receiving the call be charged when the announcement is playing?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, they will only be charged when they accept the call and they are connected to the caller.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when the person receiving the call accepts or declines the call?
What happens if the person receiving the call presses the wrong key?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The call will not go through until they select the correct key.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I make a Reverse Call to another network?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, it’s only available to subscribers within Safaricom network.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will a Reverse Call go through if the person receiving the call does not have sufficient airtime or minutes?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Unfortunately, it will not go through.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I earn Bonga points once I make the Reverse Call?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, only the person receiving the call will earn Bonga Points as they are the ones paying for the call.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Halal Pesa?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is the first Shari’ah compliant based digital financing product powered by MPESA in partnership with Gulf African Bank Ltd. Currently it is a financing product only and does not have saving, which will be introduced later.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Why Halal Pesa?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This product was designed to cater to our Muslim customers who stay out of other lending products since they don’t adhere to Shari’ah law. Shari’ah law does not support/allow taking loans/borrowing money from banks or individuals where interest is charged.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How is Halal Pesa different from other lending products?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Since Halal Pesa product is based on Shari’ah principles, it operates under Tawarruq model: which basically means that the customer is given a facility and not a loan. For customers who would like to verify the Shari’ah compliance of the product and other product details please visit www.gulfafricanbank.com

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who can join Halal pesa?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Halal pesa is available to All M-PESA registered users.

After day 60 no other charges will be applied on the facility.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is subscriber registration consent?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a service that notifies customers via message (SMS) alert that an additional line is about to be registered under their ID or Passport. The service allows Safaricom customers to accept or cancel registration of any additional number using their personal details

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I activate/register for subscriber registration consent?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You don’t activate/register for it. When someone tried to register a new line with your ID, you automatically get an alert.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What number will I receive the SMS alert from?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The message will come from 707.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where a customer has multiple lines, which number will receive the notification?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The system will check and confirm the number under the ID which is the most active on the network or M-PESA. This is the primary number.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is my primary number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is the oldest, most active number found on our network that is registered under your ID details.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if the customer does not respond to the message?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The registration of the new line will fail. New line registration will only succeed when you reply with ‘YES’ to the SMS notification.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if the message is not delivered (when phone is off or upon loss of a phone) to the primary number?

Where an SMS is not delivered to the primary number OR if the primary number has beeninactive for more than 24hrs, the registration will be allowed.
If your phone has beenoff for less than 24hrs, registration will fail.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is 5G?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
5G is the 5th generation mobile network. It is a new global wireless standard after 1G, 2G, 3G, and 4G networks. 5G enables a new kind of network that is designed to connect virtually everyone and everything together including machines, objects, and devices.
5G wireless technology is meant to deliver higher multi-Gbps peak data speeds, ultra-low latency, more reliability, massive network capacity, increased availability, and a more uniform user experience to more users.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the differences between the previous generations of mobile networks and 5G?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
The previous generations of mobile networks are 1G, 2G, 3G, and 4G.
First generation - 1G
1980s: 1G delivered analog voice.
Second generation - 2G
Early 1990s: 2G introduced digital voice (e.g. CDMA- Code Division Multiple Access).
Third generation - 3G
Early 2000s: 3G brought mobile data (e.g. CDMA2000).
Fourth generation - 4G LTE
2010s: 4G LTE ushered in the era of mobile broadband.
1G, 2G, 3G, and 4G all led to 5G, which is designed to provide more connectivity than was ever available before.
5G is a unified, more capable air interface. Compared to 4G, 5G has the potential to provide up to 20X faster data speeds and carry a massive amount of data for many simultaneous users. This allows users in high density areas to enjoy the fast speeds and low latency of 5G service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is 5G available now?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, 5G is already here today for Safaricom customers in select locations in 28 towns across 21 counties, with more coverage expansion planned countrywide. To check 5G coverage visitinternet.safaricom.co.ke

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I need a new phone if I want 5G?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
If you already own a 5G device, you don’t need a new phone. If your device is not 5G capable you can visit any of our Safaricom shop outlets where we have a wide range of 5G enabled phones that you can purchase. In addition, you will need to be in an area that has 5G coverage.
There are several mobile phones available that are designed to support 5G from manufacturers such as Apple, Samsung, Nokia, Huawei and Oppo.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Must I get a new sim card to get 5G network
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, your normal SIM card will work.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will a 5G phone work with other technologies anywhere?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: "Backward compatible" 5G phones can function on older networks outside of 5G coverage areas. The experience will reflect the technology available at the time.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will my current 2G, 3G or 4G phone continue to work in the network?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the currently supported devices will continue to work.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What 5G services are available today?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Customers and businesses in 5G-ready zones can access Safaricom 5G Wi-Fi by purchasing a 5G router and a data package. Customers can also purchase Safaricom 5G ready mobile data bundles for use on 5G enabled phones.
Learn more about 5G Wi-Fi for Home hereWireless Solutions (safaricom.co.ke)
Learn more about 5G Wi-Fi for Business here5G for Business (safaricom.co.ke)
Learn more about 5G mobile data plans here5G for Mobile Data Monthly Bundles FAQs (safaricom.co.ke)

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does 5G change my home internet service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, 5G can change your home internet service with the super-fast speeds and low latency provided by 5G Wi-Fi. You will need a 5G router to enjoy the service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does 5G Wi-Fi internet work?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: 5G fixed wireless internet connects you to 5G network using a 5G router and a SIM card. A 30-day subscription package is available for purchase providing speeds up to 100Mbps.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: My home Wi-Fi router has 5G in its name, do I already have 5G at home?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
5G could refer to two things.
The 5G label on a home Wi-Fi router indicates that it operates in the 5GHz (gigahertz) spectrum band. Wi-Fi is based on a different technology than 5G or fifth-generation wireless. On a home modem or router, it stands for “5GHz” and it’s one of the two frequency bands routers can use to broadcast WIFI through your home. You might see it as an option next to 2.4 GHz.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are some of the differences between 4G and 5G?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
5G is around 100 times faster than 4G! Given enough spectrum, it will work at average speeds of 150-200Mbps, and peak speeds will reach above 1Gbps. This means you’ll be able to download a full HD film in around 3 minutes (compared to over 15 minutes on 4G).
5G works at average speeds of 150-200Mbps, while 4G works at average speeds of only 23-35Mbps. By default, 5G will reach peak speeds higher than 1Gbps, but basic 4G works at a maximum speed of only 150Mbps.
5G speeds can vary and depend on multiple factors: how far away you are from a mast, which spectrum is being used, and how many people around you are using 5G.
Movies, gaming or music downloads are more convenient and amplified with 5G. If you have many different devices to connect inside a large home, 5G supports your experience on each device so that it’s seamless and uninterrupted.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where is 5G being used?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Broadly speaking, 5G is used across three main types of connected services, including enhanced mobile broadband, mission-critical communications, and the massive IoT. A defining capability of 5G is that it is designed for forward compatibility—the ability to flexibly support future services that are unknown today.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do businesses use 5G?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: 5G will support businesses’ innovation ambitions and create new markets, transforming supply chain management and creating smarter, more efficient manufacturing. It’s also a fundamental platform for the Internet of Things (IoT). It is expected that more than half of all new businesses will rely on the “IoT” to cut costs, build efficiencies, and grow their bottom lines.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What new services will emerge from 5G?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: 5G will potentially be able to handle more than 1million connected devices per square kilometer. This opens new opportunities for Smart Cities and Smart Homes. Other near-term services would include Realtime Gaming, and new opportunities in Entertainment with Virtual Reality and Augmented reality.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What’s a “Smart City” and how will 5G impact my community?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Smart cities employ use of electronic Sensors and Measurements to provide services and respond to challenges. For example, utility companies can have IoT meters to alert home owners on upcoming bills or to alert the utility company on leakages. Activity triggered sensors can alert in case of vandalism in isolated locations. Smart traffic lights can respond to traffic situation rather than work on a timer. Street lights can be controlled to respond not only to daylight hours, but also environmental situation e.g. Narrower streets can light sooner etc.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will 5G change transportation?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: There are opportunities in both traffic control and driverless cars. For the former, traffic information such as alerts on traffic jams, suggestions of alternative routes, real time traffic monitoring etc. are some of the use cases and for the latter we can’t reach the full promise of autonomous vehicles without 5G. For these cars to react to road conditions immediately, their sensors need to be able to send and receive data with low latency. 5G has the potential to cut latency down to less than 10 milliseconds, many times faster than the blink of an eye.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will 5G Improve healthcare?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: There are several opportunities in Health care as well. 5G could elevate virtual healthcare to new levels, enabling even more effective remote care for those who need it most. There is already ongoing research on capabilities such as remote surgeries by use of Robots and the 5G network.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are 5G antennas a health concern?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All equipment used for 5G must comply with stringent safety standards. Those standards have wide safety margins and are designed to protect everyone, including children. Everyday exposure to the radio frequency energy from 5G small cells will be well within those safety limits and is comparable to exposure from products such as baby monitors, Wi-Fi routers, and Bluetooth devices.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I have heard that 5G small cells cause COVID-19. Is that true?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It is scientifically impossible for radiofrequency waves at any frequency to create a virus, including radio waves used to provide 5G. The World Health Organization and the CDC have been clear about the origins of this virus: The WHO says, “Coronaviruses are zoonotic, meaning they are transmitted between animals and people.” The CDC says coronaviruses are a large family of viruses that are common in people and many different species of animals, including camels, cattle, cats, and bats

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How is Facebook Free Mode different from regular Facebook?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
This version of Facebook allows people to flexibly move between two modes – Free Mode and Data Mode. Free Mode is a lightweight version of Facebook where you can post, comment, and like for free.
To view photos or videos, switch to Data Mode (full Facebook) by clicking the “See Photos” button. You will be charged for data (MBs) in this mode. Go back to Free Mode any time by clicking the “Go to Free” button

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I have access to Facebook Free Mode even if I do not have an airtime/data balance?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Free Mode can be accessed without data charges, therefore, when you have run out of data or airtime, you are still able to enjoy Facebook Free Mode.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is eligible for Facebook Free Mode and how do I access it?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
All Safaricom users can enjoy Facebook for free by default.
To access Facebook Free Mode, customers can go to facebook.com using a mobile browser on a data-capable phone with a Safaricom SIM card. All major mobile browsers, such as Google Chrome, Android browser, Opera Mini, and Safari are supported. Internet Explorer mobile browser and Firefox browser for Androidmaybe supported but arenotguaranteed to be supported. WAP browsers arenotsupported.
Alternatively, customers can access Facebook Free Mode through the Facebook Android app. The core Facebook Free Mode feature is supported in the Facebook Android app version 43+ (released Oct 2015). Some user interface improvements were made in version 61+ (released Feb 2016). But the core toggling functionality between Free Mode and paid mode is available in version 43+.
Facebook iOS app, Facebook Windows Phone app, and Facebook BlackBerry app arenotsupported. Customers using these operating systems would need to use a supported mobile browser to access Facebook Free Mode.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When I use Facebook Free Mode, I can see photos. Am I being charged?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
If you are in Free Mode, you are not being charged. You can check if you are in Free Mode by looking at the top of your Facebook.
For new Facebook users or Facebook users that haven’t used Facebook in a while (last 15 days), you may still be able to see photos in Free Mode. This is a short promotion for your first 14 days on Facebook. Once this short promotion is complete, you will no longer be able to see photos in Free Mode.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I view the full Facebook experience?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can view the full Facebook experience with photos and videos by clicking on “See Photos” button, which switches you to Data Mode. Keep in mind that standard data charges will apply. You can go back to Free Mode anytime by clicking the “Go to Free” button.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: For how long can I be on Free Mode?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It has been capped at 20MB free mode consumption.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is a returning customer?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A returning customer is a Facebook user who has been inactive for 15days on Facebook.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the offer for returning customers?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: They will experience Free full Facebook experience for 3 days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is a new customer?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A new customer is a Facebook user who has been never logged on to Facebook.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the offer for returning customers?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: They will experience Free full Facebook experience for 14 days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I opt out of using Facebook Free Mode?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: On the initial screen that invites you to participate, simply click “No Thanks” instead of “Continue.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What if I initially clicked “No Thanks” to Facebook Free Mode but now I want to use it?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If you’re using the Facebook Android app, visit your bookmarks within the Facebook app and click “Facebook Free Mode” under Favorites. If using facebook.com, go to your Facebook menu and click “Facebook Free Mode” under Favorites.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What if I started using Facebook Free Mode but now I don’t want to use it anymore?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
To opt-out of Facebook Free Mode: When in Data Mode, click on the “?” next to “Data Mode.”
You can also visit your Facebook bookmarks (if using the Facebook Android app) or Facebook menu (if using facebook.com) to opt-out.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is Facebook Messenger free in Facebook Free Mode?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, Facebook Messenger is not free.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If I click a link in Facebook Free Mode, is it free?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. In Facebook Free Mode, you can like, comment, post, share, and upload photos for free. If you want to view photos, watch videos, or read articles, you will be charged your standard data rate by Safaricom. If you try and click on a photo/video/link, you will be warned with a popup telling you that you are leaving Free Mode and will be charged at your standard rate.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I registered for Facebook Free Mode with my Safaricom number, can I still access Facebook Free Mode from a different operator?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If you access the internet with a non-Safaricom number, you will not access Facebook Free Mode. Facebook Free Mode is exclusive to all Safaricom users.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I registered for Facebook with my Safaricom number, now I cannot access Facebook Free Mode, Why?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Facebook Free Mode is available to all Safaricom users. Please restart the Facebook Android App or refresh your Facebook on mobile browser. Facebook Free Mode should appear. If you are not able to see Facebook Free Mode, please call our customer care.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I access M-PESA Service when roaming?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can use STK, USSD *334# and M-PESA or Safaricom App.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be charged to use the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Roaming customers will be charged from airtime, credit limit or Postpay bundles whenever they use STK for M-PESA transactions.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How much will I be charged?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Roaming SMS charges will apply for send money, balance query/Menu update requests, pay bill, till payments and/or any other STK request originating from the handset.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I don’t have enough airtime?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Prepaid customers with insufficient airtime will be unable to transact using M-PESA STK option. They will get the notification:“M-PESA transaction cannot be completed due to insufficient airtime. Dial *334# or use M-PESA/Safaricom App to avoid roaming SMS charges for M-PESA transactions”.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is M-PESA Business APP?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-PESA for Business App allows you to have better visibility of your business, enabling you view your collections and payments, see full statements and transact directly from your M-PESA Business till using the app. Its an alternative to the USSD service *234# Option 2.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I log in to another till I have on this same App?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
While on the log in page, Tap on the arrow pointing down or Tap Change Account.
▪ If you are logged in, go to Account and then Tap Switch Accounts.
▪ Tap on Add Account. You will be redirected to the sign in page.
▪ Select Sign In>Accept Terms and Conditions>Enter the second till or store number and follow the prompts to the end.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is that Balance at the Top?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: That is the current balance on your account. Every time you log in it refreshes; you can also touch anywhere on the transactions page and pull down to refresh.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What does the Chart show me?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The chart helps you compare your performance trend over time helping you know if your business transactions are growing or slowing down, as you scroll the chart will show you the various values for each day.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the purpose of the Money In and Money Out Menu?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Money In shows you the money received on your till over time, you can back 6 months. Money Out shows you the money paid our from your till over time, you can back 6 months.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I refresh the transactions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Touch anywhere on the transactions and pull down to refresh the transactions. Every time you log in or switch between the Money In and Money Out, it refreshes the records.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I view more information of a transaction?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Tap on the transaction and it will open more details for you to view.The refunded Safaricom Guarantee Talktime will only be valid for 7 days from the time of refund.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the purpose of the Operators menu?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Operators Menu shows you the operators in your organization. The Business owner is the Primary Operator and the rest are Assistant Operators.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What functions can an Assistant Operator Perform?
How can I add an Assistant Operator?
How can the new Assistant Operator Created Log In?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The new Assistant Operator will receive their Operator ID and Start PIN via SMS from M-PESA. They can then download and install the App on their number as created and Log in with the details received. Agent.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the difference between Favorites and Frequents?
How Can I Manage my Favorites like adding, editing or removing?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Tap on Account>Select Manage Favorites> You can then Add, View, Edit or remove a favorite account you had saved.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How Can I Search for a transaction?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: When logged in, Tap on the magnifying lens Icon on the top left>Type in the transaction ID or scroll through the transactions.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How far back do the transaction statements go?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: They go back 6 months from the current date you are checking.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I export the statements for my store?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Tap on Transact>Select Export Statements>You can filter by transaction or Select All Transactions> Select the Start Date and End Date for the Statement you are requesting for then Submit. The Statement will automatically download on your phone. You can then save the attachment with a name you wish and even share the file.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I am logged in to Head office account and I have multiple stores, how can I export the statements for a specific store?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Tap on Organization>Select Stores>Search and select the Store>It will open the store details>Tap on Statements>Then Tap on the Download Image Icon on your Top right.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the purpose of the Roll Up Menu?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This enables an organization with multiple stores to Roll Up/Move Up funds from a store account to the Head office account in order to either make payments or withdraw funds.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the difference between the Roll Up All Stores and Roll Up One Store?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Roll Up All storesis done when logged in to the Head Office Account. It enables one Roll Up (Pull) funds from all the stores under that head office into the head office Account.
Roll Up One storecan be done from the head office or from the store. It you to Roll Up (Push) funds from one specific stores under that head office into the head office Account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: My Organization has multiple stores, how do I withdraw the funds?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Once you Log in>Tap on Roll Up All stores, follow the prompts insert your PIN and Submit. The request will be processed between 2 – 3 minutes. Please wait for a confirmation SMS before retrying. The funds will be rolled up to the Head office Account. You will receive an SMS.Then Tap on the Withdraw Menu and you can Withdraw to Owner, From Agent or to Bank.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I want to add a bank account to my till in order to withdraw to Bank. How can I have it?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Contact customer care on 100 or via emailThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.orThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.for guidance in adding a bank account to your till to withdrawal to bank.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I contact support in case of any queries?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Existing merchant support channels apply. (100 or via emailThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.orThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it..

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: My Assistant Operator has Forgotten their PIN How do I help them?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Tap on Operators, Select the Operator>Tap on Reset PIN, they will then receive an SMS from M-PESA with their New PIN. Request them to then go to the Change PIN Menu and use the Start PIN received as Current PIN

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How I Suspend or Remove an Assistant Operator from my account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Tap on Operators, Select the Operator>Tap on either Suspend or Remove an Operator. If the Operator is in a store, then Tap on Organization>Tap the Store>, Select the Operator>Tap on either Suspend or Remove an Operator.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I have forgotten my PIN, what do I do?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Visit the nearest Safaricom retail shop with a copy of your ID for the PIN to be reset.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: My PIN has been Reset, how do I change the Pin and Log In?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: On the Log in Page>Tap on the Change PIN Menu> Enter the Start PIN received as Current PIN>Create a new PIN and complete the process.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I am unable to Download/Install the App
I am Unable to see charts
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Either No transaction done or there is a system issue (M-PESA).Please contact Support on 100.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Am getting error “Turn mobile data on. For a secure log in, please switch off wifi and connect your mobile data”
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The user needs to turn of Wi-Fi and use mobile data for a secure log in. This will only happen the first time they log into the app. They can continue using Wi-Fi to access the app after that

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Am getting error “Insert SIM card. The SIM card you are currently using doesn’t match with this account. Please insert the correct SIM card and try again later”
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The user can only access the app on the phone with their nominated number SIM card. If this is not the case, they either need to insert the SIM card or install and access the app on the phone with their nominated number

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Am getting error “Business product is not supported”

Am getting error “Access Denied. We found suspicious files which many compromise your security within M-PESA. For your safety we locked the application to prevent further use until you are secure again”
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The user is accessing the app from a rooted device which raises security concerns for accepting the app. The user can try accessing the app using a different handset.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is mobile money transfer?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Mobile Money Transfer (MMT) refers to mobile-enabled money transfer services, both domestic and cross-border. Essentially, it's sending and/or receiving money with your mobile phone. .

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does it work?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This service allows anyone wishing to send money to Kenya to visit a Safaricom IMT partner and send money to an M-PESA mobile phone in Kenya. The transaction is similar to a traditional cash-to-cash money transfer, except that the sender specifies the recipient’s mobile phone number at the time the funds are sent. Recipients in Kenya must subscribe to the M-PESA service through Safaricom to access the service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who are the partners in this service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Safaricom has so far partnered with the following authorized International Money Transfer organizations.
WEBSITE
World remit
www.worldremit.com
Skrill iT
www.skrill.com

www.mhits.com.au/send-money

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I find an M-PESA location in Kenya?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Please log ontowww.safaricom.co.keand look for the M-PESA Agents tab. Check the M-PESA section for details of current agent locations. This list is regularly updated.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who can use the M-PESA International Money Transfer service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The sender does not have to be a registered M-PESA customer to send money on this service. Any person registered for M-PESA can receive money via IMT.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What do I require in order to use M-PESA International Money Transfer Service?
Where in Kenya can I receive money sent to my M-PESA account via IMT?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can go to any M-PESA agent countrywide to withdraw your funds, just like when money is sent by another M-PESA customer. Alternatively, you can use the money to Lipa Na M-PESA, buy airtime or send money to other subscribers in Kenya.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How much money can I receive?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The maximum amount that can be sent at any one time via M-PESA is approximately Ksh70, 000. The limits per day, per month or per year shall depend on the country and the partner the money is sent from. The sender shall be advised by the preferred Partner on any applicable restriction. .

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the cost of sending money via M-PESA International Money Transfer?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Charges for sending money via M-PESA vary depending on the amount sent, the country from which it is being sent and the partner channel via which the money is being sent from. Each partner will advise the sender on applicable charges before the funds are sent.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What exchange rate will be used at the time the money is being sent?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Conversion will be done when the funds are sent. The sender will be advised at the point of sending of the prevailing exchange rate, and the equivalent amount the customer in Kenya will receive on their M-PESA account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be charged for receiving money?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will not be charged for receiving IMT via M-PESA, but all normal M-PESA charges will subsequently apply, i.e., to send money to another M-PESA subscriber, withdraw cash etc.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will any network coverage affect my collection of money sent to me from the UK?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Money will be received into your M-PESA account, even if it is sent to you when you are out of coverage area. You can always check your current balance on M-PESA the normal way.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How much time does it take for money sent to reach me in Kenya?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The money should reach you immediately. Normally, it will take just a few seconds for you to receive the SMS confirmation of the transaction. Note that if but you are not registered on M-PESA, you will receive the notification immediately but will need to register for M-PESA to access your money.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I get a message to notify me that I have received money?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: As with any other M-PESA transaction, you will receive an SMS notifying you of the transaction details, including receipt number, amount in Ksh, balance, time stamp, sender and sender's location. Here are sample SMSes:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use M-PESA if my line is expired?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The M-PESA service uses the Safaricom network for sending and receiving SMSes to and from your phone. Your Safaricom line will need to be active for you to use M-PESA. If your Safaricom line is expired, the one transaction you will be able to do is to use M-PESA to top up your line. Topping up will make your line active again!

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the difference between a registered M-PESA customer and an unregistered customer?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: An M-PESA customer's SIM card has M-PESA active menu on it and can access to all M-PESA services. An unregistered customer is one that can only receive money from an M-PESA customer and it can be Safaricom or any other mobile network. An unregistered customer can withdraw money sent to them by an M-PESA customer in Kenya from any Agent within 7 days, but cannot carry out other M-PESA transactions. Registered customers can also withdraw cash from participating ATM networks. Unregistered customers will have to register within 21 days to receive funds via the IMT service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: For IMT transactions using Western Union, what happens if the receiver isn't registered for M-PESA (but has a Safaricom line)?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: As long as the recipient is on the Safaricom network, when a Mobile Money Transfer is sent, Safaricom will send an SMS to the receiver. They will be invited to register within 21 days. If they choose not to, or the 21 days elapse, the receiver can contact the sender for further transaction details and collect the money transfer through a Western Union Agent through the standard process.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What Anti Money Laundering (AML) controls are there to guard against money laundering?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All Partners are registered with their respective regulatory authorities for AML compliance. They are required to undertake certain due diligence on the remitters in compliance with the respective countries laws and regulations. Safaricom also carry out screening of senders and receivers as required by law. Moreover, in many countries, senders will be required to provide proof of ID to the Agent before they can complete a transaction. All transactions are also monitored to detect suspicious activity and take appropriately action.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What involvement have the Regulatory Authorities had with the M-PESA IMT launch?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Safaricom have since the inception of M-PESA worked closely with the Central Bank of Kenya (CBK). Safaricom was authorized on 3rd August 2009 to transact foreign-exchange business, having satisfied the CBK that the required legal compliance and controls are being met. Our partners have all been authorized by the relevant regulatory authority in the countries they operate in to transact international remittances.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If I want to be an M-PESA IMT Agent, what do I require?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: In order to provide M-PESA IMT transactions you will need to comply with the laws and regulations in the country where funds are being remitted from. For more information, please send a request toThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Family Connect Talktime?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a family share plan that gives you (Safaricom customer) (referred to as Sponsor) an opportunity to buy a sharable monthly plan that you can share with your family and friends for Call or SMS to any network in Kenya.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How does the Sponsor buy Family Connect Talktime?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: By Dialing *444# or via My Safaricom App and select your preferred plan.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: More about family connect Airtime Sponsor and Beneficiary.
How many plans are there?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: There are 4 plans as below:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Validity of the plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The plans are valid for 30days from the date of purchase. There is no rollover.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does the Sponsor get the full Talktime?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. The Sponsor gets the full Talktime as per the plan bought.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the Purchase modes and Frequency of plans purchase?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A Sponsor can buy the plans via: M-PESA, Airtime, Okoa or Fuliza.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use the Family Connect Talktime to access Internet or buy bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, Family Connect Talktime can only be used for Local off net and on net Calls and SMS.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I buy Family connect Airtime If I have an Okoa Jahazi outstanding Debt?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, as a Sponsor purchasing a Family Connect plan, you will get a notification to first pay your OKOA loan after which you can proceed to buy a Family Connect plan of choice.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Service Change (termination, upgrade, or downgrade)
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Should you as a sponsor require a different plan, all you need to do is dial *444# or go to MySafaricom App and choose Family Connect to change your plan.

Kindly note:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will a Sponsor Add a Beneficiary and Set their Limit?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *444# >Family connect option, select ‘Add Beneficiary, Enter the Beneficiary Number and Limit or go to MySafaricom App and select Add Beneficiary.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can a Sponsor/Beneficiary Top Up Airtime should they exhaust their plan/limit?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, A sponsor or a beneficiary can top up Airtime at any time.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can A sponsor/Beneficiary use the Family Connect Talktime for Skiza tunes and other Premium Rate Services?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. This is because the Family Connect Talktime can be used for Calls and SMS. You will require to top up should you wish to utilize services like Premium rate services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can a Sponsor remove beneficiaries?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will be required to dial *444# or go to MySafaricom App then select “Remove Beneficiary” option and Select the Beneficiary you intend to Remove.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can a Sponsor or Beneficiary Sambaza / share my Family Connect Talktime?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. The plan does not allow Sambaza. The plan only allows sharing Talktime with selected beneficiaries by allocating them a limit.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I check my balance as a Sponsor?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: By dialing USSD code *444* Family connect and select the “Check Balance” option or go to MySafaricom App and select Family Connect

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can the Beneficiary check their Family Connect Talktime allocated?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
No. A Beneficiary is currently not able to check the Family Connect Talktime allocated by the Sponsor.
A Sponsor can however check balance for all beneficiaries under their Plan.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Usage Prioritization for Family Connect plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Shorter validity Airtime are used first. Example, if you as a sponsor have a 24hour Airtime validity, that will be used before the 30day Family connect Talktime.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I roam on Family Connect Talktime plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Currently Family Connect Talktime can only be used while in Kenya.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I make International Calls with Family Connect Talktime?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. The Sponsor or beneficiary will need to top up their line with airtime to make International Calls and international calling rates apply.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I buy other bundles if I am on the Family Connect Talktime Plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. Safaricom Customers can top-up their line with normal airtime and buy other data or Minutes plans via either *444# or *544# or via MySafaricom App

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does the beneficiary earn bonga points on Family Connect Talktime allocated?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. The Sponsor will earn bonga upon subscription.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does the usage accumulate to stori ibambe?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Usage will not contribute to Stori ibambe target accumulation; however, the sponsor’s subscription amount will be considered as sponsors usage for Stori ibambe.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Fuliza M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a service that allows M-PESA customers to complete their M-PESA transactions when they have insufficient funds in their M-PESA account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the requirements and how do I activate Fuliza M-PESA Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You need to be an M-PESA registered customers with an active Safaricom line. Dial*234#and selectFuliza M-PESAto opt in.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many accounts can I hold for Fuliza M-PESA services?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Every M-PESA registered line will be treated as a different account. Each mobile number will qualify for Fuliza M-PESA and will be awarded a limit. This limit will be reviewed every 3 months depending on your usage.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will I know my Fuliza M-PESA account details?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *234# and Select Fuliza M-PESA to check your limit, balance, mini statement and opt out option. Every time you transact using Fuliza, you will receive an sms with the outstanding Fuliza amount.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times can I use Fuliza M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can use it as many times as needed as long as you are within the allocated Fuliza M-PESA limit.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which M-PESA transactions can I complete using Fuliza M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Lipa Na M-PESA: Buy goods and Paybill as well as Send money.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I use my Fuliza limit?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All you need to do is transact normally on M-PESA and if you have insufficient funds, Fuliza M-PESA will cover the shortfall.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I grow my Fuliza M-PESA limit?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Continue using Safaricom and M-PESA services frequently and repay Fuliza M-PESA on time by toping up your M-PESA account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I withdraw money from Fuliza?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. You can withdraw funds from an M-PESA agent using Fuliza M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The discounted tariff will take effect from 1st of October 2022.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All Fuliza customers who have opted-in and have a positive limit, with no outstanding balance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will pay the current daily maintenance fees on your outstanding balance. The new restructured price will take effect once you clear your balance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I know my outstanding balance?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *234# to know your outstanding balance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I have no Fuliza limit. How can I take advantage of the new restructured price?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Keep transacting on M-Pesa and ensure you repay all your loans on time.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will I repay my Fuliza M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Any funds received or deposited in your M-PESA account will automatically be used to clear your outstanding Fuliza M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the minimum and maximum amount I can send using Fuliza M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-PESA limits apply as below;

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I get money reversed if I send/pay to a wrong number/till and had used Fuliza M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-PESA reversal process applies as long as the recipient has not utilized the funds. You can also initiate reversal by sending the M-PESA SMS to 456NB: Transactional charges will not the reversed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Is Fuliza M-PESA a loan product?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. This is a continuous overdraft service that allows you to complete M-PESA transactions when you have insufficient funds.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are there any Penalties for late repayment?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will not have access to your Fuliza M-PESA limit if you have any unpaid balance after day 30. This will however be restored on full repayment of your Fuliza balance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Safaricom Platinum?

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is eligible for Safaricom Platinum?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Safaricom Platinum will be available to all individual Safaricom PrePay, PostPay and Hybrid subscribers.

Payment will be via M-PESA and customer will be required to pay for the plan and make a deposit similar to the plan selected.c. Customers will be required to share their Email address (where they will be receiving their monthly bill statements); andd.
