You will receive a confirmation SMS within 1 Hour

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I move to Platinum Plus?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A PrePay subscriber that chooses to “move to Platinum Plus” will become a hybrid subscriber

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: A PrePay subscriber that chooses to “move to Platinum Plus” will become a hybrid subscriberIn case of a reversal will the cash back amount also be reversed?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: On full utilisation of the bundle resources before thirty (30) days, Prepay subscribers can top up and purchase another platinum plan.PostPay subscribers will be prompted to unsubscribe from the existing plan after which they will be allowed to purchase another Platinum Plus plan

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What payment options are available for PostPay/ hybrid customers?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Individual PostPay and hybrid subs will make payment via credit limit.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I purchase Platinum Plus plan that is higher than my PostPay limit?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers who wish to buy plans higher than their limit will be prompted to increase their credit limit via M-PESA before purchasing their preferred plans.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I opt out of the platinum plan plus?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: i. Prepay customers who migrate to Platinum Plus and wish to terminate the Platinum service will be required to visit any Safaricom retail shopii. PostPay and PostPay hybrid customers who subscribed to Platinum Plus and wish to opt out can select the “Stop Auto renew” option from mySafaricom app.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I access the incentivized services from Shell Petrol station?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Individual PostPay and hybrid subs will make payment via credit limit.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I access the incentivized services from Eat out?
How can I access the incentivized services through Ticketsasa?
What is Bill manager?
What is the validity of the Platinum Plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Platinum Plans are valid for 30 days from purchase / subscription date after which they will expire

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I extend validity of my resources if I purchase another platinum plan before expiry of the current plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will not be able to roll over / extend expiry of the resources. The bundled resources will be valid for 30 days after which any unused resource will expire.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can the Platinum Plans be used for International calls and SMS?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: i. Resources received after purchasing Platinum Plans Ksh 2K and Ksh 3K will be used for data, local calls and SMS (on net and off net)ii. Resources received after purchasing Platinum Plans Ksh 5K and Ksh 10K will be used for data, local calls & SMS (on net and off net) as well as International calls to USA, Canada, China & Indiaiii. The Platinum Plans will not be used to make international SMS

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use the Platinum Plans to roam?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Platinum Plans will not be used while roaming, however customers can top up their lines or buy Roaming bundles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use Platinum Plans for premium rate services?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Platinum Plans cannot be used for premium rate services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I subscribe to the Platinum Plans while on Flex bundle or karibu PostPay 1000 / 2500?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers on Flex plans, Karibu PostPay will be required to finish their resources or wait until their bundle expires before subscribing to Platinum Plans.

Can I sambaza my Platinum Plan Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You cannot transfer (Sambaza) Safaricom Platinum Plan bundles to other subscribers

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Resources for lines that are disconnected for lack of payment will be purged and will not be available upon reconnection.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the bundle will auto renew every 1st of the month.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use my bundle for chargeable messages?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, you will not be able to use the bundled SMS to access chargeable messages. Top up prepaid airtime or your postpaid balance via paybill 200200 and enter phone number as account number.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use my bundle for Skiza or bank USSD?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You need prepaid airtime balance or postpaid balance. You cannot use the minutes, SMS and data given to renew buy skiza or do bank USSD.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use it for roaming?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the PostPay bundles cannot be used for roaming. You top up prepaid airtime or postpaid account via paybill 200200.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I earn Bonga points if I purchase PostPay bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you will earn Bonga points when you purchase the plans.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I “Sambaza” or transfer resources (bundles and minutes)?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, you cannot transfer/Sambaza your resources. You can share the data bundle upto three numbers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I recently moved my line to post paid When should I expect to get my bill?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The bill will be sent to the email address you provided on sign up on the first week of every month. Please ensure you settle your bill by the end of the month to avoid being disconnected from the PostPay tariff.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I join and buy a PostPay Bundle after the 1st of the month?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If you sign up after the 1st of the month you will get full resources but you will be charged prorated amount depending on remaining days of the month. On the 1st of the next month, you will be charged the full amount for the resources allocated.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be notified when my bundle is about to run out?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you will be notified for data bundles and minutes. Data bundle at 75MB and 2MB while minutes at 60minutes and 2minutes.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the resources roll over?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Data bundle will roll over upon renewal of the monthly plan. Minutes and SMS will expire at the end of the month.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When do I expect to receive an email notification?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Notifications will be sent to notify you of any of the following:
NB:Emails will be generated from SHUB Workflow Mailer

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I get an email notification?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can access full content of the email by logging in to the portal and checking the notifications panel for appropriate action.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I get help if I don’t understand the email notification?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Forward the email to:This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Digital TV & Internet is a smart Set-Top Box powered by Android that provides you with the simplest way to stream movies and TV shows to your TV. You can also play games, watch Live TV and much more

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What do I get with the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box will turn your TV into a “Smart” TV. You will be able to:i. Stream movies and TV shows from apps like Showmax.ii. Mirror content from your phone or tablet to your TV screen.iii. Download movies and videos for offline viewing. These will be stored on the 32GB internal storageiv. Create a Wi-Fi hotspot with up to 8 users.v. Stay connected in the event that there is no fibre connectivity using the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box 3G/4G data bundles easily purchased through *400# or www.safaricom.com/bigboxvi. Access external files like videos and music and watch on your TV using the USB port on the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box.vii. Watch movies, series, news and kids’ shows on apps such as Showmax, YouTube, YouTube Kids, Deutsche Welle which come pre-loaded on the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box. This includes Gameloft for all you gamers.viii. Download your preferred App through the Google Play Store on your Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box.ix. Access more than 50 Free to Air (FTA) Live and / or Local channels such as KTN, Citizen and NTV. To access the live channels, simply connect your Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box to an antenna.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I set it up
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: It’s easy! Simply follow the set-up steps as outlined on the installation guide to activate your device. In case of any queries, you can reach our support centre by dialling 400 from the contact mobile number provided during registration of the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where can I buy the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can purchase the box from Safaricom Shops in Nairobi, Mombasa, Nakuru, Eldoret and Kisumu.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the price of the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Safaricom Home Fibre customers with an active connection can purchase the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box at a discounted price of Ksh5,999 and at Ksh9,999 for customers currently not subscribed to Safaricom Home Fibre.You will also get to enjoy 3 months FREE subscription to Showmax.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I purchase the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box monthly internet bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Simply dial *400# on your Safaricom line, select Safaricom TV, select Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box then follow the simple instructions. Alternatively log on towww.safaricom.co.ke/digitalbox/on the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box, select your preferred bundle and proceed to make payment via airtime.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What mobile number do I use to pay for the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box monthly internet bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Your Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box comes preloaded with a mobile number. The number is printed on a sticker placed at the bottom of the box and on the packaging. This mobile number will act as your account number and will be used to purchase the monthly internet bundles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I exhaust my Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box monthly internet bundles before the 30 day expiry period?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can purchase additional bundles by dialing *400# on your Safaricom line, select Safaricom TV, select Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box then follow the simple instructions. Alternatively log on towww.safaricom.com/bigboxon the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box, select your preferred bundle and proceed to make payment via airtime.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can my Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box monthly internet bundles roll over after the expiry period?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the bundles do not roll over. Additionally, purchasing a new bundle will not extend the validity of your existing bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I sambaza or share the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box internet bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, you cannot sambaza or share the bundles to another mobile number.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I get notifications on payments due or when my bundles are running?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you will receive a notification on your TV screen and via SMS on the mobile number that you used during registration and purchase of the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I remove the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box SIM card from the device?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box SIM card comes pre-installed in the box and hence cannot be removed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How should I get in touch with customer care in case I need assistance with the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can reach customer care by calling 400 using the contact mobile number provided during registration of the Safaricom Digital TV & Internet Box. If you do not have a Safaricom line, you can call customer care via 0722001100.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is advantage plus?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Advantage Plus is a value proposition from Safaricom that enables consumers on the path to success live an uninterrupted life by offering convenience, exceptional value, prestige and differentiated service benefits. Advantage Plus offers Safaricom PrePay and PostPay customers bundle plans geared to provide them with additional value of up to 85% plus the convenience that comes with having an integrated Voice, SMS and Data bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the advantages of the Advantage Plus plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You don’t have to worry about topping up every now and then as a PrePay customer You have a clear understanding of your charges Customers who subscribe to the Advantage Plus PostPay bundles will have access to line 200 You can control your budgets by having a fixed amount to spend on your mobile phone usage expenses You get an itemized bill at the end of the month when you sign onto Advantage Plus PostPay

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I subscribe to an Advantage Plus plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: a.) To purchase a PrePay plan For existing Safaricom PrePay Customers: Dial *100# and select “Advantage Plus” Select your preferred Advantage Plus Plan Select the PrePay option Select your preferred payment option i.e. Airtime or M-PESA To pay via M-PESA, enter your service PIN and confirm. For airtime options, the airtime will automatically be deducted from your main account You will then receive a notification on successful subscription to your preferred Advantage Plus PrePay Planb.) To purchase a PostPay plan For existing Safaricom PostPay Customers: Dial *200# and select the “Advantage Plus” option Select your plan of choice Accept the Terms and Conditions of service Submit the request You will then receive a notification on successful subscription to your preferred Advantage Plus Plan N:B. Your credit limit needs to be sufficient to cover for the cost of the bundle For Existing Safaricom PrePay Customers joining Advantage Plus PostPay Dial *100# and select your preferred Advantage Plus Plan Enter your National ID / Passport number Enter your email address (where your new PostPay bill will be sent) Confirm subscription and 1 month prepayment Accept the Terms and Conditions Pay the prepayment and 1st month’s usage via M-PESA Submit the request You will then receive a notification on successful subscription to your preferred Advantage Plus Plan and you will be migrated to the PostPay Hybrid tariff. New Customers (joining from other networks). Please visit your nearest Safaricom Shop to sign up. An original identification document such as a National ID or Passport

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the validity period of each Advantage Plus plan?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Because of the exceptional value being provided by the Advantage Plus value proposition and the fact that consumers have three options to pick a package that suit their needs, this package will be valid for 30 days from the subscription date after which they will be expired. Unutilized resources will NOT be rolled over after the expiry date. .

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I exhaust my advantage plus resources?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If you were previously on PrePay, you will be able to top up your line with airtime. If you were on an existing PostPay tariff before subscribing to the Advantage Plus Plan, then you can continue to use your credit up to your limit. Normal calling, SMS and Internet rates will apply. This will apply to the awarded resources separately e.g. when voice minutes are depleted but the subscriber still has SMS resources; voice will be charged out-of-bundle and the SMS in-bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I upgrade my bundle to a higher bundle?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: YES. You can upgrade and downgrade your bundles based on what you qualify for. PostPay Hybrid customers (i.e. customers who were previously on PrePay) will need to visit any Safaricom Shop to upgrade their bundle plus top up their deposit to the value of the new bundle. Advantage PostPay customers will be able to upgrade or downgrade via *200#. Their credit limit needs to be sufficient to cover the additional cost

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How are the resources used?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: In case of any customer issue about the cash back, customers can call Line 234, Line 100 or Line 200.Customers can also use the Safaricom social media channels for additional assistance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I subscribe to the Advantage Plus plans if I am on the Karibu Postpay bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: YES. You can subscribe to the Advantage Plus Plan if you are on the existing Karibu PostPay 1000 or Karibu PostPay 2,500 bundles. Your existing resources will be moved to the new Plan and the prevailing expiry dates will apply. However, once you exit the Karibu PostPay Bundles you will not be allowed to move back.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I have multiple bundles running at the same time if i am on advantage plus postpay?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: NO. Multiple bundle subscriptions will not be allowed. You will have to unsubscribe from your existing bundle to subscribe to a new one.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when my bundle resources i.e. minutes, SMS, internet MBs expire?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The bundles will not be available for use once they have expired. They will be deleted from the subscriber’s account upon expiry.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I get a notification before I fully utilise my resources?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: YES. You will get notifications before you exhaust your bundle minutes, SMS and internet resources

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I transfer / sambaza bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: NO. The bundles are not transferable to other subscribers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I accumulate bonga points when i subscribe to the bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: YES. You will get Bonga Points upon subscription and renewal of the bundles as per the current Bonga Points accumulation rules.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I get additional services such as roaming and international calling whilst on the Advantage Plus plans?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: YES, you can get additional products and services as per existing product rules. However, you will need to top up your PrePay line with airtime or increase the credit limit of your PostPay line to access these services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What Advantage Plus plans are currently available?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Simply dial *100*6# on your PrePay line or *200*6# on your PostPay line and select your preferred Advantage Plus Plan.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Lipa Na M-PESA Do More promotion?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: TThe Lipa Na M-PESA Do More Promotion is an 8-week promotion to reward customers for using Lipa Na M-PESA. The promotion is entry-based; 1 entry will be awarded for every KShs.100 and above transacted.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which Lipa Na M-PESA transactions qualify for the promotion?
When will the promotion start?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The promotion will run from 8th January 2020 to 5th March 2020.All Safaricom customers are eligible for the Safaricom Guarantee when they call another Safaricom customer in Kenya.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be required to opt in?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Any Lipa Na M-PESA transaction over KShs.100 at the beginning of the promotion will automatically opt you in.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will I:
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
1.Check my entries?
Dial *234# from your Safaricom line
Message prompt “You have XX entries in the Lipa Na M-PESA Promotion. The more entries you have, the more chances you have to be a winner”.
2.Check winnings?
Dial *234# from your Safaricom line
3.Opt out?
To opt out, dial *234# from your Safaricom line
4.Opt Back In?
To opt back in, dial *234# from your Safaricom line

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which transactions are not eligible for the promotion?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Transactions below KShs. 100 are not eligible.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which are the listed eight (8) regions?
What are the prizes to be won?
How will I collect my prize?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Weekly and Grand Prize winners will be required to be physically present to receive their prizes. For the daily winnings, the surprise gift will be credited to winner’s M-PESA.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will I know I have won?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Weekly and Grand Prize winners will only be contacted through the official Safaricom Number 0722 000000. Daily winners will be contacted via SMS, whose header will be ‘LIPA NA M-PESA’.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: If a transaction is reversed, will the entries be reversed as well?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. The entries will be reversed.any other services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: In case of any query, who will customer contact?
What is the out of bundle management?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a service which ensures you aren’t billed from your airtime when browsing. Data charges will only be on your data bundles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is an M-Shwari Lock Savings Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a savings account that allows M-Shwari customers to save for a defined purpose and for a specified amount of time. The funds saved on the M-Shwari lock –Savings will be kept in the account until the maturity date; this maturity date is determined by the customer upon opening the account and ranges between one and six months. The M-Shwari lock Savings Account is ideal for customers looking for higher interest rates and those wishing to keep money away safely for one to six months.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the requirements for opening an M-Shwari Lock Savings Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: One must be an M-Shwari customer in order to access this service. To join M-Shwari, Go to your M-PESA menu, select “My account” and “update menu” then go to your M-PESA menu, select M-Shwari, click on activate account and accept terms and conditions.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the benefits of opening an M-Shwari Lock saving account?
What are the charges due to this account?
What interest will be payable on the M-Shwari Lock Savings?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: M-Shwari lock interest is earned daily and paid out monthly.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will the interest be calculated?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Interest is earned daily but paid out on the maturity date selected by the customer. However, if a customer wishes to access the locked funds before maturity, the interest rate shall be M-Shwari interest rate

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will I know that my M-Shwari Lock Savings Account has matured?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Upon maturity, a notification will be sent to the you via SMS informing you of the amount saved and the interest earned.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I access my M-Shwari Lock Savings deposits upon maturity?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Upon maturity, the M-Shwari Lockbox savings and the interest earned shall be moved to your M-Shwari account.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the minimum amount needed to open an M-Shwari Lock Savings Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The minimum target amount is ksh500.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the maximum amount that can be saved in an M-Shwari Lock Savings Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: There is no maximum target amount. However, M-PESA daily limits apply.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times can I save into my M-Shwari Lock Savings Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can save as many times as possible

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the minimum amount I can top up on my M-Shwari Lock Savings Account?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The minimum top up amount is Kshs1(one)

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the minimum deposit amount that one needs to have in their Lock Savings to earn the Lock Savings interest?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The minimum amount is Kshs 1000.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the minimum time period for an M-Shwari Lock Savings Account:
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The minimum period is one (1) month.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the maximum time period for an M-Shwari Lock Savings Account:
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The maximum period is six (6) months.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can a customer withdraw their funds before maturity date?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. However, a customer will receive the requested money after 48hours. Additionally, accessing the funds will result in the M-Shwari interest rates rather than the lock savings interest rates

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How to open a Lock Savings Account:
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Go to M-PESA menu, Select Loans and Savings, Select M-Shwari, Open Lock Savings. Use the same process on MySafaricom App.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Google play payment via M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a service offered to M-PESA registered customers with Android phones to be able to purchase applications and digital goods from the Google play store using M-PESA as a payment option.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who can use the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This service is only offered to users in Kenya with registered M-PESA accounts, Google accounts and android devices.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be required to pair my mobile number to Google?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, the first time you buy an app or game on Google playstore you will be required to register a payment profile and your mobile number will be automatically linked. The next time you buy an app or game, you’ll be able to use M-PESA payments option to pay for it.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I add M-PESA as a payment method?
How will the customer make an M-PESA payment??
Can I purchase an app directly without setting up a payment option on Google playstore?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: When purchasing an app for the 1sttime you will be forced to setup a payment option. Select M-PESA Xpress billing, register your details and proceed to purchase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I setup M-PESA payments on Google play if I already setup credit/debit card payments?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If you have a credit or debit card linked to your Google account, you can still setup M-PESA as a payment method.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I register more than one Google account to my number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you can setup more one account to your mobile number.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I use a dual SIM handset on Google Play and pay with M-PESA?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you need to ensure the Safaricom line is on SIM one and disable the twin SIM functionality.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I change my mobile number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: When you change your mobile number, the system will auto sync the new mobile number.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I have clicked the buy icon but I cannot receive the M-PESA payment push?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If you can receive M-PESA PIN push, kindly update your SIM card by dialing *234*1*6#

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What will be the response time to get the app after the M-PESA payment has been done?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The app will be downloaded immediately.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I view my order history?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
To view your Google Play order history log on the website below
https://play.google.com/store/account

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I do not receive the app purchased?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If app refuses to install after a successful payment, kindly contact Google help centerhttps://support.google.com/googleplay

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can the customer purchase using M-PESA when roaming?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes if you activated roaming services and we have a roaming agreement in that country.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Once I purchase an app can I get a refund?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will be able to refund an app or game within 48 hours after purchase

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I refund an app/game purchased?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Note: You can only return an app or game for a refund once. If you buy it again you will not be able to get a refund. If a refund is issued you will lose access to the item.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where can I get general help on Google service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: https://support.google.com/googleplay

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who are the SWIFT Squad?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: They are your go to team on anything data and they will guide you on how to get the best out of the internet while getting the most out of your data bundles. Watch out over the next couple of days for much, much more from them!

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Snappy Sasha
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: She’s the Samurai of Snapchat, Slayer of selfies and fixer of filters. She’s got all the 411 on how to keep on Snapping and Slaying while saving on that precious data.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Whatsapp Willy
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: He’s the undefeated champ of messaging, the ultimate group admin. If it involves Whatsapp, he’s your guy. Keep a look out for him to know how to be a knockout on Whatsapp while showing your priceless bundles who’s boss.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Insta Irene
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Instant queen of pics and undisputed top don of tags. She’s your best friend for all information on how to keep it real and on fleek on Instagram while keeping your spend low.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Facebook Freddy
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: He’s always in the know and keeps it real 24/7. He’s your go to guy on how to keep on streaming and checking out Status posts while guarding your bundles like a real guru.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Trending Tweet Timo
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: He’ll make anything trend and is the king of hashtags. Need to know how to keep up with trends while keeping your data bundles? Timo is your go to guy.Connect with the SWIFT Squad all day every day and see what they’re up to and what they have in store for you.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Merchant and Paybill Interoperability Service
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a joint project between Safaricom, Airtel and Telkom that will allow all customers to pay for goods and services at any merchant outlet regardless of which network they operate on - Safaricom, Airtel and Telkom T-Kash merchants. • This means for example, that a Safaricom M-PESA customer will be able to pay for goods and services from an Airtel money or Telkom T-Kash merchant.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the benefits of this service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The service will offer the following benefits to customers and merchants.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is the target of this service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This service targets Airtel and Telkom mobile money customers paying Safaricom Lipa na M-PESA merchants i.e., Paybill organizations and Business Till merchants.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the minimum and maximum amounts that an M-PESA merchant can receive from Airtel or Telcom customers?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The maximum amount payable to an M-PESA merchant is KSh. 150,000.00, the minimum amount payable to an M-PESA merchant is KSh 1.00

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will the Airtel/ Telkom customer make payment to Lipa Na M-PESA Buy Goods merchant?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
This service will enable Telcom and Airtel customers to make payments to Lipa Na M-PESA Buy Goods till.
Airtel customers will have to be registered on Airtel Money and follow the steps below.
Telkom customers will have to be registered on Telkom T-Kash and follow the steps below.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will the Airtel/ Telcom customers make payments to Lipa Na M-PESA Paybill organization?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
This service will enable Telcom and Airtel customers to make payments to Lipa Na M-PESA Paybill organizations.
Airtel customers will have to be registered on Airtel Money and follow the steps below.
Telkom customers will have to be registered on Telkom T-Kash and follow the steps below.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the charges for Airtel/ Telcom customers making payments to Lipa Na M-PESA Buy Goods merchants?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the charges for Airtel/ Telcom customers making payments to Lipa Na M-PESA Paybill organizations?
Will the notification to Lipa na M-PESA merchants change, after transactions from customers on other networks?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, Lipa na M-PESA merchants will receive the same message from M-PESA indicating the transaction ID, details of the customer, amount transacted, transaction cost, and the new merchant balance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will customers from Airtel and Telkom request a reversal in case of an erroneous transaction?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will call their respective mobile network provider to request a reversal. e.g., An Airtel customer paying at a Safaricom Lipa na M-PESA will call Airtel to request a reversal. Airtel/Telkom will credit respective customers’ accounts.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will customers from other networks be able to forward reversal requests to 456?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, customers will not forward the transaction messages to 456 to request a reversal. This service is reserved for Safaricom M-PESA customers only. The Airtel and Telcom customer will only request for the reversal by calling their respective mobile network providers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who do customers contact for support?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers shall contact their respective service providers directly for all support functions i.e., Airtel customer care and Telcom customer care.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Hakikisha Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a service for all M-PESA customers that will enable them to confirm the name of the person they are transferring money to on M-PESA before completing the transaction. It also allows you to confirm the name of the agent when withdrawing money from your MPESA account * The service will also be available for Pay Bill (payment) and deposits for M-PESA agents.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I opt into the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will automatically be opted into the service which is free. However, normal M-PESA charges apply as per the M-PESA tariff.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I have to do a Menu Update to access the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will automatically be opted into the service and do not need to do a menu update.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will I be able to access the service outside Kenya?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will be able to use the service wherever you can roam. However, you will only be able to cash in / cash out your M-PESA balance at M-PESA Agent outlets in Kenya.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: After a SIM swap, will my M-PESA line pick the service I had on a previous line?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The system will automatically enable the service as soon as you reactivate your M-PESA account using your current M-PESA PIN.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I opt out of the service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Dial *234# to opt out. You will still be able to transact on M-PESA without confirming the name.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can other people confirm my name before sending money?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Please note that other customers will also not be able to confirm your name when you opt out of the service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will M-PESA transactions cancel if I press the cancel/dismiss/close on my phone?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To stop any wrong transaction, send any letter or number within 25 seconds. Pressing cancel, dismiss or close will NOT stop the transaction.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Will the service work on all handsets?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The service will work on most handsets, however there may be a few phones that may have challenges accepting the service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the Ali Express 10% Cash Back Promotion?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Ali Express is an online retail platform based in China that has integrated with M-PESA to allow customers in Kenya to shop and pay with M-PESA on the app and on the website.The promotion therefore seeks to reward customers who shop on the Ali Express app or on the website and pay with M-PESA on Friday 11th November 2019.The promo will be driven as a countdown throughout the week calling out the massive discounts on the Ali Express app and website. However the 10% cashback will only be available on Monday 11th November 2019

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the objective of the promotion?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To reward customers who shop on Ali Express app or on the website and pay with M-PESA payment option.To create awareness of M-pesa as an option for payment on AliExpress.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where will the promotion be communicated?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The media channels that will run the promotion will be digital. The promotion will be run as a weekend long countdown to 11th November 2019..

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where will the promotion be communicated?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The media channels that will run the promotion will be digital.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When will the promotion run?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The promotion will run on 11th November 2019 from 00:00:00 – 23:59:59

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the promotion mechanics?
Who is eligible for the promotion?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This incentive is open to all registered M-PESA customers who shop on the Ali Express app or on the Ali Express website and pay with M-PESA for a minimum of Ksh. 50.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can a customer shop on the AliExpress website to participate in the promotion?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: YES. The Ali Express website now has the M-PESA payment option therefore payments done on the AliExpress website will qualify for the 10% cashback.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are there any exemptions?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Shopping amounts below Ksh. 50 will not qualify for promotion.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where can customers download the AliExpress app from?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: On Google Play store for android phone users and Apple Store for IOS users.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which business owner can access Boost ya Biashara?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All business owners using M-PESA Business will be able to access the service.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can a Pochi la Biashara business owner access Boost ya Biashara?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, the facility is for business owners with a stand-alone store, with active stores on M-PESA Business till.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will business owners activate Boost ya Biashara?
Which transactions can the business owner complete using Boost ya Biashara?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Boost ya Biashara can be used only for the following transactions done on the till through the nominated number:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will a business owner use Boost ya Biashara?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
After successful opt-in, the business owner will be given a limit that can be accessed when making any of the above transactions when they lack sufficient funds in their till to complete a transaction.
Merchants will receive a notification prompt informing them of the amount they are about to overdraw and action to accept or reject. If they select accept, then the transaction will be completed.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times can merchants access their Boost ya Biashara?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Business owners can use it as many times as needed if they are within the allocated Boost ya Biashara limit.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the duration of Boost ya Biashara?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Boost ya Biashara is payable within 30 days. However, business owners are encouraged to clear their Boost ya Biashara facility as soon as they can.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the transaction limits for Boost ya Biashara?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Minimum of KSh 1 up to the merchant’s assigned Boost ya Biashara limit. hour.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will a business owner repay their Boost ya Biashara?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Deductions towards repayment will be made automatically from collections made to the till every 30 minutes of the hour.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What will happen if there are no funds in the till for repayment?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The system will keep retrying to recover the payment until funds are available in the till.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can a business owner query their Boost ya Biashara details?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The Business owner can query their outstanding balance, Mini statement, and due date via USSD.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if a business owner does not repay the Boost ya Biashara?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: A Business owner that does not pay their Boost ya Biashara on time will not be able to access the service, their limit will be reduced and eventually, they will be listed on CRB after 91 days of their due date.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can a business owner opt out of Boost ya Biashara?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. The business owner can use the below steps on USSD to opt out, after settling any outstanding balances they may owe.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can a customer choose to pay their Boost ya Biashara early?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, Boost ya Biashara is paid back as soon as funds are collected in their business till, business owners should encourage payments via Lipa na M-PESA till to settle their Boost ya Biashara facilities in a suitable time.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What can I do to grow my Boost ya Biashara limit?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Encourage your customers to pay via Lipa na M-PESA, the more you transact the more you grow your limit.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: For support business owners can contact:
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: For further inquiries, support, and training requests, you may reach us on:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: About the Service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This Service aims at giving our Prepay, PostPay & Hybrid Subscribers, the opportunity to choose a personalized combination of offers ranging from data, sms, voice and Talktime.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How to Purchase the Offer?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: To purchase the offers, Dial *444# every day and select your preferred option. You can access and purchase the available personalized offer every day.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Why does my offer keep changing?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Tunukiwa is personalized and dynamic. Every day of the week, each customer will get new and different offers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I earn Bonga points when I use Tunukiwa?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. Tunukiwa earns you Bonga points whenever you purchase a Tunukiwa offer.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Does Tunukiwa contribute to Stori-Ibambe target achievement?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Tunukiwa is a discounted offer and will not be considered in the achievement of the Stori Ibambe target

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Offers Validity
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The validity of the offer is specified at the time of purchase. Validities will range from less than 24 hours, 24hours, 48 hours and 7 days.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How Frequent can I purchase?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You can purchase multiple options at any given time throughout the day.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Offer Balance
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The offer balance cannot be transferred. To check your offer balance, dial *444# then select Balance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Why do some offers keep disappearing?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Tunukiwa is personalized and dynamic. Every day the system refreshes new offers for customers. Some offers are also time bound and once the offer period lapses, the offers automatically expire and can no longer be served to customers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I buy an offer with Bonga points ?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes, you can buy Tunukiwa offers with any of the following payment options; Airtime (including Okoa balance), M-PESA and Bonga points.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is a“Bonga-Only”Offers?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: These are offers which can only be purchased using Bonga Points. These offers will be presented to the customer from time to time and will be have the Bonga conversion rate in the offer name at the time of purchase.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What will be the conversion rate for buying Tunukiwa Offers with Bonga?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Conversation rate when buying normal Tunukiwa offers using Bonga points will be the normal rate of 1 point = 30 cents. This will be displayed to the customer at the time of purchase..

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Do I earn Bonga points when I Buy an Offer with Bonga Points?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. Since “Buy with Bonga” is a Bonga redemption process, it will not earn Bonga points for the customer. However purchase of offers via Airtime or M-PESA will earns you Bonga points whenever you purchase a Tunukiwa offer using the two payment options.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Available Options
More Information
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: For more information, please visit theSafaricom website

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Recreate Old SIM?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is an innovative solution that allows customer to recreate their old inactive lines (that have not been recycled) with the old SIM Card at the comfort of their homes.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I recreate my old (inactive) line?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. Simply dial *100*2# from an active number > SIM Card issues > Recreate Old SIM or *456#>What’s New> Recreate Old SIM.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens if I do not have the old serial number?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You will need to visit a Safaricom Retail Shop near you for assistance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I recreate a golden number or a company line?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Recreation will only be done for normal lines. Golden number & company line recreation requests will be done at any Safaricom Retail Shop.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I recreate my number while roaming?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: If one is roaming, you kindly send your request via email with a scanned copy of ID/passport toThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.orThis email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.for assistance.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I recreate an Idle line?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No. You will be required to purchase a new line at any Safaricom Retail Shop or M-PESA agent near you.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How many times can the dialing number perform a recreation?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: One can only be able to recreate 2 inactive lines within 72 hours.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Are M-PESA agents able to recreate lines?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Yes. Same rules apply where they can only recreate 2 MSISDNS within 72 hours.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I recreated my line successfully but I’m unable to make or receive calls?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Kindly top up your line to continue enjoying Safaricom products and services.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Who is eligible?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Prepay, PostPay and Hybrid customers can purchase data roaming bundles.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I purchase the Data Roaming Bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers can purchase the data roaming bundles via USSD

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: When can I purchase the Data Roaming bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers can purchase the data roaming bundles before leaving for their destination or upon arrival.Bundles will only be used or consumed when roaming on Safaricom partner networks.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the available mode of payment?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers can purchase the data roaming bundles using M-PESA or Airtime

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I have a PostPay number, can I use M-PESA as a mode of payment?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Post pay customers can use M-PESA payment option when buying data roaming bundles for another prepay number. Purchases for self on PostPay will only be done via airtime.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is the validity of the data roaming bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will enjoy validity based on the data bundles purchased

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I extend expiry of my data roaming bundles?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All bundles will have rollover but rollover will be conditional as below:

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I transfer my data roaming bundle resources?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customer can be able to buy for another number, but will not be able to transfer available data roaming bundle resources.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I check my data roaming bundle balance?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will check their data roaming bundle balance via *100*50# or *200*50#

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I bought the data roaming bundles by mistake, can I reverse the transaction?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Subscribers will not be able to reverse their data roaming bundle purchases.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: I bought the heavy data roaming bundles and did not exhaust while away, can I use the reminder once back in the country?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Customers will only be able to enjoy the data roaming bundles while browsing using the partners network, they will be required to purchase data bundles when within the country via *544# to enjoy affordable browsing.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is 4G+?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: 4G+, another first from Safaricom, is a 4G enhancement that allows you to enjoy faster internet. 4G+ allows customers to browse at double the 4G speeds.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Where can a customer enjoy 4G+?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: The new technology builds on our growing footprint of 4G network, which has been activated at over 1,100 sites across Kenya. We have already activated 100 4G+ sites in Nairobi, Mombasa and Kisumu as well as parts of Kisii, Naivasha, Kitui, Machakos, Kakamega and Kericho with more areas scheduled to be switched on in coming months.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How much does it cost?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: There is no extra cost for accessing 4G+. Provided you are in a 4G+ enabled area with a capable device, you can access 4G+ without making any change. You will notice increased data speeds when using 4G+.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How fast is it?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: 4G+ offers peak download speeds of 150Mbps. Typical speeds depend on the location and the users connected at that time. In any case, 4G+ offers double the speed you would get on 4G.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How will 4G+ benefit me?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: Bonga points earned will be on the bundle purchased

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I Sambaza my minutes once purchased?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: 4G+ will make managing your life on the go a breeze. Think: faster uploads, downloads and web browsing, better video viewing experiences or accessing more apps.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What is Safaricom Jitambulishe service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: This is a service that allows Safaricom Prepaid, Individual Post-pay and Hybrid customers to enroll their voice and use it to access services such as get PUK, Unlock M-PESA account, Get M-PESA PIN/ start key and replace their line conveniently by calling 100/234/200.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What do I need to enroll for Safaricom Jitambulishe service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You need to be a registered Safaricom customer with an active Safaricom line.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I enroll my voice in both English and Kiswahili?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, you can only enroll your voice in either English or Kiswahili

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What benefits do i get if I enroll my voice as a customers
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: You enjoy security and the convenience of accessing Safaricom products and services by your self. You can access services such as PUK, M-PESA PIN, Sim Replacement, Unlock your M-PESA account, Bar/Unbar your line and much more using your voice as your password.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the services I can access as self service once I enroll my voice for Jitambulishe service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
Once enrolled, you can access the following services when you call  100/234
Level1
Customer enrolled by calling 100/234/200
Level2
Enrolled as above and vetted further by Safaricom

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Am I charged to enrol and use Safaricom Jitambulishe service?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No, there are no charges, the service is free of charge and is open to Prepaid, Postpaid individual and hybrid customers.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How can I stop using Jitambulishe service but still continue using my Safaricom line?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
You can dial 100/234 and follow the prompts to delete your voice
1.Dial 100/234 and select “language”
2.Select the “Jitambulishe Service” option
3.Select the option to “delete your voice password”
4.Repeat your passphrase, ”At safaricom my voice is my password” or “Safaricom sauti yangu ndio kitambulisho changu” to delete your voice password.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Can I re-enrol my voice again if I already enrolled my voice?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
You can re-enrol your voice again by simply calling 100/234 and follow the prompts to update your voice
1.Dial 100/234 and select “language”
2.Select the “Jitambulishe Service” option
3.Select option to “update your voice password”
4.Repeat your passphrase, ”At safaricom my voice is my password” or “Safaricom sauti yangu ndio kitambulisho changu” to update your voice password.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What happens when I change the ownership of my line, will someone else use my voice?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: When you change the ownership of your line, the existing voice will be deleted and the new owner of the line will need to enrol their voice for Jitambulishe service.

The Revamped safaricom Data bundles now offer you more data bundles at no extra cost. Additionally, we are creating a worry free experience on selected bundles by ensuring that customers can continue accessing WhatsApp for free when their data bundles run out.
Customers will also have the option of using their Bonga Points to purchase their preferred bundle.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Unified USSD *456#
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: No need to worry about which short code you need to dial in order to access our different services. It is now as simple as 456…In line with our customer first strategy, we have come up with a single short code that will help our customers access all the services with a single dial. The unified short code *456# is a service transformation aiming to give Safaricom customers a transformed and enhanced experience while accessing the different services via short codes.As our products developed over the years, so has been the different ways to access these services. One of the platforms through which the customers access our products is via short codes (*100#, *200#,*544#, *444#, *188#, *811#, *234# among others). In order to simplify all these products, we are consolidating them to enable the customer access at once via *456#. This will provide convenience and simplicity to our customer.

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: How do I access all the Safaricom services?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer: All you need to do is dial *456#Ok to access all Safaricom services under the consolidated single short code.The service allows our customers to use one short code to access Safaricom services and products whether one is on Prepaid or Postpaid.With the new short code, the customers will experience a whole new experience on Safaricom services

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: Which services can I access under *456#?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
• Get Deals– Access all Safaricom deals and promotions in a single view*456*0#
• BUY– Purchase different Safaricom services (Data, SMS, Minutes, Skiza among others)*456*1#
• Okoa/Sambaza– Request for Okoa Jahazi or Share/Sambaza your friends and family*456*2#
• Bonga–Get rewarded with fabulous offers for using your line, redeem and share.*456*3#
• Balances/Top Up– Access all your balances and carry out top up*456*4#
• M-PESA– Unlock your M-PESA, check tariff, search paybill numbers and more.*456*5#
• Safaricom Home- Sign up for Safaricom Home Fibre and manage your account here.*456*6#
• Activate–Activate Data manager, Blaze and other services.*456*7#
• Get PUK– PIN locked? No worry. Option 8 helps you get the PUK. Help a friend to get the PUK through your line.*456*8#
• Stop– Stop active subscriptions that keeps on renewing (Data, SMS, Games and more)*456*9#
• Find- Locate the nearest Safaricom shop or care desk, find other interesting services here.*456*10#

https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.question: What are the benefits of the unified short code?
https://www.safaricom.co.ke/media-center.answer:
•  The unified short code provides convenience and simplicity to the customer as they do not have to memorize the different short codes in the market, it is lean and provides shorter steps while accessing the services.
• Better self-service options as customers can now carry out a variety of Do It Yourself (DIY) options such as,Buyingdifferent Safaricom services from a single button, getting thePUK,Unlocking M-PESA,Stoppingany charged services among others
• Improve on accessibility to service lines as more customers will now be able to use the short codes to resolve issues on their lines without having to call.
• High availability of a robust menu for the customer’s access anytime.
